story:
The Rock Camp Experience

This has been a wonderful, empowering experience for my daughter. - Bernadette, parent.
I wish rock camp was every day. - Gabi, camper.
QCRC really ROCKS! ... She has been excited every day by what she has learned and done. - April, parent.

Queen City Rock Camp is an experience like no other. For one week each summer, girls between the ages of 8 and 18 learn to play an instrument, form bands together, write their own original song, and perform it for a real audience at the camp showcase. There are also music related hands-on workshops, tutorials, and roundtable discussions about topics relevant to the campers' lives. The things each camper learns about collaboration and positive self-image will stay with her for life… whether or not she ever touches a musical instrument again. 

Needs and Rewards

Thank you for doing this camp and allowing scholarships, because without it I couldn't have come here this week. - Juliana, camper.

We believe every girl should have the chance to attend camp, and we don't turn anyone away for lack of funds. At our first session in 2014, 70% of campers attended QCRC for free. Thanks to our generous business sponsors and individual donors, we were able to cover the cost of our facility and showcase venue, insurance, T-shirt printing, food, and volunteer background checks. We are so grateful to everyone who made last year a success. 

I have had the best time here. - Natalie, camper.

This year, with an enrollment capacity of fifty campers, each of those expenses has grown. We've also added an advertising budget in order to reach more families. We are currently working on QCRC's 501(c)3 nonprofit certification, but in the meantime we are ineligible for most major grants and corporate sponsorships. Individual donations remain the bedrock of our operations. 

I didn’t really want to perform in front of people, but I did anyway and it was so much fun. … I’m not as timid in front of people. I can talk to new people more easily than I did before, and I can approach people more easily. - Nora, camper.

Along with our benefit show on May 30th at Patton Alley Pub in downtown Springfield, this campaign will cover a large portion of our expenses and allow us to host camp without relying on tuition money. This is a Flex Funding campaign, so even if we don't reach our goal of covering tuition for twelve campers, your contribution will still allow girls to attend rock camp for free. In exchange, we have some pretty sweet rock camp merch to send you, including buttons, T-shirts, and the very last hand printed QCRC schwag bags from the 2014 session! 

If You Can't Contribute Now

There are lots of ways to help QCRC. Check out this blog post to find out how to give your support--with or without money. Donations are also accepted year round through our website, and you can even pledge your musical instruments and equipment for camp week!

If you want to give something even more valuable than cash, consider donating your time as a camp volunteer. No musical experience is required. Sign up today!

story:
We are AU Worship, a Worship Arts program from Asbury University in Wilmore, KY.  We are a group of students passionate about Jesus and worshiping him with our lives and voices. This is our second year to send a worship team to Texas but our program has maxed out its travel budget. We're seeking financial support to cover the costs of our van, trailer, and start-up expenses, in the hopes that the rest of our funds can be used to support a trip to Malawi, Africa this summer.

If you can't support us financially, please support us with your prayers. Our greatest desire is to see God move in the churches we go to, and our prayer is that logistics can be put on the back-burner and ministry can be our focus.

However you can help, thanks for taking time to learn about our ministry.

story:
When It All Falls Down         
    #ElysiaMarieMusic #E.P. #ILoveYouMore

Get to Know my Project:

I am launching my first solo E.P. titled “When it All Falls Down.”  

In life, there are hard lessons, trials and seasons that everyone at some point in their lives wrestle with, some longer than others, and some at different stages or levels.  Loss - Grief - Disappointment - Doubt - The feeling of failure or the empty feeling of loneliness that each of these bring. 

In this project, I really focus on writing into those places that hit a deep place of raw emotion and reflection. I write and sing about the need of hope, searching for revival, and in the midst of these attacks to the heart; finding it.   

Finding a beautiful peace beyond our comprehension, strength, sense of empowerment, direction, and victory in the midst.

My prayer in faith is that the songs reflect a style of writing that connects with many different people from many walks of life and many different things, and meet them right where they are at.


              

E.P. Details:

·  5 Original Songs

· I have included the video of the song “When It All Falls Down.” 

Where Will the Money Go:

11% of what I make will go to:

Emily Hepker and Family- To help with Medical Expenses

· Dedication of the song “I Love You More” will go to Emily Hepker.  A cancer surivor and warrior. She has been battling for 7- 8 years, a future full Victor to Stage 4 non-Hodgkin Lymphoma. She is a world changing inspiration. She impacts hundreds of people daily, just by being the amazing warrior that she is.

· http://espn.go.com/college-sports/softball/stor...

City Church Chicago Ministries, LLC.

· This church supports many ministries throughout not only Chicago; but has a national and global impact as well. 

Such as: 

>World Vision- Global Aid and Relief

>A21 Campaign to abolish Human Trafficking

>Vision Rescue- Breaking Poverty in India

>Compassion International- Sponsoring under privileged children around the world

> City Care Homeless Ministry

The money that you donate, is going to amazing and faithful places, and will come back to each of you and bless you abundantly in more ways than you will expect.

The rest of donations will be placed accordingly: 

-Studio Musicians

-Studio Time 

-Engineer

-Production/ Producing

-Editing and Mixing

-Mastering *

-CD Printing and Duplication, packaging

-Album Artwork & Photography

-Video Work 

-Merchandise and gifts 

-AMTC Sponsorship- Actors, Models and Talent for Christ- Summer 2016 Songwriting Showcase- Orlando, FL. 

-Copyright Management

-ASCAP Publication

-Website Production and sustainability

-IndiGoGo & Transaction fees

         -If I meet the full campaign goal (4%)

         - If I do not meet the full campaign goal (9%) 

But I am believing with all of my heart that I will meet the goal that God has placed on my heart to go for!

If I exceed the goal:  

-Ensure all costs are covered for E.P.

-Music Video for I Love You More 

-Marketing and promotion

-Save for a tour and for additional album planning


         


Why I need You:

I need you to be in agreement in faith that every need will be met. I know that if you took time to watch this campaign video, that God has sent you here to agree with me for what I am believing for and donate to this cause.    

I am believing that by the support of you all; I can get back in the studio to finish this project and take it to completion as well as help others in the process.

Matthew 18:19: "Again, truly I tell you, that if two of you on earth agree about anything they ask for, it shall be done for them by my father in heaven"

How you can help:

Donate to this project: 

Go to the Perks section on the right to review what incentives and gifts you will receive from donating. 

If you do not wish to receive any gifts, you are also able to opt out, and still send a donation. 

If you choose to remain anonymous, there is an option to do that as well.

If you wish to send a donation by mail, email me at elysiamusic@gmail.com and I will send you the address to use.

What You Get:

Many perks and incentives!  Review the Perks section to the right of the screen.  (Review the summary details for each)
Perk 1 applies to all tiers of giving. It is a promotion that will run for the entirety of the campaign.

Promotion Details:    (Listed in Perk 1)

Step 1: If you share and re post this IndiGoGo page on Facebook or Instagram or email 3 family members, co-workers or friends with the link to this page. 

___________________

I will include a free digital download of "I Love You More." upon E.P. completion, and place you in a drawing to win a custom designed jewelry piece from the I Love You More collection. 

Meet Anastasia Nikki Forova:

Producer, Cowriter, dear friend and mentor

             

She does it all.  Russian American Singer-Songwriter, Producer and Composer. Her heart is in this project just as much as mine is. I am so thankful for her.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign on your social media and email it to others. (Perk 1)
  • You can share this page by clicking share under the video at the top.
  • PRAY!!!!!  He is able to do more than we can think of dream of or imagine! Please pray and lets see God move. He is the only reason I've gotten this far with this project; and it will be him who sees that it gets completed. 

In Jesus Name. 

Thank You Everyone for your time, prayers and love.
Love,
Elysia Marie 
elysiamusic@gmail.com


Thank you! <3

story:
Watch our Campaign video or read :D thanks for your time:


We are You Only Live Once from Los Angeles, CA. We have been a band for 5 years and played many shows in LA and Orange County area. You have probably seen our front women on shows like American Idol, Americas Got Talent and The X Factor. We now have an opportunity to record a full length album with Joel piper, Mikey Doling, and Dave Fortman as the producers - as well as tour the record. But we are an unsigned band MEANING we have no funding and we have to pay for everything on our own. This is difficult to do when we all work minimum wage jobs. We also really wanted to involve everyone that has been supporting us and anyone that would like to become a part of what we're doing. Together we can create some amazing things. The album is going to cost about 20,000. We Will want to tour the record so we are going to need transportation. Our final cost will be 40,000 to make this happen. We have all decided that this is going to be our last shot to try to make this happen as we need to go to college and get started on our lives. So we are asking our friends & fans to help us chase our dreams ONE LAST TIME and help us get a great album recorded for you and come to a city near you. We really need your support to make this happen and would really appreciate any help. We have awesome gifts for everyone that donates. Anything will help and, again, we really appreciate your time for reading this. Thank You.

Indiegogo video:


We are also selling Merch on our Band Camp: http://youonlyliveonce.bandcamp.com/merch

story:
Soul Ipsum Spring Tour 2015 

On Monday the 30th of March, I parked my 1993 Subaru Legacy wagon outside the Goodwill Bins in deep SE Portland, OR. It was gone when I stepped outside. It happened a week and change before I was to head out on a two week get away of traveling back home to see family via playing music on the road. 

This tour was planned at the very beginning of the year, giving me an opportunity to represent the gear hounds, noise merchants, and conceptual artists of the Pac NW.

  • Highlights include shows w/ artists that have influenced me and others. 
  • Also giving me a chance to link up with old / far flung friends.
  • The ultimate goal is to build a musical dialogue and build bridges via touring.

This trip is taking me back to my hometown of Tucson, Az via Southern California. With the opportunities to link up and play shows that came through in Los Angeles, it no longer made sense for me to cancel my tour...despite the fact that a drifter is likely using my beloved Subaru as a toilet at the moment, or its being chopped up for parts. 

IF LA Is So Important, Why Don't I Just Fly There

For those of you that don't know, I use a stupid amount of musical gear. But ya, I think I will anyways because driving all that way round trip doesn't make sense, even though it means canceling a few shows along the way:

  • Flying to LA then taking a bus to Arizona, and then a train back should amount to much less than it would be if I had my car, and it sounds fun. 
  • The opportunity to play music for friends and family in my hometown is invaluable, sharing my musical culture with a homegrown experimental scene.  
  • I'm honestly not expecting the tour to be financed by this platform, but the funds raised will still impact my decision to go forth. At the very least these contributions will cover a luggage fee or two. 
  • Any funds raised will also contribute to creating one-of-a-kind merchandise, like screen printed cassettes and patches. 

Why I'm Doing This

Soul Ipsum usually enables me to connect with people as a producer by busting out dusty hardware thats older than me. It just so turns out my trusty mmT8 fried out before my trip, so this is an all new learning opportunity:

  • I can only lug one suitcase full of gear and will be creating software synths. Grants me the opportunity to create site specific sets and learn new programs. 
  • Although my day job is truly soul-sucking, the fact that I can get away for ten days makes this chance really special to represent our DIY online community.
  • Having this ambition was enough to self-fund, the only reason for crowd sourcing is because of the unfortunate circumstance of my car's theft impacting my travel and the sad fact my insurance will not cover a dime. 

Planes, Trains & Greyhounds

The original plan was for this trip to be a litmus test for the health of my Suby. Now, it's become a real testament to all of you for keeping me positive and encouraging me to still go out there and represent and for the airlines not to mess up my gear. 

I hope that this blazes the trail for any of you to follow in these footsteps. Especially given how much I am consistently humbled by our artistic community. 

Don't Be A Stranger

Even if you can't contribute, or you think that I'm conceited or idiotic for trying this:

  • Send me an uplifting text / call while I'm out there. Odds are I'm lonely.          520-429-7616 / soulipsumagency@gmail.com / @fanta_seer on IG
  • Tell your friends about the tour! I really enjoy meeting people off those connex.

story:
You've all probably heard this before.

But, being in a band isn't easy. EVERYTHING costs money. Artwork, gear, pressing cd's, merchandise, recording, traveling, traveling to record, eating on the road, and missed work hours all start to add up, and that's just the beginning.

It's all worth it to us, knowing that we have some truly incredible things we can share with everyone to show for it.

With that being said, we need YOUR help.                                                                             This spring we are going to be filming a music video to accompany the release of our new record Castle in the Clouds (Woohoo!). In order to do this we are trying to raise $700 to cover the costs of filming.        

We are asking for your help to make this idea a reality! We know we can get it done: if we could convince just 13% of the people who have liked our Facebook page to contribute just $1, we would be there. If you have ever wanted to show support to your local music scene but were unsure how to get involved, or if you have ever been to a show of ours or listened to our music, or even if you have no clue who we are and feel generous, PLEASE consider contributing to this landmark in our musical endeavors. Now's your chance!!

If you cannot or would rather not donate to the cause, we ask that you simply pass it on (you can pass it on if you donate as well, if you're just that much of a philanthropist/patron of the arts). If everyone who sees this message either contributes or keeps the campaign alive by sharing, we will be guaranteed to meet our goal! Just take a second and write a message to a facebook friend who enjoys heavy music (e.g. "hey Denise, we haven't spoken since jr. high. let's change that! we used to be such good friends. pls donate to this band?? *insert link*)

Bam. Just like that, old friendships you thought could not be salvaged with people whose company you'd rather not share have been repaired and they are irrevocably placed back in your life. 

Or try hitting it off with that cute girl that for some reason accepted your friend request but with whom you've never been able to start an organic conversation (e.g. "hey Sheryl, I like you. and i like this band. so if the transitive property of equality means anything, you'll like them too, and we can finally date!).

When's the last time you sent a heartfelt letter to your grandma? Let today be the day you break radio silence with her for the first time since you ran the lawnmower over her garden of Tulips and favorite cat (also named Tulip). Write her a touching note recalling golden memories you shared in the past, and urging her to donate some money to a metal band. She's guaranteed to be thrilled.

 If after filming expenses there is any leftover money, every cent we get will go back into band costs such as (Merch, CD's, Shows etc...) which helps us out so, so much.

Even if you can't donate, just listening to our music means the world,
The support is truly amazing.

Thank you, thank you THANK YOU for helping us get this far!
 We are not slowing down.

  <3 The Wise Man's Fear
story_txt:
You've all probably heard this before.But, being in a band isn't easy.
EVERYTHING costs money. Artwork, gear, pressing cd's, merchandise, recording, traveling, traveling to record, eating on the road, and missed work hours all start to add up, and that's just the beginning.It's all worth it to us, knowing that we have some truly incredible things we can share with everyone to show for it.With that being said, we need YOUR help.                                                                             This spring we are going to be filming a music video to accompany the release of our new record Castle in the Clouds (Woohoo!). In order to do this we are trying to raise $700 to cover the costs of filming.        
We are asking for your help to make this idea a reality! We know we can get it done: if we could convince just 13% of the people who have liked our Facebook page to contribute just $1, we would be there. If you have ever wanted to show support to your local music scene but were unsure how to get involved, or if you have ever been to a show of ours or listened to our music, or even if you have no clue who we are and feel generous, PLEASE consider contributing to this landmark in our musical endeavors. Now's your chance!!If you cannot or would rather not donate to the cause, we ask that you simply pass it on (you can pass it on if you donate as well, if you're just that much of a philanthropist/patron of the arts). If everyone who sees this message either contributes or keeps the campaign alive by sharing, we will be guaranteed to meet our goal! Just take a second and write a message to a facebook friend who enjoys heavy music (e.g. "hey Denise, we haven't spoken since jr. high. let's change that! we used to be such good friends. pls donate to this band?? *insert link*)Bam. Just like that, old friendships you thought could not be salvaged with people whose company you'd rather not share have been repaired and they are irrevocably placed back in your life. Or try hitting it off with that cute girl that for some reason accepted your friend request but with whom you've never been able to start an organic conversation (e.g. "hey Sheryl, I like you. and i like this band. so if the transitive property of equality means anything, you'll like them too, and we can finally date!).When's the last time you sent a heartfelt letter to your grandma? Let today be the day you break radio silence with her for the first time since you ran the lawnmower over her garden of Tulips and favorite cat (also named Tulip). Write her a touching note recalling golden memories you shared in the past, and urging her to donate some money to a metal band. She's guaranteed to be thrilled. If after filming expenses there is any leftover money, every cent we get will go back into band costs such as (Merch, CD's, Shows etc...) which helps us out so, so much.
Even if you can't donate, just listening to our music means the world,The support is truly amazing.

Thank you, thank you THANK YOU for helping us get this far!  We are not slowing down.
  <3 The Wise Man's Fear

story:
UPDATE 5/13: Released the first single from my EP!


------------------------------------------------------------------

About My Project

I'm Kato, a Funk Volume producer. Once again, I got some of my rapper friends together and created a cool ass EP for my fans - Pathomania (meaning, 'moral insanity').

Some features on the album: Trinidad Jame$, Dizzy Wright, Jarren Benton, Devin The Dude, ScottyATL, Sy Ari Da Kid, Royce Rizzy and many more!


I've spent a lot of hours putting this project together and making it sound like a cohesive album. It's definitely some of my best music to date, and I can't wait to share it with ya'll on JUNE 5! If I can reach my goal of $3000, I can deliver signed hard copies directly to you and take this show on the road!

All the music is already mixed and mastered, but now I need a little help from my fans to take it one step further and make it a piece of (autographed) art that you can hold in your hands, and also hopefully get a chance to meet some of ya'll in person.

What I Need & What You Get

When it's all said and done, I'll need about $2000 for the first initial round of printing, and some extra gear and hardware to take this show on the road!

CD's: $1000
Posters + Design: $500
Packaging + Shipping: $500
Additional gear for touring: $1000

In return, all of you will get the music, most of you will get an autographed copy, and a very few select will get to actually kick it with me 1-on-1 when I hit your city on tour in the Fall.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not, word of mouth is probably the most valuable way of helping me with this project. Share this page with your friends and family! #PathomaniaEP

story:
A little about Litha Symphony Orchestra

Through invigorating interpretations from the symphonic literature, as well as arrangements of works realized anew, the Litha Symphony Orchestra is committed to bringing the excitement and energy of summer to its audiences and musicians alike. We are New York's Premier Summer Ensemble.

Litha Symphony Orchestra was founded in the spring of 2012 by a group of musicians who wanted to create a summer outlet for performing classical orchestral music in the New York Metropolitan area during the summer, which is traditionally an off-season for most musicians and orchestras in the area. As the full orchestra performs mostly during the summer, the orchestra chose to use the name Litha after the goddess of the summer solstice as the signature name for the organization. Maestro Eric Hayslett has been at the helm of the orchestra since the premier season, where he has led the orchestra through three full seasons featuring a variety of orchestral hits.

Help us finance Litha Symphony Orchestra!

It takes a whole lot of hard work, conviction and determination to keep the Litha Symphony Orchestra going each year. However, this is not enough! LSO needs a budget of $5,500 this year to cover all expenses. Expenses are categorized as follows: Artist fees, Artist travel and Accommodation expenses, Venue rentals, Promotion and Advertising expenses, Technical expenses (sound, lighting, etc.), and much more.

Please, use the share button and help us spread the word to get the financial support we need.

Become a Friend of the Orchestra!

By becoming a friend of the orchestra, you are becoming a member of New York’s Premier Summer Ensemble. Our orchestra friends are our biggest and most treasured motivation. The 2015 Litha Symphony Orchestra invites you to becoming a member of its family, and in doing so playing an integral role in the success and continuation of the orchestra.

Yours, 

John Langwell

PRESIDENT

Litha Symphony Orchestra

story:
We've been working on this CD for nearly six years, and we've finally finished recording all 19 tracks!

Rose in the Heather is a seven member band that plays Celtic and American folk music, both old and modern.  We sing and play fiddle, guitars, keyboard, bass, bodhran, whistle, and assorted rhythm pieces.    We've been playing together for more than 17 years, having fun and performing for lots of different audiences.     Some of those audiences include:

  • The Portland Highland Games
  • Portland State University Burns Suppers (six years)
  • Seattle Folklife (three years)
  • Champoeg State Park  - Concerts in the Park - (five years)
  • Newberg Music Center - Acoustic Music Series
  • More weddings, parties, and festivals than we can count

You can listen on YouTube to some music we recorded several years ago:   https://www.youtube.com/user/MSam47/videos?sort=dd&view=0&shelf_id=0


We recorded our first CD, By Any Other Name, in 1999 with a baby napping in a swing while we played.  That baby and his little brother now haul hundreds of pounds of equipment at gigs as our roadies.  We recorded the second CD, Mountain Road, in 2004, and as soon as we finished we had a long list of songs that we wanted to put on the "next cd."  

Eleven years later, we had a REALLY long list of great songs, and we finally got back into the studio to get them recorded.   We now have nineteen tracks recorded, mixed, and ready to put onto CDs, and a pretty long list of friends, family and fans who have been (kindly) nagging us to hurry up and finish.  

After all this time, and after spending more than $1,500 with our recording engineer and his studio, it would be a shame to burn CDs on our home computer and label them with a Sharpie, but all of our money has been spent on recording, mixing and mastering.  

You can help us to finally make this project a reality!  If you contribute to our campaign, you will be putting these tracks onto a professionally produced CD, and putting that CD into a lovely, full color folder.  You could also choose some fun perks like t-shirts, posters, one of our limited edition first CDs, or even a custom recorded track or a live performance (if you live near Portland, or want to fly us to your exotic locale for a house concert.)


Why do we need $3,400 ?

It's surprisingly expensive to print CDs, and here's where the money goes :

  • $1,500 in royalties to songwriters (or their estates), including Dave Carter, Jay Ungar, Stan Rogers, Mark Knopfler, Dan Fogelberg, Gaelic Storm, and Christy Moore.  This will cover 1000 physical copies of the CD and 500 electronic downloads.  They wrote some awesome songs, and they deserve to be paid.
  • $1,443 to print 1000 discs in full color packaging. (This includes shrink wrap, bar code, 70 electronic download cards, and registration for music sales through CD Baby, iTunes, Amazon, GooglePlay and Gracenote MusicID.  Being available on iTunes and Amazon also makes us eligible to submit our CD to Pandora for possible inclusion.)  This also includes a pretty good deal on some full color posters that are handy for publicity.
  • $126 for shipping all our CDs to Portland.
  • Most projects would also need to budget a large chunk of money to pay for CD graphic design, but our band member, Lisa Colgrove, is a wonderful professional graphic artist in her day job and has volunteered to do the design.
  • A little more ($250) to cover the cost of mailing the perks, and to cover the 5% charge by Indiegogo to manage the campaign.


What's on these 19 tracks?

Lisa Colgrove sings 6 songs:  I Go Like the Raven, Fare Thee Well Northumberland, Grand Prairie TX Homesick Blues, Star of the County Down, Wayfaring Stranger, Back Home in Derry

John Parrott sings 4 songs: Gentle Arms of Eden, Texas Underground, Johnny Tar, Field Behind the Plow

Mark Nielsen sings Sutter's Mill

There are 8 instrumental sets.  These are mostly jigs and reels, and it includes the beautiful waltz Ashokan Farewell as a fiddle duet with our good friend Diane Lovejoy.



What will you get? (besides the knowledge that you're supporting independent folk music...)

Depending on the amount that you pledge, you could get...

  • The satisfaction of being in the first group of people to get an electronic download or a physical copy of this CD!   There will be 19 tracks!  That's nearly two CDs worth of music on one disc, and if you like this sort of music, you'll really enjoy it.

  • A black t-shirt with a green Rose in the Heather logo (designed by Lisa), pictures in the Gallery
  • A RitH Happy Birthday recording, personalized for anyone you specify
  • A copy of one of our previous CDs - Mountain Road or By Any Other Name
  • A signed poster, pictures in the Gallery
  • A performance by Otter Crossing (Mike & Julie's small group)
  • A performance by the full Rose in the Heather band
  • Your choice (up to four minutes) of a song or instrumental that didn't make it onto this CD.  We'll practice, then go into the studio and record (almost) ANYTHING you want . You could choose any kind of music - a song that you've heard us play live (like Walk in the Irish Rain, Ride On, or The Scotsman); a song that we may have played when we didn't think anyone was listening (like The Boxer, Elvis's Can't Help Falling in Love, some theme music from the Lord of the Rings movies, or The Devil Went Down to Georgia); a Dave Carter song, an Eagles song, or a folk song.  If your goal is comedy, you could request a rap song, or rock (like Sweet Child of Mine, Dream On, or old Alice Cooper songs).  We welcome humerous or serious suggestions in the comments section, even if you don't have the cash to select this specific perk.


If this project isn't fully funded...

We'll order fewer CDs, pay royalties for fewer copies, and earn money by playing some more gigs.  It will still be made, but it will take longer and not be nearly as much fun as this campaign.  


If we reach beyond our goal...

We'll go right back into the studio and record lots more music!  Dave Carter's When I Go, Stan Rogers' White Squall, Andy Stewart's Lover's Heart...  We might even have another CD finished during this decade!


Other Ways You Can Help

You might not have the cash to contribute right now, but there are other ways that you can help us out!

  • Write comments or suggestions for songs that we should record.
  • Share our gig, CD and fund raising information with friends and family who might enjoy it.
  • Indiegogo has some really convenient options for sharing, too.  Use social media if you are so inclined.

story:
Our Mission:

      We have given everything we have to get ready for our newest album; working countless hours to perfect our works, and we couldn't have made anything possible without the love and support from you lovely people. With your help, together we can actualize our musical vision even faster and more clearly than we could have ever imagined to achieve on our own. 

      Now is the time. We have found the studio we had only previously dreamed about in La La Land Studios in Louisville; with the remarkably talented Kevin Ratterman, who lately is credited with works from My Morning Jacket, Punch Brothers, Sufjan Stevens, Flaming Lips, Ben Solee, Wax Fang, Twin Limb, and countless other exceptionally gifted musicians.

      We have already begun tracking, and we know in our hearts that this is going to be the greatest thing we have ever done, and want to give you guys a chance to join in the process!    

Let's Talk About Perks!

       We are excited to announce some way we can reward you for your kindness in helping us raise our goal:  be the first to hear our new single, reserve your copy of our newest album, have it delivered to your door before it's release, get exclusive merchandise, and even purchase instruments used by the band to record their first record "Wakes in Shadow Lies By Fire".

Where do the funds go?

  • $6000 Will record the full album.
  • $5000 Pays for the necessary publicist and other promotional strategies,                      including application fees, features, and other vital tactics for distribution.
  • $4000 Presses the album to CD and  special vinyl!
  • $2500 Will manufacture our new merchandise.
  • $1000 For Travel and Lodging during Louisville Recording Sessions. (12 Days)
  • $500   Gets a little extra studio time for a special gift only for those who donate
  • For those of you who really enjoy a little math with your reading: Our total expense for the list above is $19,000. We are only asking to raise $15,000 through this campaign. We will take care of the rest.  
Our Vision, Passion, and Roots:
      We are extremely proud of where we come from. All of the Red Ember musicians stem from the same area. When we first got together to make music, we noticed a uniquely level plane we artistically find together, and Kentucky has a whole lot to do with it. Our inspirational home is rooted in the past and reaching for the brightest future; proudly creating bluegrass just as easily as powerhouse original bands from genres that couldn't be more diverse. This is not something that is easily nor frequently portrayed in contemporary pop culture, on the contrary, Kentucky can easily become the target or criticism and stereotypes, while the truth is so beautifully layered in our hearts and minds. We want to represent ourselves and our home in the proudest light, while showing through our music a universal vein in all people. We will put our true selves into this album, with an honest frame grounded in our upbringing, and solidified in the driving passions from Red Ember's members as a whole. In the end, we will show that even if your geographic home is different from ours, there is a undeniable universality between you and us, To keep ourselves close to our inspiration, all artist involved in this album, and all we do visually and beyond will be local artists. Made in Kentucky, by Kentuckians, for the world.
       Every dollar buys inches of critical tape time needed to give every recorded moment the special attention it deserves; in a studio where the sky is not the limit, but the expectation. So please, check out our pre-sale, give what you can, share with those who love music, and let's create some magic together! We love you, and look forward to showing you what we have made!

story:
Making music together for two and half years, culminating experiences, growing, both as individuals, and as a unit, we've accumulated momentum towards success. We've grown a local, and out-of-town fanbase, played over a hundred shows, and even a few festivals, all without an album of sincerely refined, recorded music. We are ready to move into the next chapter, and are going to ask our fans to help us! 

Recording our album at Sugar Hill Studios, has been the start of our next chapter, but to give to ya'll, what you've inspired us to do, we ask for the help to fund the mixing, and mastering process. We've payed for all that we can muster at the moment, and have unanimously decided that our fans are the ones that we can rely on for help!

story:
Hi!

We are Rebirth::Collective, an Antwerp (BE) based large jazz ensemble formed in 2010. In March 2016 we will release our second album ‘Raincheck’ wich will feature the famous Dutch guitar-player Jesse Van Ruller. This album will celebrate Billy Strayhorns 100th birthday.

Our previous release received very positive reactions of both public and press. But for our upcoming album, we want to take it a little bit further. We expanded from 8 to 9, and we invited Jesse Van Ruller as a guest soloist. 

To make this ambitious project become reality, we have started a crowdfunding campaign of wich you can be part. Together with you we can realize this album! When we reach our goal of 4000EUR, we will be able to fund the recording, mixing, mastering and the musicians. 

In exchange for your donations, you can receive a number of perks in return. 

Thank you so much for your support!!!

About the project:

2015 will mark the year that one of the most original composers in jazz, Billy Strayhorn, would have celebrated his 100th birthday! Strayhorn helped produce a body of work that has no rival in originality and range—from unforgettable tunes and jazz melodies to orchestral suites and soundtracks. He was the sole composer of many classic compositions, including the Ellington theme song, “Take The ‘A’ Train,” and the widely recorded “Lush Life.” Rebirth::Collective will pay homage to this jazz giant with the help from an international icon of modern jazz guitar, Jesse Van Ruller.  Rebirth::Collective consists out of 6 horns and a rhythm section and therefore functions as a small bigband. These talented musicians form a powerful 9-piece ensemble and let the music evolve from sensitive ballads to burning uptempo music with deep grooving moments and exciting battles between the musicians. 50’s bop swings again, but this time with a contemporary drive.

They team up with Jesse van Ruller to do a fresh and innovating take on the Strayhorn songbook. Van Ruller won the Thelonious Monk Competition in Washington in 1995. The jury, consisting of Pat Metheny, John Scofield, Jim Hall, Pat Martino and Mark Whitfield, was of the opinion that van Ruller is one of the most promising talents of his time. Since then he has been recognized worldwide as one of the leading voices on his instrument and has performed with numerous renowned musicians and ensembles amongst which are George Duke, Joe Lovano, Pat Metheny, Peter Erskine, Mike Stern, Tom Harrell, Philip Catherine, Toots Thielemans, the Roy Hargrove Quintet, Christian McBride, Seamus Blake, Metropole Orchestra, Asko Ensemble, WDR Big Band, Birmingham Symphony Orchestra and the Berliner Philharmoniker.

The album tracks are:

01-Isfahan

02-UMMG

03-Chelsea Bridge

04-Raincheck

05-Johnny Come Lately

06-Lush Life

07-Satin Doll

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cWTRV0Uc-XA

http://www.rebirthcollective.com

https://www.facebook.com/rebirthcollective

Impact - How your contribution helps:

 As you might have heard, these are not easy times for musicians financially speaking. With your help we are hoping to raise € 4,000 to pay for the cost of:

° Studio recording & mixing

° Mastering

° Physical production 

° Artwork and design: original artwork by Rinus Van de Velde

° Publicity

° Fees for IndieGogo and credit card companies: 10-15%

What you get in return:

Something for everyone, from tickets to the concert, to advanced copies of the new CD or a private concert! Check out the list of perks below!

You can also make a money transfer on my bank account 
(instead of using the paypal option) 

In which case, here is the info you'll be needing:

Roadhouse VZW

bankaccount: BE06 0017 6727 4322


Make sure to mention your delivery address (so I can send you your order) 
and your email so I can keep you posted on the process! 

Perks:

10EUR

Free gift: Thank you thank you thank you for contributing! Your support means the world to us!

20EUR

Physical copy of the new album Raincheck with Jesse Van Ruller mailed to you before the official release date! On this album, Rebirth::Collective will pay homage to this jazz giant with the help from an international icon of modern jazz guitar, Jesse Van Ruller.

35EUR: 

Physical copy of the new album Raincheck with Jesse Van Ruller + the selftitled  debut album mailed to you before the official release date! Debut album Rebirth::Collective mailed to you. Rebirth::Collective has been Artist in ‘Residence’ in one of Belgium´s most legendary jazz clubs, Café Hopper in Antwerp, for a few years now. The band has been building its repertoire and its audience and they released their self-titled debut album in April 2013 on SoulFactory Records.

Physical copies of both records will be send to you! Double Pleasure!

35EUR:

Physical copy of the new album Raincheck with Jesse Van Ruller + 1 single ticket for a Jazzlab Series concert of choice! Enjoy together with our new music the rich live jazz scene in Flanders!  www.jazzlabseries.be (6x available!)

40EUR:

Physical copy of the new album Raincheck with Jesse Van Ruller + 2 records of choice from the catalogue of W.E.R.F. Records. http://www.dewerfrecords.be/nl/catalogus (5x available)

50EUR

1 Duoticket for the releasetour of Rebirth::Collective plus the new cd ‘Raincheck’. You'll drink with us, be merry and happy and experience an amazing concert!

50EUR

Physical copy of the new album Raincheck with Jesse Van Ruller + 1 duoticket for a Jazzlab Series concert of choice! Enjoy together with our new music the rich live jazz scene in Flanders! www.jazzlabseries.be (10x available!)

50EUR

Sheet music: 50EUR for a song. Choose 1 or more songs and get the official sheet music, which contains all the arrangements for all instruments. Each song will be send to you in pdf-format and will be ±100 pages in length. Dive deep into Strayhorns music and help Rebirth::Collective at the same time!

60EUR

New CD ‘Raincheck’ + Ticket voucher Gent Jazz worth 50EUR (to be used for ticket purchase Gent Jazz Festival 2016) 2x available http://www.gentjazz.com/

60EUR

New CD ‘Raincheck’ + Ticket voucher Jazz Middelheim worth 50EUR (to be used for ticket purchase Jazz Middelheim 2016) 3x available http://www.jazzmiddelheim.be/

85EUR

New CD ‘Raincheck’ + Ticket voucher Gent Jazz worth 75EUR (to be used for ticket purchase Gent Jazz Festival 2016) 2x available http://www.gentjazz.com/

85EUR

New CD ‘Raincheck’ + Ticket voucher Jazz Middelheim worth 75EUR (to be used for ticket purchase Jazz Middelheim Festival 2016) 2x available http://www.jazzmiddelheim.be/

100EUR

Physical copy of the new album Raincheck with Jesse Van Ruller + 3 duotickets for a Jazzlab Series concert of choice! Enjoy together with our new music the rich live jazz scene in Flanders! www.jazzlabseries.be (2x available!)

110EUR

New CD ‘Raincheck’ + Ticket voucher Gent Jazz worth 100EUR (to be used for ticket purchase Gent Jazz Festival 2016) 1x available http://www.gentjazz.com/

3000EUR

Concert on your business event. Want to have the real experience at your doorstep? Book Rebirth::Collective for your events and make an immense contribution to this crowdfunding project! A Live 75’ performance. Forever VIP treatment at any of our shows and our deepest, eternal gratitude!

Other Ways You Can Be a Part of the Project:

If you don't have funds to contribute but would still like to help please tell all of your friends that this is going down and just spread the word all over the place! Let others know about the Indiegogo campaign or come to the live performance. There are many ways to be a part of the community surrounding this project, and every voice makes a difference!

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone!

We are The Wherewithals from Portland, OR!

A few years ago we took a hiatus but the time has come that we re-group and have been working effortlessly to bring you new content. 

Since we have the music covered, we really want to start promoting our name again. And that can get pretty difficult when one of us owns a business and the rest of work just enough to pay our bills. 

Thats where you come in! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise around 700 dollars to help print, press and create DIY shirts, CDs, Tapes and any other merch we can that will help get our name out there, again. 

We have our own screen printing setup but the screens, ink and t-shirts can be expensive. 
We have our own cd sleeves ready to be screen printed once we finish our EP in August but yet again the screens and ink can be expensive. 

PERKS! You donate you receive.

$5.00 -  You will receive our love and 5 dollar coupon for any merch we create!


$15.00 - You will receive our love and one of the first printings of our upcoming shirts!


$25.00 - You will receive our love, a first printing of our upcoming shirt and an exclusive print of the design 


$50.00 - WOAH, so much love, a first printing of our upcoming shirt, exclusive print, an early release copy of our EP (when completed) and a hand drawn surprise!


$100.00 SERIOUSLY WOAH!, everything in the $50.00 perk plus you will be added to the guest list for any shows we play for a year, if the show is free we will buy you a drink of your choice at that show! 

$200.00+ - NO WAY! IF YOU DO THIS PERK, YOU WILL GET EVERYTHING IN THE $100.00 PERK AND ANY MERCH WE CREATE YOU WILL RECEIVE IT FOR FREE THE WHOLE YEAR. Includes t-shirts, CDs, buttons, stickers, posters, etc...

What your contributions go too

Ink, screens, t-shirts, CDs and time. 

The Impact

  • This means so much to us, to help spread the word about our band.
  • Misconception that musicians make money, we don't. We work really hard to create things that you enjoy.
  • We are doing everything DIY, we are about to lock ourselves in our home studio for 3 days to record our own album, we are screen printing our own shirts and CDs. 
  • We are all artists in many ways and you will be helping us create stuff for you to enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

  • If we do not make our goal, it will be difficult to create. We are still going to create but being able to do it on our budget is very hard.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word, come say hi to us at a show, share our music to your friends!

story:
A little bit of background

In December 2012, BRL secured the facility it now calls home: BRLHQ. Walking distance from the Grand Lake Theater in Oakland's upcoming Grand Avenue area, our space sat vacant for 10 years due to its need for costly repairs. Fortunately, our BRL youth and staff saw the potential of the space and took on the challenge to transform it.  Shortly after securing the space, we reached out to principal architect Mallory Scott Cusenbery to work with BRL’s Academy youth to create a vision for our space through ‘participatory design’. Mallory held envisioning sessions with our BRL youth and staff to gather authentic input for design and functionality. The results were breathtaking. 


Our vision for a greater impact

For the past 27 months, BRL staff, board members, volunteers and supporters have worked tirelessly to renovate our space which is now 75% complete. Once complete, BRLHQ will serve as a hub for innovation, collaboration and service to further develop and expand our mission to help youth heal, grow and lead.  We are asking for your support to complete BRLHQ and help us achieve our goal.

BRLHQ will feature a youth art gallery, training center, recoding studio, media lab and offices. In addition to serving as day-to-day headquarters for BRL, BRLHQ will provide an invaluable resource for local groups to host meetings and small events to advance collaboration and achieve shared goals. Our completed facility will help us further our impact and convene youth and affiliated groups to lead and transform our communities. 


What we need

BRLHQ has come a long way from our humble beginnings. We have managed to accomplish a lot through the generous support of our community.  Thank you!  But we still have a ways to go. We need to raise a minimum of $15,000 by August 31st in order to complete necessary renovations and upgrades to our space.  Beyond our minimum goal, we need additional support to cover furniture and equipment costs.  With your help and commitment, we will have BRLHQ fully operational by October 1, 2015.  BRL is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, and all donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law.



Invest in innovation

In 2004, BRL pioneered one of the country’s first Hip Hop Therapy programs to utilize the process of creating positive hip hop music to engage at-promise youth in meaningful mental health services.  The success of BRL’s Hip Hop Therapy model is widely documented and has served youth in Oakland, San Francisco, and the South Bronx, New York. We equip marginalized youth with:

  • tools for success in school and in life
  • positive coping strategies
  • conflict resolution skills
  • avenues for creative expression
  • supportive networks

Since 2004, BRL has blossomed into an emerging social enterprise. As the foremost provider of Hip Hop Therapy, BRL is well positioned to meet the growing demand from systems of care for innovative programs that reduce stigma and promote wellness and recovery, especially among boys and young men of color. BRLHQ will serve as a center for this work.  We need your support to make this vital work happen.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we're Brandon and Rob, otherwise known as the alternative rock band Chair Warriors. We've been performing around Montreal, Quebec since 2009 and have had our share of triumphs and challenges along the way. We signed with an indie record label and released our first EP A Thousand Words in 2012, but things went to shit didn't really work out. Fast forward three years and after lots of tireless struggling we're finally free from the shackles of our contract and ready to record again!

We're hoping this new EP will be the fresh start that we've been waiting for. We've come a long way over the past few years and it has shown in our music. Earlier this year we released a one-off single called "Liars" (highlighting some of our experiences with the music industry so far), but we have six new songs written, demoed and ready to be recorded properly!

We need you to help us get this project off the ground and fuel our new found independence. We are truly more inspired and motivated than ever to share our music with the world and we want you to become part of our journey from this point forward. After all, we've already come this far. Why not join us the rest of the way?

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $5,000 to cover the cost of recording, mixing and mastering six songs. Our studio time is already reserved with Kevin Jardine of Uplift Recording Studio, so there's no turning back now. Leftover funds will be put towards pressing CDs and creating cool and stylish merch like t-shirts, sweaters and caps.

Our perks will include physical copies of the new EP, both signed and unsigned, as well as copies of our first EP A Thousand Words, merch products and a few more surprises.

It would be great to reach our goal, but if we don't...Rob will have to sell his car. This bad boy is getting done one way or another ;)


The Impact

We have a plan and nothing is going to get in our way. After finishing this EP we will:

1) Make it available across all major digital platforms (iTunes, Amazon, all major streaming services, etc.) through TuneCore. There will also be a small 500-1000 copy run of physical CDs made to be sold at shows (and to be sent out as perks of course).

2) Focus heavily on promoting the album online via social media, using behind-the-scenes content and music videos to push songs and expand the target audience.

3) Tour Eastern Canada (primarily Quebec and Ontario) in collaboration with our good friends at Landmark Events and Sincop8ed Noize Inc.

4) Produce videos for several songs with Front To Back Video Productions, which has already worked with us on the “Liars” video. The founder is Chris Kells, bassist of Century Media band The Agonist.

5) Secure support on stations historically supportive of the band: university radio stations CJLO (Concordia) and CKUT (McGill) plus commercial station CHOM 97.7, specifically the highly-respected "Montreal Rocks" show with Jay Walker, and 99.9 The Buzz “Homebrew” (covering Burlington, Plattsburgh, Montreal).

Sounds great, right? Well we need YOU to help us take the first step in this long-term project of ours.

Risks & Challenges

We won't pretend like this is going to be easy. We paid for our first EP out of pocket only to watch it rot away on the shelves without a proper marketing plan or support of any kind from our record label. But this time will be different.

With your help to cover the costs of recording, we'll be able to invest more time, money and energy into promoting our EP and making sure it's heard by as many people as possible. Using our ever-growing social media presence (by the way, follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram) to generate buzz for the release and hype for the subsequent music videos, we'll be able to reach more fans than ever. We now have what it takes to give our music a fighting chance to survive out there in the wasteland that is our contemporary musical landscape. 

The Bottom Line: We've faced enough adversity to know the level of dedication it takes to bring a quality piece of music into the world. The recording studio is a high pressure environment, but we've been there, done that, and now we just want to do it our way; bigger and better with more tools in our arsenal.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's ok! You can help just by spreading the word.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to make some noise about our campaign. Share it  with your friends and follow our band across all our social media platforms.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ChairWarriors

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/ChairWarriorsband

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ChairWarriors

Instagram: https://instagram.com/chairwarriors/

Bandcamp: https://chairwarriors.bandcamp.com/releases

Reverbnation: https://www.reverbnation.com/chairwarriors

Also, don't be shy to give us comments or feedback. We love hearing from people!

We've been performing around Montreal, Quebec since 2009 and have had our share of triumphs and challenges along the way. We signed with an indie record label and released our first EP A Thousand Words in 2012, but things went to shit didn't really work out. Fast forward three years and after lots of tireless struggling we're finally free from the shackles of our contract and ready to record again!
We're hoping this new EP will be the fresh start that we've been waiting for. We've come a long way over the past few years and it has shown in our music. Earlier this year we released a one-off single called "Liars" (highlighting some of our experiences with the music industry so far), but we have six new songs written, demoed and ready to be recorded properly!We need you to help us get this project off the ground and fuel our new found independence. We are truly more inspired and motivated than ever to share our music with the world and we want you to become part of our journey from this point forward. After all, we've already come this far. Why not join us the rest of the way? 
  What We Need & What You Get We're asking for $5,000 to cover the cost of recording, mixing and mastering six songs. Our studio time is already reserved with Kevin Jardine of Uplift Recording Studio, so there's no turning back now. Leftover funds will be put towards pressing CDs and creating cool and stylish merch like t-shirts, sweaters and caps.
Our perks will include physical copies of the new EP, both signed and unsigned, as well as copies of our first EP A Thousand Words, merch products and a few more surprises.
It would be great to reach our goal, but if we don't...Rob will have to sell his car. This bad boy is getting done one way or another ;)

  The Impact
We have a plan and nothing is going to get in our way. After finishing this EP we will:
1) Make it available across all major digital platforms (iTunes, Amazon, all major streaming services, etc.) through TuneCore. There will also be a small 500-1000 copy run of physical CDs made to be sold at shows (and to be sent out as perks of course).
2) Focus heavily on promoting the album online via social media, using behind-the-scenes content and music videos to push songs and expand the target audience.
3) Tour Eastern Canada (primarily Quebec and Ontario) in collaboration with our good friends at Landmark Events and Sincop8ed Noize Inc.
4) Produce videos for several songs with Front To Back Video Productions, which has already worked with us on the “Liars” video. The founder is Chris Kells, bassist of Century Media band The Agonist.
5) Secure support on stations historically supportive of the band: university radio stations CJLO (Concordia) and CKUT (McGill) plus commercial station CHOM 97.7, specifically the highly-respected "Montreal Rocks" show with Jay Walker, and 99.9 The Buzz “Homebrew” (covering Burlington, Plattsburgh, Montreal).Sounds great, right? Well we need YOU to help us take the first step in this long-term project of ours.
  Risks & Challenges
We won't pretend like this is going to be easy. We paid for our first EP out of pocket only to watch it rot away on the shelves without a proper marketing plan or support of any kind from our record label. But this time will be different.
With your help to cover the costs of recording, we'll be able to invest more time, money and energy into promoting our EP and making sure it's heard by as many people as possible. Using our ever-growing social media presence (by the way, follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram) to generate buzz for the release and hype for the subsequent music videos, we'll be able to reach more fans than ever. We now have what it takes to give our music a fighting chance to survive out 
there in the wasteland that is our contemporary musical landscape. 
The Bottom Line: We've faced enough adversity to know the level of dedication it takes to bring a quality piece of music into the world. The recording studio is a high pressure environment, but we've been there, done that, and now we just want to do it our way; bigger and better with more tools in our arsenal. 

  Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute? That's ok! You can help just by spreading the word.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to make some noise about our campaign. Share it  with your friends and follow our band across all our social media platforms.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ChairWarriors
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/ChairWarriorsband
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ChairWarriors
Instagram: https://instagram.com/chairwarriors/
Bandcamp: https://chairwarriors.bandcamp.com/releases
Reverbnation: https://www.reverbnation.com/chairwarriors
Also, don't be shy to give us comments or feedback. We love hearing from people!

story:
ROBERT IRVING III-GENERATIONS

Robert Irving III-Generations, led by 9-year Miles Davis collaborator, formed less than one-year ago, has rapidly grown in popularity and demand throughout the Chicagoland area.  Having recently completed a two-month run at the legendary Andy's Jazz Club, the group will, with your help, record this debut CD for pre-release on the band's one-year anniversary at their scheduled performance at the Chicago Jazz Festival on September 6, 2015 at 3:30pm at Millennium Park on the Von Freeman Pavilion Stage.

PERSONNEL

The bandleader, Robert Irving III pianist/composer/producer, is a recipient of
the 2015 Chicago Music Awards Lifetime Achievement Award, and a nine year collaborator with Miles Davis and his wife, Paris France native, alto saxophonist, Laurence d’Estival Irving is group Co-Creator and Conceptualist/Producer. The band includes Rajiv Halim-soprano sax/flute, Irvin Pierce-tenor sax, Scott Hesse-guitar, acoustic & electric bass/vocals, Emma Dayhuff and Charles Heath-drums, 

BIO

Robert Irving III served as Miles Davis pianist/keyboardist and who proved to be his longest collaborator as a composer, arranger, producer and musical director (from 1979 to 1988).  As a musician and as producer of five Grammy Award nominated projects, Irving worked closely with numerous music greats including, Carlos Santana, Wayne Shorter, Ramsey Lewis, Billy Joel, Terri Lyne Carrington, Diane Reeves, David Murray, Doudou N'Diaye Rose, Regina Carter, Gary Bartz, Pharaoh Sanders, John Scofield, Kirk Whalum, Sting, Grover Washington Jr, Nona Hendricks, George Duke, Patrice Rushen, Nancy Wilson, Branford Marsalis, Roy Ayers, R. Kelly and also served as musical director for  the group, Sister Sledge, for trumpeter, Donald Bryd  and for The Last Poets (40th Anniversary in Paris, France),

Check Out This Short Documentary Video To Learn More About The Group!


STORY

Just as a young Miles Davis was mentored by Dizzy Gillespie, he similarly mentored a 26-year old burgeoning young Robert Irving III in 1979. In-kind, Irving has been nurturing the next generation of young jazz players since 2007 as a professional mentor with the Jazz Institute of Chicago.  Last May 2014, near the time of Irving's annual Miles Davis birthday tribute (normally performed with alums from the Davis band), Irving's wife, Laurence d'Estival Irving insisted that it was time for Robert to give his mentees the same performance experiences that he received from Miles by making them an actual part of his band.  Laurence d'Estival Irving's brilliant Idea soon evolved into a creative concept that gave birth to the group, "Generations" as a vehicle to both, showcase these extraordinary young musicians, while creating a workshop for the development of expansive new music composed and arranged by Robert Irving III for the group.

Irving says,  "This campaign is important to me because, despite my long resume in the music business, most of my work has been behind the scenes in support of other artists and as a youth mentor. As a result, I have only two official releases under my own name in a 30-year career.  In this sense, this project is my "coming out" of sorts... I'm a late-bloomer.  Generations is a dream band for me because of the high level of musicianship of the players and their willingness to explore beyond traditional or even contemporary forms of jazz expressionism. My compositions often defy categorization and can be challenging to execute, but these young musicians work exceptionally hard to interpret my ideas while also bringing their own unique personal artistic spirit to the music.” The personnel of Generations is more than qualified to do this:


BAND MEMBERS

Irving’s spouse, Group Co-Creator/Conceptualist/Producer and alto saxophonist, Laurence d'Estival Irving, who is a native of Paris, has performed with George Clinton, Fred Wesley and Pee Wee Ellis, Archie Shepp, David Murray and Roy Ayers. Drummer, Charles “Rick” Heath IV (Irving’s cousin) is  currently a member of the Ramsey Lewis Group and performs with Dee Dee Bridgewater, Philip Bailey (EW&F) and played the Oprah Winfrey musical production of The Color Purple. Generations bassist, Emma Dayhuff is a recording engineer and producer of recordings for the Chicago Symphony Orchestra in addition to being in high demand as a bassist across genres from jazz to country music. Guitarist, Scott Hesse is a music educator who has performed internationally with Dee Alexander’s Evolution Ensemble, Stafford James String Ensemble and the Victor Garcia Organ Group. The two Jazz Institute mentees of Robert Irving III, tenor saxophonist, Irvin Pierce (age 20) and soprano saxophonist/flutist, Rajiv Halim (age 24) are both leading their own groups as highly recognized ‘young jazz lions’ who have been compared to John Coltrane and Cannonball Adderley respectively.


PRESS

Chicago Tribune columnist Howard Reich recently wrote, "You can perceive the beauty and ingenuity of Irving's music whenever he places his fingertips on the keyboard, his voicing and chord constructions as surprising as they are expressive... this (Generations) could be his next major vehicle, if so, it could be a fascinating one..." 
"...Irving's spouse moved from Paris to Chicago in July and soon became a key figure in the band..."


IN TUNE


Irving offers, “Another thing that makes this group unique is our tuning system. We tune at the frequency of 432 hertz rather than the western standard of 440 hz. There is extensive research that shows that 432 hz promotes a sense of well-being and balance, whereas 440 hz. creates tension. Living in a world that is so much on edge, anything that can possibly make even a small difference in reducing stress, should be embraced and explored.” Fans of Robert Irving III Generations invariably comment that they were ‘blessed’ by the sound and harmonic expansiveness of the band. For this reason the band’s performance experience has been dubbed as “jazz church.”

This earlier incarnation of the band features Bob Davis on guitar.  The tune,
"Every Today" is inspired by the idea that, in some, African cultures, there is
no words or concept for yesterday or tomorrow... all is one continuous today!


STATUS AND PLAN

Robert Irving III Generations debut CD project is in the pre-production stage with 14-original compositions in development.  The band plans to pre-release the debut CD to  Indiegogo supporters and to local audiences during their Chicago Jazz Festival Performance at Millennium Park on September 6, 2015 at 3:30 pm on the Von Freeman Pavilion Stage.  An national release will follow two months later (as a three month pre-marketing lead time is needed for national releases). In order to fulfill this release schedule the group will need to begin recording immediately at the end date of this Indiegogo campaign.


Win/Win Proposal

  • PROJECT OVERVIEW: The record industry we once knew no longer exists, and so alternative funding platforms fill the void allowing artists to continue creating works of value and to deliver that value creation to the world.  85% of the minimum campaign goal is earmarked for hard cost of: studio production include tracking, editing, mixing and mastering; toward video archiving, photography, graphic design and art concepts for the CD and supporting website and towards manufacturing (CD's and Download cards... Vinyl pressing is on our wish list if we exceed the goals), marketing (media campaign managed by a publicist, advertising etc.) and promotion (radio campaign conducted by professional  radio promoter) and subsequent promotional performance support.  Additional hard costs include fulfillment expenses (cost of mailing product to:  print media, radio, Indiegogo supporters, and the fulfillment of perks that require travel and/or other associated costs). Only 15% is to be allocated for musician fees and only if we reach the minimum goal.  
  • A PEEK AT PERKS: Everyone who gives receives something.  We are excited to offer many unique, generous and useful perk packages. Some of these are designed for Universities (Master's Classes), Individual Students (which you can gift) and Businesses  (Corporate Sponsorship).  Even if you select "Unconditional Giving" you get the satisfaction of truly making a difference in the sharing of new music with the world... music that has been uplifting audiences during every performance.
  • DISASTER PLAN: If we don't reach our minimum goal, the funds received will be used to complete the first steps of the production process with the alternative goal of doing a digital only release with other "must have" items to be decided upon based on the resources that are available. 
  •   OVER-THE-TOP-BONUS PLAN:  Because we've been developing enough music for two CD's, it is more cost effective to record all the music in one project and thus have enough to eventually release a subsequent CD (depending on resources). This second CD will be also be pre-released in the Spring of 2016 to all contributors with at no additional cost if we reach the  required threshold. Exceeding our goals will also allow the band to produce music videos and multi-media content for live performances. We will provide more detailed updates throughout the campaign. 


The Impact of Your Gift

Recording a CD is like taking all this collective value creation and putting it into a time capsule that’s available for Generations to come.  Your gift helps to make history and make you a part of creating the jazz legacies!  A central part of the concept of the group is about mentoring young jazz musicians and giving them a voice and a vehicle for expression.  From time to time we invite other incredible young players to sub for the regular band members to expand the generational experience.  It is the participation of each contributor, no matter how large or small, that makes all this possible.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you have read this far, of course, you are interested in our project. However, if you are on a tight budget for the next thirty days, you can, nevertheless, help us get the word out to others via email, phone conversations and social media using the 'share tools" provided here on Indiegogo. 

                     We truly thank you for your support of our campaign!!!!!!!



                        Come hang out with us at the studio!


           Miles Davis Portrait

 


   Black & White Photography
   By Scott Hesse

Robert Irving III, Composer/Pianist



Scott Hesse, Guitarist




Laurence Irving,  Group Co-Creator/Alto Saxophonist



Rajiv Halim, Soprano Saxophonist/Flutist



            Irvin Pierce, Tenor Saxophonist



Emma Dayhuff, Bassist/Vocalist


Charles "Rick" Heath IV, Drummer

story:
Everybody knows Brooksie... if you don't, you will soon! 

Hi, I'm Brooksie Wells. I have been writing songs all my life. When I was nineteen I was signed by the late Bobby Darin to Chappell Music. I grew up in the South with parents who fought for Civil Rights. Then I moved to New York City in the 1970s, where the thriving folk music scene heavily influenced my songwriting.
 I've recorded with John Lennon's band Elephant's Memory and sang with Kid Creole and The Coconuts (extra cool points if you remember them!) You can learn more and hear songs from my previous records at www.brooksiewells.com 

After raising two beautiful children, these days I try to inspire people across the country by telling our story through music as well as teaching workshops on honoring and elevating your intuition. 

About North East Rising Sun...

I've returned to my folk roots with my new album, "North East Rising Sun." It's a soulful, heartfelt response to recent events in my life. After a major life change I moved to Atlanta and found a wonderful guitarist/producer named Billy Gewin, in Tucker, GA. He helped me craft this acoustic sound that combines traditional folk style and powerful lyrics that will appeal to anyone who has ever lost their heart... and then found it again. 

My dear friends and family helped me finance the initial recording and they really want me to finally get my work out to a larger audience. So, with your help through this Indiegogo campaign, I can mix, master, print and promote this record to a wider audience than ever.
The business of making music is so different these days. Social Media and Crowdfunding are the main ways musicians can get the financial support necessary to release, distribute and publicize an album. 
What I love, is that it gives me the opportunity to reach out and share some really cool art, bonus material and interact personally with new friends and loyal fans.

The Bottom Line Y'all...

There is mixing/mastering, production, licensing and all kinds of people involved in getting North East Rising Sun out to the masses and played on 540 radio stations. This all costs money and I'm hoping that your contributions will help me hit the $10,000 mark.

What YOU get out of the deal...

  • Digital Download of the album for even the $10 donations
  • Knowing that you helped make this record possible
  • Some really unique perks for each level of donation
  • Personal interaction with Brooksie on social media (and maybe in person-SEE PERKS!)
  • EXCLUSIVE sneak peeks of songs and video clips throughout the campaign

Even if you're broke... YOU CAN HELP... Share!

  • Post this campaign on your Facebook or Twitter, or your favorite social media channel to help get the word out to music lovers who don't know Brooksie, even though Everybody Knows Brooksie! #EKB 
  • Email or call friends and family you think might enjoy the soulful, heartfelt music

Just so you know...

Come hell or high water, North East Rising Sun will be released and there is NO RISK that your contributions will be in vain. Indiegogo will charge a very reasonable percentage of the final funds. And, you have my deepest gratitude for any and all contributions. Love, Brooksie!

story: The funds will go to helping me make my own recording booth, so I can make music for you guys. The first album is free. it will be around 10-15 songs depending on recording time and so far there's no release date, but after the first album is released I will immediately get to writing and working on the second album. I will be making music more and more, helping others more and more. I've wanted to make music for you guys for a long time now but never had the money to get it done, now I ask you guys for your help. Please help me raise money for my dream. If we raise more than enough I'll be making merch for you guys from both my own designs and from the album, so please lets get past the goal. Love you all (\^~^/)

story:
Summary

Hello everyone allow me to introduce myself I am Dave Tolliver 1/2 of the RnB duo Men at Large. Discovered by the late great Gerald Levert we thrived on excellence and have taken so much pride in the music we released. At this point I am on a solo journey and have a cd coming out this summer on the Monarchy/Spectra Music Group. It is a blessing to still have people interested in backing my talent. Although they are putting it out my team and I still need your help! We are hoping you will want to be a part of this history making project!

What We Need & What You Get

  • $20,000 is my goal which is to provide an extra push in the marketing and promotions (Radio,Print,TV,Street, Club) area. If nobody knows the project is out we can't get back to the top. 
  • The great part about donating to this project is the feeling you will get when you see real songs with content and an artist with bonafide talent back on top. Hopefully this will spark a revolution of change and we can get back to making music for the soul!
  • The funds achieved from this project whether we reach our goal or not will be used to propel this cd in to space on a major level. We are trying to bring back the validity of RnB music.

The Impact

  • SomethinLikeTheGreatest will be a classic and revive the RnB culture. It is full of songs that will touch all ages, cultures, and nations. It will reignite the interest in  "People Who Really Have Talent"
  • My career has had its ups and downs but at its high point I have: 1 Platinum and 1 Gold Record, 3 #1 Radio Singles, Radio Song of the Year(1993), Lifetime Achievement Award from the Ohio Hip Hop Awards, and a host of other local proclamations from different organizations.
  • Being a consumer as well as an artist I understand the importance of the bang for the buck concept. This project will remind people of the good old days when you could play an album from beginning to end. They will feel like the money they spent was well worth it, in turn giving you a great feeling knowing you were a part of it from the beginning! You will see your investment at work with a direct connect to me or any financial record will be in plain sight for your comfort. 

Risks & Challenges

  • In entertainment there is always a 50/50 chance of taking a loss but lets face it if we all bet on the real we can win. They throw millions of dollars in to talentless, non subject music. At that point we are forced to like it because we have to listen to it over and over again, but if we have dollars to compete with our radio campaign we can make them LOVE ME AGAIN!
  • Most of the services we need to be competitive already have a price tag and time stamp. By placing the monies in the proper place we become competitive with the major artists we hear everyday all day that we gripe about but eventually love them. We only love them because WE HAVE NO OTHER CHOICE! ITS TIME FOR US TO TAKE THE GAME BACK!

Other Ways You Can Help


  • If you can't or don't want to make a donation please by all means feel free to share my story with all your friends, I REALLY REALLY NEED YOUR HELP!
  • Please use all the IndieGoGo tools that are available in this prospectus to make it an easy process to share with all of your family and friends. 

                                           I THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!!!!!!!!
