story:
Creating a Legacy of Music, Together.

 

OUR MISSION

Every community needs a music school that invests in its children, and The Jerry Evans School of Music IS that school! After starting as a one-person music studio, I, Jerry Evans, discovered that my vision of educating young musicians through core fundamentals where they also learn styles that they LOVE TO PLAY had really hit home! Young and old students alike wanted to grow in their skills, but also wanted to play things that they loved. We are here to do that!

 

JESM wouldn’t be the same without YOU and the  people who are involved. Parents and kids alike devote time, hard work and energy into making JESM happen because they believe in what we do. JESM is truly a community of people who are passionate about music and are invested in creating a culture of music for themselves and the next generation. So now is your chance - join our team here at the beginning. Help us build a legacy of music and pass it on.


 

Why the Jerry Evans School of Music?

 

JESM (Jerry Evans School of Music) is dedicated to providing high quality and fun music lessons to students of all levels ranging from beginner to professional throughout the Chicago-land area. All of our instructors have a bachelors or masters degree in the field of music from high level institutions, and are committed to teaching students’ core fundamentals and technique in an enjoyable and fun environment! Whether it’s classical, musical theater, blues, rock, pop, country, jazz, opera or anything else imaginable, students will receive an excellent and versatile education that exceeds expectations!

 

With your help, we can make this happen!

 

OUR GOAL

Since making the leap from solo-teacher to a multi-disciplinary school, we have been operating without any investment capital and just the little left over at the end of the month, so WE NEED YOUR HELP!!! We are in an old building with small rooms that is not equipped with the materials, equipment or sound-proofing needed to help our students. PLEASE HELP US! We want to give the best to all students, but since we are brand new and don’t have the means to make these changes on our own. We need to raise $35,000 so that we can look like a real music school, but, more importantly, provide the best learning environment for our students. Here’s what we need the money for:

Soundproofing the walls and doors.

Soundproofing costs $13,000-$17,000.

Soundproof doors

To foster a focused and comfortable learning environment, we want to give each student the space to learn without the interruption of outside visitors or distraction of fellow students. Soundproofing the walls will give each student that space.

Instruments - $5,000.  

A String Bass will cost $1,500 alone.  

For a complete learning experience, we need to equip each studio with its own keyboard/piano, as well as our students with instruments they may need.

Audio and recording equipment for student recordings - $3,000.

After our students develop a foundation, providing students with the ability to record at a professional level and share with friends, or help their budding careers is very important and we want to encourage our students through recording.

Music and sheet music, theory books, and other teaching tools for our students

We believe that a one-size-fits-all lesson plan is not realistic. Since each student has different tastes, learning styles and skill level, each lesson plan is going to be different. At JESM, each student benefits from a custom lesson plan that focuses on the interests of each individual student and skill level from the young beginner to the seasoned professional. We want to provide our teachers with the materials they need to give a full music education to each student.

JESM outdoor sign – So people see that we’re here! - $4,000-$5,000

Our building is old and not particularly glamorous. Many people don’t even know we exists. We would love to change that!

Aesthetics - $3,000-$5,000

We want to create the most welcoming atmosphere possible. Our desire is to create an environment that is welcoming and that communicates to people that they are welcome and that we are ready to have fun learning.

We want to provide a fresh, attractive, and comfortable place for our students to learn. This includes painting, adding artwork and furniture, as well as other items that will make our lesson spaces and lobby are more pleasant.

 

Our goal is $35,000, but anything we make beyond our goal will help us further better our school! We would really love a new carpet (ours is super old and kind of gross), and a video camera to better document and share what is happening at JESM with the community!

 

Pass it on.

There are two ways you can help. First, you can give financially. As you just read, there is a great need and we can’t meet it on our own.  Second, you can pass it on - spread the word, share this video, and find those music lovers in the Wheaton area and beyond who want to see their kids and grandkids be a part of a musical legacy! We want everyone to know what is going on!

 

Building a legacy beyond our walls.

 

GIVING BACK

Since beginning this venture, the Jerry Evans School of Music has been honored to donate our gifts and time to many different causes and we plan to continue this as we become more established in the community. We have donated gifts of free lessons to local educational institutions for their events and fundraisers including the Ark Preschool, Lincoln Elementary School, and Our Savior Preschool. We have  also opened up our master classes to local music students. We look forward to continuing to provide donations to people and organizations in the area as they need.

 

More about us!

 

Students at JESM participate in high quality concerts, rock band classes, workshops and other performance opportunities outside of school. The Jerry Evans School of Music is an educational institution that seeks to be a symbol of excellence in the community.  Students are taught in a linear direction to fit their learning style and goals while also receiving encouragement and developing confidence.

Musical Relevance – Our students learn to play the music they enjoy, no matter the style: rock, classical, pop, jazz, folk, musical theater, country, and school orchestra/band. Focusing on the music each student cares about is huge in creating an engaging music lesson experience.

Creative Expression – All of our students are given the opportunity to explore the creative side of music many studios fail to explore. Improvisation, songwriting, style study, and playing by ear are some of the examples of creative expression.

Comprehensive Musical Learning – Since one can’t achieve mastery without building a strong musical foundation, JESM students have the opportunity to go deep into skill building, fundamentals, theory, and technical exercises. This allows each student to play/sing more complex and involved versions of the styles they love.

Fun, Fun, and More Fun!!! – Enjoying the process is huge when it comes to a student sticking with it! We strive to provide a lesson experience that is focused on having fun while simultaneously developing skills.

Performance Opportunities – We believe that performing is crucial to a musicians education and provide our hard working students with the opportunity to perform in high quality concerts every semester. Moreover, our concerts provide collaboration opportunities between classical and contemporary musicians.

Opportunities To Learn Multiple Instruments – Multiple research studies have shown that music study contributes to intelligence, better grades, better test scores, good behavior, etc… At JESM, there are lessons offered on more than 20 different instruments with opportunities for students to take lessons on more than one instrument; even for multiple students of the same family (kids and adults) to conveniently take lessons at the school on their preferred instrument.

Open Door Policy – We maintain an open door policy for parents to sit in the lesson and comfortably enjoy their child’s lesson while providing extra assistance and support for their practicing and growth throughout the week.

 

What people say about JESM.

 

“Jerry Evans’ training skill set is proven to produce success as made evident in the progress of his students and the growth of his business over such a short period of time. It is Jerry’s powerful combination of competence, consistency, and care that takes students higher than the average music lesson. Students of Jerry Evans School of Music will excel and stand out above the rest and will feel empowered as they are trained.”

Stephen Gulley, Top-Ranking Christian Music Artist

 

“I really like how Jerry relates to my son Sam (10). He has a pleasing personality and brings a hipness and cool factor which lends itself well as a music teacher to kids and makes them want to play. And from my adult perspective, I appreciate Jerry’s academic theory knowledge he brings to the table which is helping me to better understand the playing I’ve been doing for years.”

Curt (Parent and Student)

 

“Jerry projects a positive learning environment with energy, adapts the student’s capability to learn to lessons provided, & demonstrates patience and holds the student’s attention.”

Bill

 

“I have had massive improvements in my playing technique since taking lessons and I have also learned lots of theory which allows me to construct better guitar parts.”

Wes

 

“Whether you’re 6 years old or 48, (I’m 48), Jerry’s lessons are the best. The learning atmosphere is relaxed, yet comprehensive, and it’s fun too.”

Tony

story:
Creative Arts Factory of Evanston

Our Mission:  To provide affordable opportunities in the exploration and expression of music and other creative arts, media production and recording, as a gateway to the discovery of personal worth, responsibility and the desire to achieve.

Our Vision:  To become a center for cultivating culturally diverse expressions of the arts and community media that motivates, enriches and establishes a path toward meaningful aspirations. 

Creative Arts Factory of Evanston, a 501(c) (3) nonprofit charitable organization was formed by a small group of experienced musicians, performers, artists and teachers.  The combined expertise of this group is helping others discover and develop their own artistic passions.

We Are Musicians, Performers, Artists & Teachers and This is What We Do 

A few of us worked and taught for a small cultural arts facility that had recently closed its doors.  However, we wanted to continue the work that we felt was very important - supporting and providing music and arts within our community while keeping it financially accessible for those who could not otherwise have such opportunities.  So in 2014, we banded together, founded and incorporated a new cultural arts group, and also received our nonprofit charitable organization status.  

Our planned programs offer instruction in music, dance, art and other art forms, and feature performances with a concentration on multicultural (world), urban and contemporary genres.  We have plans to design a recording studio for most types of recording needs, which will allow students to further explore music and sound through technology and production.  

In addition to music, art and dance classes, Creative Arts Factory of Evanston will include an internet radio station, and will share time on a low-power FM radio station. Individuals and groups can, with training, create and broadcast their own shows - from music performances, to stories with historical references about community, or even shows about DIY project tips.  All are approaches to stimulate creative engagement within the community.

The Impact

Our organization will not only offer opportunities to pursue creative endeavors, but will also offer a fresh approach and positive challenges to enhance the nature of the human condition.  Before there can be achievement, there must be belief in its possibility.  The ability of the CAF of Evanston to nurture an interest in obtaining creative arts skills will encourage students' desire to hone those skills into very possible and achievable career paths.  

Our instructors have stories to tell about their individual successes within our group. Former students of our sound engineer have provided quotes particularly related to his guidance: 

  • "The studio has made me change my life. It made me do positive things.  (Drew) made me think about what I talk about in my songs and the connection to real life... honestly, I'm not even on the streets anymore like I was.  I've got a girlfriend and talk to her on the phone and write my raps.  It's done so much for me."
  • "The studio has made it so I can get my voice heard beyond just my friends."
  • "It's brought me closer to my friends.  It showed me that I can speak positively instead of negatively on the track and get my voice heard out here." 

Using the arts as a gateway to the discovery of personal worth, responsibility and the desire to achieve, CAF of Evanston will be a conduit for individuals to seek and focus on positive interactions, thus supporting deeper relationships that strengthen a community of peace.  Individuals will begin to see a wider realm of possibilities for a brighter, more creative future.  This will be the impact of your donation.

How Your Funding Will Help

Right now, we are doing some outreach work - providing some of the arts programming at other organizations, schools and events - but are in need of a space where we can base our operations in order to fully accomplish our goals. Additionally, many pieces of equipment we had been using were generously loaned to us by our teachers and volunteers, particularly because of their commitment to our mission.  We hope to raise enough money 1.) To help fund the leasing of space for our first year, 2.) To outfit our studio with equipment purchased exclusively for CAF of Evanston and 3.) To pay a part-time office administrator to set up systems and maintain bookkeeping. 

Donate a Little or A Lot... and Help Us Share Our Story

We all know the saying, "Every little bit helps."  And yes, a lot would help us get to our goal even faster.  However, we know how difficult it can be to donate when personal funds are tight.  There are other ways you can help, in addition to donating funds, or if you can't contribute financially.  You can help us get the word out about our organization's Indiegogo campaign - by posting on your social media pages, or by using Indiegogo's sharing tools.  We deeply appreciate your contribution in any way you are able.
story_txt:
Creative Arts Factory of Evanston
 Our Mission:  To provide affordable opportunities in the exploration and expression of music and other creative arts, media production and recording, as a gateway to the discovery of personal worth, responsibility and the desire to achieve.
  Our Vision:  To become a center for cultivating culturally diverse expressions of the arts and community media that motivates, enriches and establishes a path toward meaningful aspirations. 
Creative Arts Factory of Evanston, a 501(c) (3) nonprofit charitable organization was formed by a small group of experienced musicians, performers, artists and teachers.  The combined expertise of this group is helping others discover and develop their own artistic passions.   We Are Musicians, Performers, Artists & Teachers and This is What We Do 

A few of us worked and taught for a small cultural arts facility that had recently closed its doors.  However, we wanted to continue the work that we felt was very important - supporting and providing music and arts within our community while keeping it financially accessible for those who could not otherwise have such opportunities.  So in 2014, we banded together, founded and incorporated a new cultural arts group, and also received our nonprofit charitable organization status.  Our planned programs offer instruction in music, dance, art and other art forms, and feature performances with a concentration on multicultural (world), urban and contemporary genres.  We have plans to design a recording studio for most types of recording needs, which will allow students to further explore music and sound through technology and production.  In addition to music, art and dance classes, Creative Arts Factory of Evanston will include an internet radio station, and will share time on a low-power FM radio station. Individuals and groups can, with training, create and broadcast their own shows - from music performances, to stories with historical references about community, or even shows about DIY project tips.  All are approaches to stimulate creative engagement within the community.   The Impact Our organization will not only offer opportunities to pursue creative endeavors, but will also offer a fresh approach and positive challenges to enhance the nature of the human condition.  Before there can be achievement, there must be belief in its possibility.  The ability of the CAF of Evanston to nurture an interest in obtaining creative arts skills will encourage students' desire to hone those skills into very possible and achievable career paths.  


Our instructors have stories to tell about their individual successes within our group. Former students of our sound engineer have provided quotes particularly related to his guidance: 



"The studio has made me change my life. It made me do positive things.  (Drew) made me think about what I talk about in my songs and the connection to real life... honestly, I'm not even on the streets anymore like I was.  I've got a girlfriend and talk to her on the phone and write my raps.  It's done so much for me."


"The studio has made it so I can get my voice heard beyond just my friends."


"It's brought me closer to my friends.  It showed me that I can speak positively instead of negatively on the track and get my voice heard out here." 


Using the arts as a gateway to the discovery of personal worth, responsibility and the desire to achieve, CAF of Evanston will be a conduit for individuals to seek and focus on positive interactions, thus supporting deeper relationships that strengthen a community of peace.  Individuals will begin to see a wider realm of possibilities for a brighter, more creative future.  This will be the impact of your donation.
    How Your Funding Will Help Right now, we are doing some outreach work - providing some of the arts programming at other organizations, schools and events - but are in need of a space where we can base our operations in order to fully accomplish our goals. Additionally, many pieces of equipment we had been using were generously loaned to us by our teachers and volunteers, particularly because of their commitment to our mission.  We hope to raise enough money 1.) To help fund the leasing of space for our first year, 2.) To outfit our studio with equipment purchased exclusively for CAF of Evanston and 3.) To pay a part-time office administrator to set up systems and maintain bookkeeping.    Donate a Little or A Lot... and Help Us Share Our Story
We all know the saying, "Every little bit helps."  And yes, a lot would help us get to our goal even faster.  However, we know how difficult it can be to donate when personal funds are tight.  There are other ways you can help, in addition to donating funds, or if you can't contribute financially.  You can help us get the word out about our organization's Indiegogo campaign - by posting on your social media pages, or by using Indiegogo's sharing tools.  We deeply appreciate your contribution in any way you are able.

story:
I'm Kenny Peck, Veteran and longtime singer/songwriter, author, actor and comedian. I've just finished putting together a compilation of delightful musical comedy numbers! The often risque pieces, some original, some not, were plucked from live performances in both studio and house concert settings, and are complete with spontaneous banter! 

With the recordings already completed, this campaign finishes the comedy album's production phase. Titled "Rita's Party", contributors funding will help producers complete a really fun musical comedy project that would give me great joy to share.

The funding required to complete the comedy album "Rita's Party" will be used to pay for mixing, editing, and mastering. Looks like 7k is what the effort is going to cost. There are some cool perks for contributors that can include a signed copy of my book on Amazon, tee shirts, singles, and other personally signed albums by my band Kenny Peck & the Smoky Jack Band. Funds for this comedy project will also be used to promote the new album of funnies, including printing and shipping fees.

                         

There is just not enough laughter in a world that takes itself too seriously. As an entertainer, the closeness of an audience is, by far, the most edgy and fun place to be. It's a terrific feeling for me to think that together, we can get everyone a ticket to "Rita's Party"!!

                                                            

The Smoky Jack Corporation is proud to have created, produced, and financed the company's musical singles, albums, books, images, and bling previously mentioned. But this time, with this album, I honestly wish for you to participate in a tribute to musical comedy.

Know that you may have to go through our website kennypecksongs.com to order or obtain "Rita's Party" after the program ends on December 24th, which is cool. Even we can meet our funding goal, we will continue to accept funding via In Demand to keep on promoting and maybe even potentially finding a publicist!

Welcome aboard the Kenny Peck train!!!

story:
Hello fans, friends, and music lovers,

I am back in the studio recording my 5th studio album and am looking forward to sharing my journey during this next musical project with you.

Our lives are marked by milestones-special moments in time. As a musician, I give myself to those Moments through my life energy which is embodied through my melodies, lyrics and chords to stir the audience’s soul. One comment I make at every concert is how music moves people! It is truly the universal language.

Moments also define us as individuals. On this upcoming album, I will be sharing some of my life’s most memorable experiences to date to create an uplifting, positive and engaging listening experience for people of all ages. That aspect of my music, and how I live my life day to day will never change, and that's a promise I keep to myself, my family and all those around me. My life mantra is:

Balance, Energy, Laughter, Love, (B.E.L.L.) the 4 key ingredients to strive for to achieve a Limitless life!

About this album:

As with my past work, this new album will put a groove into your step and a smile on your face. We’ll be serving up an eclectic mix of smooth, funky, edgy and infectious contemporary instrumental grooves. Featuring a stellar line up of my local Toronto band members, studio musicians and special guest artists from the contemporary jazz, pop and world music scene, like:

  • Grammy nominee and Soul Train Award winning co-producer Nate Harasim

  • Multiple Juno and Canadian Smooth Jazz Award winner Gabriel Mark Hasselbach

  • World Guitarist extraordinaire Steve Oliver

  • And more special guest collaborations (TBA), so stay tuned for more exciting artist announcements!

With Contemporary Pop, Jazz, World, Latin, Acoustic, Electric guitar overtones, a couple of new vocal based songs I have written, this new album will achieve a fresh mix of exciting music and finely-crafted songs recorded live in the studio with the amazing musicians mentioned above.

Our goal is to create musical Moments to share with you and that you will enjoy for years to come!

Why I need your help and support:

The music industry has undergone radical changes in recent years. Record companies no longer fund new albums, because the revenue from music sales has essentially dried up. As an independent recording artist with no record company support, album costs are my responsibility from start to finish, so I need to raise the funds required to cover recording/production /studio musician costs for this new album, which will be released in late Fall, 2015.

My funding target is $15,000, which after deducting cost of perks and Indiegogo fees will leave me with just enough to get this project done. That may sound like a lot of money, but you’d be surprised how quickly it gets consumed during the album-making process and every penny needs to be spent wisely for maximum benefit.


You can help by pledging your support. I have created some perks/incentives to encourage your support. The more you give, the more you get! From CDs, posters, unique Rob Tardik merchandise, private guitar lessons, live in house concerts, Rob Tardik concert tickets, album credits all the way up to executive producer acclaim and even a custom one-of-a-kind Godin “Moments” guitar, there is a perk to suit all music fans!

Every little bit helps, so all contributions are welcome no matter how small. There are other non-monetary ways to help as well:

  • Please share this page/link with your friends, family and social networks, anyone who has a passion for great music and you can help to get the word out about my campaign.

  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

The final word:

Thanks for spending your valuable time getting to know me, my musical vision and learning about my Indiegogo campaign. I sincerely hope you have plans to support this project and help create some shared musical Moments with me!

Watch for continuous updates throughout the campaign as this campaign progresses and we share the journey together.

Let's make this album a reality and enjoy some amazing Moments together!!!

And always remember to ring the B.E.L.L of life loud and clear!!

About Rob:

In a career spanning over two decades, Rob Tardik has established himself as an award winning guitarist and contemporary jazz/world instrumental music artist. He has performed at venues all across North America the prestigious Glenn Gould Theatre in Toronto last October. Rob enjoyed a stellar release with his 2011/12 3rd CD release Balance, Energy, Laughter, Love (B.E.L.L.) which spawned 3 U.S Billboard singles two of which went Top 10. Rob was featured on the cover story for the Oct/Nov 2012 issue of Smooth Jazz News Magazine and his single “Christmas Morning” was Billboards most added holiday track last year. B.E.L.L. has also made the top 50 list of 2012 on SmoothJazz.com coming in at #15 and was a top 10 album (#6) for 2011 in “Smooth Jazz News magazine”. Café Jazz Radio named Rob the #1 Canadian Smooth Jazz Artist for 2011 and B.E.L.L. its #1 CD for 2011 as well, and “East meets Wes” the #1 single of the year.

Rob has kicked of 2015 with his 5th CD Moments in the works for a Fall 2015 release, and new tour dates and a new single “RobBop” which has already been the #2 most added new track on the Billboard Smooth Jazz charts. Rob released his 4th studio CD release “Limitless” which debuted at the end of summer 2013. His first single “One World” went to #1 on the charts for 3 weeks in summer/fall 2013. In 2010, Rob won the prestigious Canadian Smooth Jazz Guitarist of the Year; and held the #1 spot on the U.S.-based, Music Choice Contemporary Jazz charts for 4 weeks in Sept/Oct 2010. Rob is currently on the guitar faculty at Metal Works Institute, the Merriam School of Music and studied music at York University in Toronto and has worked for Roland Canada as a guitar product specialist. Rob also holds diplomas in both recording engineering from TRW and in Media Arts from Humber College. Rob has also been honored being named Mississauga’s 2007 “Established Performer of the Year” for his musical contributions, an award won previously by Oscar Peterson and Rik Emmett. Rob is currently endorsed by Godin Guitars, Roland Canada and D’Addario Music.

story: We've been working hard for years now on The Green Zoo's second album, "The Adventures of Johnny Nihilist." It's sounding great and we're excited to share it with you. Unfortunately, engineering the album has cost us more money then we've been able to raise writing music for commercials, playing music for the Rocky Horror Picture Show and The Red Light Variety Show and putting on various live events around the Treasure Valley area. Help us to finish the album and get it into your ear-holes!

story:
So Roots Fall Tour 2015

So Roots is planning their first tour to the West Coast of the mainland during the Fall of 2015. The duration of the tour will be 2 weeks. They need your help to raise money for this trip. This tour will open new doors of opportunities and will help them spread their music. 

So Roots will need $12,000 which will be used towards flights, food, gas, hotel,transportation, and any other necessities. One of the biggest challenges that they and all other Hawaii bands face is the fact that we are not connected to the mainland at all. The only way there and back is by a 5 hour plane ride, which will be the most expensive part of their trip. This is where you come in. Any type of monetary donations will be greatly appreciated, there are several different perks available depending on how much you donate, from free music to a free performance. If you are unable to make any monetary donations at this time, a click on the “Share” button will be greatly appreciated as well. We hope you can help make our Fall tour a successful one. 

About So Roots

     “I want to capture a point in time and let people forever live in that same moment,”-Pono Patoc.

     SO ROOTS is now spreading their special moment in time with the world. Originally formed by a group of friends in high school from Honolulu, Hawaii, what started off as a monthly meeting about music they loved, soon turned into something much greater. Their music has let them travel to different places and meet new people everyday. Opening for bands such as Morgan Heritage, The Green, The Steppas, Maoli, The Hot Rain Band, The Jimmy Weeks Project, and many more. The young band is zealous to see what the future has in store for them.

     MALAMA(PONO)MAIKALANI ADRIAN PATOC, lead vocalist and keyboardist of So Roots, is finally paving his own way through the reggae scene. Performing as a keyboardist with many artists/bands including The Jimmy Weeks Project, Kiwini, Siaosi, Jah Maoli, Leilani Wolfgramm, and Iakopo to name a few, his drive and persistence has taken So Roots music far beyond what anyone has anticipated. KLANDON FETAUI and LAPANA IERIKO, the heartbeat of the band, is not only musically talented but extremely driven to accomplish their goals. Their presence has boosted So Roots progression tremendously.

     The success of So Roots thus far has been accomplished through hard work and perseverance. Independently releasing their music, “Still Love You” was their introduction to the world in 2013. They then released “Try”(featuring Rod Da Fire)  in early 2014. Both singles would later appear on their debut EP So Roots that was released on September 18, 2014 with no expectations of hitting the charts. The six-track EP topped at number three on the iTunes reggae charts. Multiple songs from the EP received tremendous attention from several local radio stations.


For more information visit us at www.sorootsband.com

story:
ABOUT ME AND MY AIMS


I'm Jeremy Holtom and I head a small team who will manage our campaign that include my partner Michelle, also a talented artist and our two children Abi and Vicki aged fifteen and sixteen. I'm a music producer, mentor, business consultant, concert pianist, songwriter, lead vocalist and keyboard player and main writer for several bands signed to our record label Beyond Reality Music. I'm a poet, an artist, direct produce and edit some of our music videos one of which was featured on Classic FM TV for several years, a published author and an inspirational speaker. I also cook!!  I also own an anarchic record company, a publishing company, a mentoring company and a classic car company and the cars are loaned to those who choose to work with me as a mentor and guardian angel to follow their dreams. 

For twenty four years until the age of forty four I was one of the countries leading financial advisers until I sold up to pursue my own dreams, free my own heart and show others how to leave the mind numbing and life wasting illusion of corporate security and the illusion of safety. 

I deliberately chose to walk the riskiest path from 2002 in order to show others the way by leading from the front. Life is too short to play safe and be imprisoned by fear and the quest for a security that does not exist for we cannot fight fate and could be dead tomorrow!  

I have sunk every penny into my dreams, mortgaged everything up to the hilt. I have fended off bailiffs, fought off people who tried to make me bankrupt and gone to the very edges of losing my home which I have lived in for thirty years and bought at the age of 26 as a derelict shell.  Indeed you may have seen me in Channel Four's Posh Pawn in May 2014 when I played poker with my mortgage company raising £26,000 by pawning my prized Steinway concert grand piano which you can see in the video in classical and rock music mode to clear off my mortgage arrears two days before being evicted like in the film Field Of Dreams with Kevin Costner 

If you are going to achieve a dream there is only one right road and its risky, sometimes scary and very empowering and you have to be in the right places at the right time. What doesn't kill you really does make you much stronger. If you believe and never give up one day you will win when you have learned all you must to be the person you were meant to be.

Now after painting for ten years and releasing alot of ground breaking high energy music two things have come together. My first London art exhibition between 23rd September and 7th October this year at a gallery called Shamineh in Hampstead which has hosted some great exhibitions including one by Storm Thorgerson who painted several album covers for rock band Pink Floyd and the launch of our most powerful song Free Your Heart clips of which you can hear at the end of the video above.

You'll get a fuller picture of me from the video which is a little longer than usual. Its a short thirteen minute documentary introducing my paintings, videos, my classical and rock side, a bit about me and my family and two clips of Free Your Heart.
The artwork for Free Your Heart



The main facts are in the first four minutes or so but take the time to watch it all. Its a more interesting way to use thirteen minutes than watching most stuff on television and you'll understand me better!


 My aim is simple. To put the passion, inspiration and colour back into the world and sweep away many of the rules, regulations and the idea that things should be done a certain way. I want to inspire you all to break free and follow your hearts for all our dreams are possible! Help me to bring this about...


Centrepiece Painting In The Exhibition
Bird Watching Through The Eyes Of A Bird (4 feet by 5 feet)



What I  am Looking For And the Amazing Things You Get For Supporting Me:

IF A THOUSAND PEOPLE EACH CHIP IN £20  MY TARGET WILL BE MET- EVERY LITTLE HELPS!

I am looking to raise a minimum of £20,000 by getting as many people involved as possible from people with very little to alot.  There are amazing perks at every level which will give you great music introducing you to the very different way we produce music (no Simon Cowell or manufactured music here). At £250 you'll get the chance to borrow my Mustang GT, come on a Creativity Day with me and receive a mentoring session to get you thinking about your own dreams and how to achieve them. You'll also pick up all the perks from lower levels of support. 

If you are a high roller who's prepared to back me for thousands well there are some great rewards for backing me for you too including the chance to receive some of my best paintings amongst your reward.

If 1,000 people each chip in £20 then the target will be met. 

DVD OF DON'T LET THE TAIL WAG THE DOG AN ALTERNATE PERK FOR THOSE WHO SEEK TO BE INSPIRED AND TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR LIVES
AN INSPIRATIONAL TALK GIVEN BY JEREMY TO A GROUP OF BUSINESS PEOPLE IN BLETCHLEY PARK IN NOVEMBER 2014 COMPLETE WITH MUSIC AND MESSAGES



There is a particularly attractive package at £20 to encourage people to push the boat out a little further that is worth upwards of £50. If you  are thinking about chipping in £5 or £10 well I'm encouraging you to take a small risk to push to £20 and rewarding you for taking it because when you start taking risks you have started walking to your dreams and started to free your own heart.

I want you to take the first step and the first slight risk on the journey to your own dreams. This provides two albums including our groundbreaking concept album about confronting fears and going for your dreams, Grim Reaper.....And Other Imaginary Fears which is sold in HMV, a classic single and a special signed and numbered limited edition pre- release copy of Free Your Heart with at least four tracks on it.

I promise you that you will pick up some luck by doing it and a proportion of those who push to £20 will get some  special ad hoc rewards from me that I won't tell you about now but for sure people that get them will tell the world!

I particularly want music lovers who have relatively little to buy real CD'S rather than downloads to benefit from this and be inspired by the music they receive!



The Grim Reaper video made at Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire in 2011 that has attracted more than 31,000 views on youtube. 

The video was directed by Peter Thomas who appeared in Vincent Price's most controversial film in the 1960's, Witchfinder General. Peter also plays the Priest in our video and does the menacing voiceover at the start of the video and song!


If we raise my target figure then the money will provide the following:

For The Art Exhibition

Rent of the gallery
Cost of framing pictures and photographing and 
producing limited edition prints
Cost of printing invitations to private views and previews and
a professional guide
Hire of van to take pictures to and from  the exhibition
Hire of PR company
Cost of drinks and food for private views and previews
Cost of producing press releases, posters and publicity leaflets
Insurance


THE UNION OF TWO IMMORTAL SOULS WHICH WILL GO TO THE PERSON WHO CONTRIBUTES £10,000 (SIZE 30 INCHES BY 24 INCHES)
OILS



For Free Your Heart

Producing a video
Manufacture of CD'S
Hire of PR company and a plugger
Publicity photos
Fees for the performers
Paying the designer of the finished artwork
Producing posters. tee shirts and other publicity

Should I raise more than the target then I will use it to inject money into our record company, to fund the rest of the album on which Free Your Heart will appear, to fund a classical release called Reflections, hire staff to move forward and potentially get back my beautiful piano from the pawn brokers. I will also produce the next edition of my book about my journey called Messages From Beyond Reality and use some of the money to finance a classical piano tour.

If we raise less then the art exhibition is the first priority so we will have to delay the release of Free Your Heart.

THE PERKS

I really believe in sharing and helping to free everyone so the perks are all about that. You can support me from £5 upwards and you'll not only get music, tee shirts, copies of my book and DVD'S of an inspirational talk  and other goodies but potentially the opportunity to borrow fantastic cars, come on creativity weekends at my home, gain help from me to start journeying to your own dreams and even come and paint at my home or have me give  a private piano recital for you and your friends. You'll potentially get limited edition prints and original pieces of art for your home or office.  There really is something to inspire everyone whether you help with a little or alot!!

MUSTANG GT A 4.6  LITRE BEAST AVAILABLE TO BORROW FOR A DAY FOR ALL WHO PROVIDE £250 OR MORE SUBJECT TO A FEW SENSIBLE CONDITIONS


Help Me Change The World

We have all been boxed in by rules, too much education by regulations and how things should be done that we have lost sight of real creativity and originality. Without these things there is no chance of getting out of the financial mess the world has got into. I want to change this and free us all to be the people we want to be living as we want without busy bodies and politicians telling us how we should live! I want to help everyone to believe in themselves and what's possible.

I worked incredibly hard for twenty four years building a business in financial services that became one of the best in the country. I dealt with everyone from rock stars and famous actors to plumbers and people doing ordinary jobs. I learned how to manage and motivate people, how to sell and how to change people's thinking.

In 2002 after planning how I would do it for several years I sold my business for a substantial sum and walked away from security and safety and a large income to pursue my dreams. Within a year I had formed a record company. After eight years I had taken two clients of my mentoring company from wage slaves to membership of the Sunday Times Fastrack 100 Index which meant they ran two of the 100 fastest growing companies in the country. Both became multi millionaires.

I have become incredibly resourceful, a powerful negotiator and learned how to live right on the edge and use all my resources both personal and financial to greatest effect.

I have appeared in two prime time documentaries on National Television, on local and national radio and battles I have fought have been reported in national and local media. Google me and you will find out more.

I have been a supporter and spokesperson in the original petrol price campaign appearing on sky news. I have supported the metric martyrs financially who have been fighting for the retention of all things British. I have taken on the VAT authorities in the courts and fought test cases against speed cameras. By supporting me you will give me a bigger voice and a much higher profile to use the knowledge I have gained to really fight for a better, saner world for us all! 

Risks that I have taken and overcome

I have literally risked everything I have ever made as I knew I would have to to achieve  my dreams. It is one step at a time on the journey up the mountain. I have gained, wisdom, insight and an ability to think in a completely free and massively out of the box way. This I believe means that I will achieve my biggest goals and usher in a new age of freedom, individuality, creativity and new ways of thinking to take us all forward to a brave and more inspiring world!


Even if you have very little you can still help!


To gain some really nice and unique perks starts with just five pounds. However even if you can't find this you can still help by spreading the word and using all the sharing tools available. Tell me if you have helped because I will remember and some of those who help in other ways than financial will find that I still give them a thank you in some way.
Even if you can't chip in this time there will be other opportunities down the road and I will enhance any perks if you have helped this time.


The cover of a concept album about confronting fears released in 2011 by our record company
story_txt:
ABOUT ME AND MY AIMS


I'm Jeremy Holtom and I head a small team who will manage our campaign that include my partner Michelle, also a talented artist and our two children Abi and Vicki aged fifteen and sixteen. I'm a music producer, mentor, business consultant, concert pianist, songwriter, lead vocalist and keyboard player and main writer for several bands signed to our record label Beyond Reality Music. I'm a poet, an artist, direct produce and edit some of our music videos one of which was featured on Classic FM TV for several years, a published author and an inspirational speaker. I also cook!!  I also own an anarchic record company, a publishing company, a mentoring company and a classic car company and the cars are loaned to those who choose to work with me as a mentor and guardian angel to follow their dreams. 


For twenty four years until the age of forty four I was one of the countries leading financial advisers until I sold up to pursue my own dreams, free my own heart and show others how to leave the mind numbing and life wasting illusion of corporate security and the illusion of safety. 

I deliberately chose to walk the riskiest path from 2002 in order to show others the way by leading from the front. Life is too short to play safe and be imprisoned by fear and the quest for a security that does not exist for we cannot fight fate and could be dead tomorrow!  


I have sunk every penny into my dreams, mortgaged everything up to the hilt. I have fended off bailiffs, fought off people who tried to make me bankrupt and gone to the very edges of losing my home which I have lived in for thirty years and bought at the age of 26 as a derelict shell.  Indeed you may have seen me in Channel Four's Posh Pawn in May 2014 when I played poker with my mortgage company raising £26,000 by pawning my prized Steinway concert grand piano which you can see in the video in classical and rock music mode to clear off my mortgage arrears two days before being evicted like in the film Field Of Dreams with Kevin Costner 



If you are going to achieve a dream there is only one right road and its risky, sometimes scary and very empowering and you have to be in the right places at the right time. What doesn't kill you really does make you much stronger. If you believe and never give up one day you will win when you have learned all you must to be the person you were meant to be.

Now after painting for ten years and releasing alot of ground breaking high energy music two things have come together. My first London art exhibition between 23rd September and 7th October this year at a gallery called Shamineh in Hampstead which has hosted some great exhibitions including one by Storm Thorgerson who painted several album covers for rock band Pink Floyd and the launch of our most powerful song Free Your Heart clips of which you can hear at the end of the video above.

You'll get a fuller picture of me from the video which is a little longer than usual. Its a short thirteen minute documentary introducing my paintings, videos, my classical and rock side, a bit about me and my family and two clips of Free Your Heart.
The artwork for Free Your Heart




The main facts are in the first four minutes or so but take the time to watch it all. Its a more interesting way to use thirteen minutes than watching most stuff on television and you'll understand me better!


 My aim is simple. To put the passion, inspiration and colour back into the world and sweep away many of the rules, regulations and the idea that things should be done a certain way. I want to inspire you all to break free and follow your hearts for all our dreams are possible! Help me to bring this about...

Centrepiece Painting In The Exhibition
Bird Watching Through The Eyes Of A Bird (4 feet by 5 feet)




What I  am Looking For And the Amazing Things You Get For Supporting Me:


IF A THOUSAND PEOPLE EACH CHIP IN £20  MY TARGET WILL BE MET- EVERY LITTLE HELPS!


I am looking to raise a minimum of £20,000 by getting as many people involved as possible from people with very little to alot.  There are amazing perks at every level which will give you great music introducing you to the very different way we produce music (no Simon Cowell or manufactured music here). At £250 you'll get the chance to borrow my Mustang GT, come on a Creativity Day with me and receive a mentoring session to get you thinking about your own dreams and how to achieve them. You'll also pick up all the perks from lower levels of support. 


If you are a high roller who's prepared to back me for thousands well there are some great rewards for backing me for you too including the chance to receive some of my best paintings amongst your reward.


If 1,000 people each chip in £20 then the target will be met. 

DVD OF DON'T LET THE TAIL WAG THE DOG AN ALTERNATE PERK FOR THOSE WHO SEEK TO BE INSPIRED AND TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR LIVES
AN INSPIRATIONAL TALK GIVEN BY JEREMY TO A GROUP OF BUSINESS PEOPLE IN BLETCHLEY PARK IN NOVEMBER 2014 COMPLETE WITH MUSIC AND MESSAGES






There is a particularly attractive package at £20 to encourage people to push the boat out a little further that is worth upwards of £50. If you  are thinking about chipping in £5 or £10 well I'm encouraging you to take a small risk to push to £20 and rewarding you for taking it because when you start taking risks you have started walking to your dreams and started to free your own heart.

I promise you that you will pick up some luck by doing it and a proportion of those who push to £20 will get some  special ad hoc rewards from me that I won't tell you about now but for sure people that get them will tell the world!

story:
ABOUT ME?

My Name is Olafè and I'm from Republic of Benin in Africa and proudly a Yoruba Child.

I like to call myself as an Afro Nu Soul Singer and Songwriter. Singing is like another way to breathe for me and all I want is to bring emotion with my music and positive vibrations.

I’ve been influenced by amazing music icons as Angelique Kidjo, Lizz Wright, Norah Jones, Lauryn Hill, Ayo, Asa and many others.

But my inspiration comes mainly from my own experiences and true stories. Singing helps me to express my feelings about life and on what I’m going through everyday.

More on my Facebook Page OLAFE

ABOUT MY PROJECT?

I delayed many times this moment because of fear, but now i'm ready to make my lifelong dream a reality.

Despite the big budget that it represents, I managed to record a first single in the studio "Lost Without You" and I want to make my first video clip with this song already much appreciated by my friends and relatives. At the same time, I want to record a minimum of six titles through my EP Album. My texts are ready and the melodies are already made.

My songs are mainly written in English and African languages as Yoruba, my native language, Fon and Lingala.

I need YOUR HELP to auto-produce my first Music Video Clip and EP Album with six (6) original songs with Jazz, Nu Soul vibrations and afrobeat influences.

WHAT WE NEED?

With YOUR HELP, I will be able to fundmy first Music Video Clip and EP Album with six (6) original songs:

1. Full Realization of the Video Clip "Lost Without You": $ 2 500 Budget

2. Recording, Mixing and Mastering of six (6) original songs:  $ 1 500 Budget

3. Graphic Design Of the Cover of the EP Album: $ 800 Budget

4. Manufacturing of hundred (100) CDs: $ 850 Budget

5. Promotion and Marketing: $ 850 Budget

TOTAL FUND NEEDED: $ 6500

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN I REACH MY GOAL?

I CAN'T GET THERE WITHOUT YOU and as being part of MY PROJECT TEAM, you will be the first to celebrate this victory with me, if we raise all the money to fund my project! 

I will share with you regularly details of project during its realization. You will be the first to see my video clip and hear my EP Album before the official launching and bring then your first impressions.

We'll then focus on producing and launching the EP Album, giving it some life with press support and build touring opportunities around it so that I can come play near you.

But the best of all is that I will go live with a LIVE WEB CONCERT PARTY and perform a few pieces from my EP Album. You will be invited to attend the exclusive event for backers only.

Any extra funds (that would be awesome!) will go towards marketing, video and touring.

HOW YOU CAN HELP?

You can help contribute by making a donation to my campaign. You've heard it before and it's true: every little amount goes a long way. 

You can also contribute to this project by spreading the news amongst your friends and on social media.

I NEED YOUR SUPPORT ! J'AI BESOIN DE VOUS !

WHY ARE YOU CHOOSING TO HELP ME?

You can easily guess how it's so difficult to realize a project alone and I want you to be part of MY TEAM. 

I know that we can all make THIS together and I will be proud to say at the end:WE MADE THIS!

The only way I have to convince you to help me is by singing. Just listen to my Message Video and my acoustic Demo HERE.

MY CHALLENGE FOR YOU!

I will work hard to bring you one of the best ever video clip and original EP album.

I will be supported by amazing video producers, musicians and coached by experienced music professionals.

Every cent that you will bring will be used to bring the best to this project because your trust worth more than anything.

THANK YOU FOR BRINGING YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
#Solidarity

A new album created in a different direction by building the foundations for our future.

Shifting Tracks is an alternative indie-pop/rock band from Mobile, AL. Over the past three years we’ve worked hard to remain loyal to our fans and release an album every year filled with as much music as we could afford to put on a record. Well now we are ready to carry on this tradition and put out a fourth but instead of going that traditional route we want to record this 15 song album in its entirety.

Recording, mixing, and mastering an album can be very expensive and it only gets more costly with every song we put on a record. Our projected expenses by those traditional means would be about $10,000 which we found out is more than the cost to finish the studio we are already building for ourselves. So we thought, instead of asking for help to make one album let’s ask for help to build the foundations for all our future albums to come! It will be like every album is a personally crafted musical letter from us to you.

What we need to complete our studio

Right now we still need to complete the last bit of furnishing inside our building and then just upgrade our current equipment to a more professional level. Here’s the full breakdown!

Building (Total cost w/tax $1,160)

  • Sound deadening $519
  • Wall Paneling $536
Studio Upgrade (Equipment Essentials = $1,691)
  • Shure Beta52 (Mic) $189
  • Shure SM57 (Mics) $ 297 (3 @ $99)
  • AKG p420 (Mic) $199
  • AKG p170 (Mics) $158 (2 @ $79)
  • Shure SM7B (Mic) $349
  • Vocal Windscreen $18
  • Mackie MR5mk3 audio monitors $298 (2 @ $149)
  • Gator Frameworks monitor stands $119 (pair)
  • Furman m-8x2 outlet power conditioner $64
Studio Upgrade (Level 1 = $1,979)

  • Hover Mat Drum Floor isolation $279
  • Vox Guard $99
  • Great Gamma II Bass Floor isolation $99
  • SubDude HT Sub Floor isolation $79
  • BlueTube DP v2 Preamp $229
  • Behringer Powerplay 4 channel headphone amp $129
  • Audio-Technica ATH-M20 headphones $49
  • Presonus 10 Channel FireWire audio interface $399
  • LaCie D2 4TB hard drive $219
  • McDSP 6030 Compressor plugins $199
  • McDSP 6020 EQ plugins $199
Studio Upgrade (Level 2 = $2,293)

  • Pro Tools upgrade $599 (Download)
  • Gypsy Classic/Ethnic Virtual Instruments $295
  • Audio Creation Station Computer from Sweetwater $1399
Grand Total = $7,123

If we don’t reach our entire goal then what we have raised will go to completing our building and purchasing studio equipment by its necessity starting with essentials first and moving up in levels. If we raise more than we need then we’ll begin purchasing sound reinforcement materials to ensure absolute perfect frequency response within the building itself.

Perks of this campaign

We are bringing back all the old goodies from before and adding a bunch of new ones this year! Swag such as t-shirts, wristbands, and stickers are now available. A lucky few of donors will each receive a hangout day in studio while we record the album.

Your Impact!

We believe music is not only something to be enjoyed as an accent to various moments in our lives but also is something that influences who we are in life. With that, we feel, comes a responsibility to sing of the lofty ideals of human aspiration, expose hidden truths, and dive deep into who we are and where we are going. With every dollar you donate you are actually putting waves of musical vibes into the world, helping directly affect everyone who is touched by our music.

How to help even if you can’t chip in!

Please use the indie-go-go sharing tool to help get the word out about our campaign to every corner of earth! Sharing this campaign and encouraging others to contribute on a regular basis gives us the best chance of completing our goal. Think of every time you share it as putting out a goodwill vibe out into the universe. With enough of it, the world changes.

Studio Upgrade (Level 2 = $2,293)


Pro Tools upgrade $599 (Download)


Gypsy Classic/Ethnic Virtual Instruments
$295


Audio Creation Station Computer from
Sweetwater $1399




Grand Total = $7,123
If we don’t reach our entire goal then
what we have raised will go to completing our building and purchasing studio
equipment by its necessity starting with essentials first and moving up in
levels. If we raise more than we need then we’ll begin purchasing sound
reinforcement materials to ensure absolute perfect frequency response within
the building itself.
Perks of this campaign
We are bringing back all the old goodies
from before and adding a bunch of new ones this year! Swag such as t-shirts,
wristbands, and stickers are now available. A lucky few of donors will each
receive a hangout day in studio while we record the album.
Your Impact!
We believe music is not only something
to be enjoyed as an accent to various moments in our lives but also is something
that influences who we are in life. With that, we feel, comes a responsibility
to sing of the lofty ideals of human aspiration, expose hidden truths, and dive
deep into who we are and where we are going. With every dollar you donate you
are actually putting waves of musical vibes into the world, helping directly
affect everyone who is touched by our music.
How to help even if you can’t chip in!
Please use the indie-go-go sharing tool
to help get the word out about our campaign to every corner of earth! Sharing
this campaign and encouraging others to contribute on a regular basis gives us
the best chance of completing our goal. Think of every time you share it as
putting out a goodwill vibe out into the universe. With enough of it, the world
changes.

story:
Peter Jam: How it All Began...

With no budget or income, I carried my guitar, a handy-cam, my song (“If You Want”) and my vision with me, few years ago, starting off in Lebanon, with the goal of singing my peace song in three cities. This vision was only the beginning of what would become an ultimate journey that had me traveling in over forty countries worldwide, delivering motivational speeches at UN headquarters, universities, TV and radio stations, getting acknowledged as a human rights, justice and peace activist, and getting the title of “Ambassador for Peace” from UN-Affiliated Organizations.

What's Next?

Recently, I asked myself, “what’s next?” With a lot of hard work, I managed to release two albums and few singles, including tracks in English, Arabic, and Armenian, and I have worked extensively on my upcoming book. I have accomplished my EuropePeaceTour and am currently in the United States with the willpower to keep on sharing my positive message through the power of music, art, and speech. Upon meditating on what’s coming up, I decided to launch this project which is all about COLLECTIVE action that comes from COLLECTIVE awareness. I have been deeply inspired by the artists, activists, and children that I have worked with, and decided that just like all my other projects, this one will start with “you and me my friend!” What is different about this particular project is that the song that I have written “We All Need” will be recorded not by “Peter Jam,” but it will have us HEAR and LISTEN TO voices from different backgrounds, starting from here in the United States, using various cultural instruments, marching band and choir. The video will also have us SEE children, youth and people from all walks of life, from the East Coast to the West Coast, as we document our path together: uniting and sharing our need to take action as humans of the world to make peace and love a tangible reality. I truly believe that INSPIRATION can lead to TRANSFORMATION, and connecting through music can be the highest form of inspiration.

What is Needed & What You Get

This project is aimed to be achieved by the International Day of Peace (September 21). We have the song, we have the vision, and are set to kick it off!

What is Needed:

The funding for the audio and visual production of "We All Need". The song will be recorded in the form of a marching band and choir. The release of the CD (Single) requires recording equipment expenses as it will happen in various studios and locations, with different cultural instruments. Moreover, an important component of this project is the video/DVD that will document the journey and bring out the voices and images of the people joining together to make music. The budget includes travel expenses (tickets/accommodation). The peace-building tour will also include sessions for children and youth in music, peace education and non-violent communication.

What You Get:

- There are exciting perks in this project that start from as low as $1 to encourage all types of support and contribution. The perks include signed albums, video appearances, music lessons, healing bracelets and pendants, and possibilities to get your own words turned into a melody, or even to have your own song, on whichever subject that you like, from scratch! Your contribution will be acknowledged and your name will be mentioned in various online platforms. Perks also include highlighting your name in the project's CD and video. Make sure you check out all the perks, some of which are limited, and spread the word for us to make this project come to life!

                     If there is happiness in taking, there is joy in giving!


Other Ways You Can Help

Each and every dollar that you contribute to this project will make a difference. As a traveling musician and activist who believes that music can transcend boundaries, I know the challenges of contributing with financial resources. Therefore, I came up with various perks that will make it easier for all of us to bring this project to life. I genuinely hope you realize how the act of contributing one dollar is by itself an ACTION, and actions are louder than words! 

With that being said, words are also full of so much power and potential. Sharing the link on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms, as well as by word of mouth and telling friends about this exciting action, are all acts that would be deeply appreciated for #WeALLNeed. This project is waiting to happen, and it would not be possible without you and me my friend. Let's make it happen!

Thank You!!! We have completed the indiegogo phase with over 20% of the budget which will get us started. You Can still Contribute, Share & Spread the Word! Your kind donation is deeply appreciated at www.peterjam.com or info@peterjam.com via PayPal. 

Thank You again! Peter Jam




Note: The "Universality" Album is one of the perks! Check it out!

       


And a scarf, too!

story:
Dear Friends!

My company has just ended and I'd love to say a huge thank you to everyone who believed in my project and helped me and my team to make our wonderful music video. Even though we haven't reached our goal, you made us closer to acheve our dream and we're extremely grateful to you for it! Thank you so much for your belief!

Love,

Polyna & the team

story:
Shangalang Summary

I'm The New Bruce. I've artistically been around since the late 90's releasing my first cd single in '98 (I think I'm in love-ooh child).  2015 saw the release of my first full length cd (Stay Loose or Panic).  This year I am bring my brand of vibes and style known as Shangalang through a new 7 song EP.  It's important to me because as artists, we should never let anything stop our growth or expression of who we are.
 By being a part of this campaign, you are not only declaring your desire for me to succeed, but you are also declaring your own Shangalang!  You are the type that stands apart from the crowd! Gotta love that! 
 "Every road I walk, Every word I sang, I will think of you, a part of my Shangalang"

THE SHANGALANG INGREDIENTS!

Here's the breakdown, folks:

Funding will go toward the finishing of the studio time, legalities, video, 

and manufacturing.  I have atight shangalang budget to get this done. 

I have chosen "amazing, creative, and fun" perks as my way of saying "Thank You". Truthfully I am so blessed to have you in my corner rooting for me and "SHANGALANG". I'm excited and I want you to be also! I have created fantastic EP GIFTS including: DIGITAL ART PICS, AND INCLUSION IN THE EP CREDITS and more

If this campaign doesn't reach its goal, I will use what I raise to finish, but I will do what I must to get the rest. The SHANGALANG must go on!

The Impact

Your pledge will make a difference:

Have you ever played a part in discovering an artist? You know that feeling you get when you turn someone on to a new performer? Now you can say you helped create this EP, because that is EXACTLY WHAT YOU'RE DOING.

I have successfully self published 13 books, and a CD (Stay Loose or Panic!:2015). There is nothing you can't do when you are determined.

Let's get real. I work a 8-11 hr a day job like many of you and then come home to be reminded of what my dreams are but I'm so exhausted, When do we take control? YOU CAN'T STOP THE SHANGALANG! 

Risks & Challenges

There are many challenges to being an indie artist. Having to do the creative and the management work, building a following, fighting off critics, raising your own funds. Should that stop us at all? It makes things hard, but no, it won't stop my Shangalang! I am a determined creator. I AM A DETERMINED ARTIST.

Other Ways You Can Shangalang:

Some people just can't pledge, but that doesn't mean they can't participate:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the Shangalang EP project.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools also!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
'Beat Beautiful & Loaded' - Vol 4 -  LP/CD/DD 

  • Vocals :  Ruby Florence  Gärance Moonfløwer  Louise Turner  Chris Free  Gabriela Giacoman  Sara Onyett
  • Keyboards : Sean O'Hanrahan   Guitars   Chris Free   Bass Sara Onyett  
  • Drums :  Rod Norman  John Metcalfe  Percussion  Ivan Pedersen
  • Songs : Chris Free

This will be a stellar collection of songs performed with all the fire & finesse you could wish for. The material is all written and arranged and is very strong. Backing tracks of guitar bass & drums to 3/4 of the album have already been recorded. Next we will add keyboards, saxophone, trumpet and  the final vocal tracks.  

What You Give & What You Get

  • We need  your support contributions for 
  • Recording, mixing & mastering 
  • Pressing 180gram Vinyl LP  with  colour cover / printing CD with digi pack cover 

Your Impact 

  • You will be contributing to a genuine non corporate independent work of art. Without your contributions this will not happen.

The 3 previous Sound Of Pop Art  releases  have received  very good reviews  :

TSOPA - Vol 1 

  • "A minor masterpiece these timeless slices of sunshine combine killer hooks, insidious lyrics and superb choruses."  R2 Magazine - Dave Halsam  
  • "A Cracking Album" - Paolo Hewitt 

TSOPA - Pop Art Trip - Vol 2 

  • "The record is a grab-bag of pop goodness. There's the girl group-meets-The Turtles vibe of "True to Your Soul" and The Kinks-ish concerns of "Suburban Living" The album nods in the direction of The Mamas and the Papas, or even "Stoned Soul Picnic" by The Fifth Dimension, on "Let's Get Lost" with its lazy Sunday mood and closes on the equally strong "Scavengers and Thieves" which recalls nothing so much as The Style Council. The Sound of Pop Art are creating hits that seem like lost treasures from another era that you've never heard until now."  Glenn Kenixfan A Pessimist is Never Dissappointed 

TSOPA - Drama - Vol 3  

  • "Drama will be in my top three releases when the year comes to a close without a shadow of a doubt." Sussed Magazine
  • "TSOPA burnish their credentials as the accomplished masters of a range of 60s styles from Bacharach infused dreamy psych-pop, overlain with cinematic cascades to driving R&B" Shindig Magazine
  • "Freedom is the 2016 pop tune of choice for the sussed generation.” Sweet But Deadly
  • "Infectious sixties inspired quality pop" NUTs Mag

Timetable of events, leading to release 

  • All backings to 10 songs  finished by mid- September 
  • All vocals recorded beyond of September 
  • Mixing & mastering October 
  • Artwork  for LP & CD sleeves October 
  • Vinyl and CDs printed November / December

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this project - we want to make the best work possible .
  • So please use the  Indiegogo social media share tools!

Thank you in advance, get involved  and  lets make this happen ! X

story:
I've been asked, time and time again... "When are you going to record a new album?" I wish there was a simple answer to this, because I would have recorded one YESTERDAY. Being the perfectionist that I am, the thought of launching an album production haphazardly, just concerns me. It's gotta be good!

But plain and simple, a new recording project entails respectable costs... and being a recording artist with no major record label to provide finances during the creation process, even when making the most frugal efforts to make it happen, can be somewhat daunting. Very frustrating indeed!

And... LIFE just seemed to get in the way, as it often does, and one year led into three... and so on. Other duties and responsibilities were priority... raising our daughter especially. But all along this goal continued to weigh heavier and heavier on my mind. Next thing I knew... nearly EIGHT years had passed.

However meanwhile, the past few years HAVE been pretty exciting! I've been blessed with the experiences of performing in New York City, Las Vegas, Hollywood, Los Angeles, Chinatown and several other cities. I have met and worked with some really amazing people. 

Below is a highlights video of several of these incredible memories and moments...

I've had the privilege of enjoying other performance opportunities in the meantime... usually with an instrumental trio or using background tracks. Always fun. But all along that undying urge to step things up and record a new and better album continued to taunt and frustrate me! IT WAS TIME TO RECORD A FOLLOWUP ALBUM.

So now it´s 2017 and the voice in my head is screaming "Time to make a move J-E-B! Time to suck it up and ask for help." So, I am humbly reaching out to you today to seek your sponsorship with my next album project, which has been in the planning stages for the past 3 years, and a new corner to turn which I am most excited about! In my own J-E-B style, this time around I pay homage to the great pop sounds of the late sixties (some amazing music). Not strictly big band and the Great American Songbook and such, but rather, the slightly more mainstream of classic 1960's radio pop hits.

A fine album CAN be recorded, without spending insane money!

Thanks to valuable input from a circle of respected and knowledgeable music industry friends, I am encouraged that something incredible CAN be accomplished within my very modest budget. These funds will be directed toward costs of arranging, studio sessions, musicians, production, photography, licensing/clearances, manufacturing & packaging, promotion... and distribution.

THE MUSIC... OHHH... THIS SWEET MUSIC.

Cultivating a list of terrific songs the past few years resulted in selections possessing great lyrics, and infectious melodies! These include potential selections (and not necessarily their bigger hits) originally recorded by Engelbert Humperdinck,Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Nat King Cole, Tom Jones, Sammy Davis Jr., Andy Williams... SO many singable songs to consider!

A few of the terrific songs we have selected...

Quiet Nights (Englebert Humperdinck)
Happy Heart (Andy Williams)
Yes I Can (Sammy Davis, Jr.)
Wichita Lineman (Tom Jones/Glen Campbell)
S’posin’ (Dean Martin)

Doesn't ring a bell? Look them up on YouTube! Terrific songs much worthy of new life.

My super-talented brother in arms... arranger, producer, engineer and keyboardist Damien Montalto in Australia is at the production helm of this new project (with considerable input from J-E-B) and after plenty of time to plan, we are poised to put the wheels into motion.

We are just missing ONE very important element... EFFECTIVE financing! I AM without a doubt utilizing some of my own savings towards this effort, but it's not enough. For more insight, please watch the video above and consider sponsoring this very special album project.

SPEAKING OF GIVING: I don't wish to make this effort "ALL about ME". I feel compelled to add that I will be gladly donating 10% of ALL pledges to a very worthy cause that is close to my heart. My good friend Anuparti Ravi performs devoted missionary work in South India involving restoring manually pumped bore wells (fresh drinking water) for small tribal villages and delivering other much needed "conveniences" we often take for granted. We've already made a great difference for these people and hope to continue the efforts. Gotta do my part!

EVERY dollar makes a difference.  I am GRATEFUL for your assistance. The end result will be nothing less than stellar.

I truly hope you can help me make this happen.

Again, I am super excited to begin this long overdue, and highly anticipated recording project and share it with the world! YOUR kind assistance is greatly appreciated. I just know you will love what is next on the J-E-B musical horizon!

My good friend Anuparti Ravi performs devoted missionary work in South India involving restoring manually pumped bore wells (fresh drinking water) for small tribal villages and delivering other much needed "conveniences" we often take for granted. We've already made a great difference for these people and hope to continue the efforts. Gotta do my part!
EVERY dollar makes a difference.  I am GRATEFUL for your assistance. The end result will be nothing less than stellar.
I truly hope you can help me make this happen.
Again, I am super excited to begin this long overdue, and highly anticipated recording project and share it with the world! YOUR kind assistance is greatly appreciated. I just know you will love what is next on the J-E-B musical horizon!

story:
About Inner Circle CD

  • My name is Mikhail Kirilin and i was club events promoter for more than 10 years. In 2013 i started Harder & Louder Recordings to develop my interest in underground music genres. After 4 years H&L became one of the scene-known music dealers. I've prepared and released 2 physical releases, one of this was successfully crowdfunded on Indiegogo in the 2016. Harder & Louder helped a lot of beginners to show their music to the worldwide listeners. Right now we are working together with Árpád Szrnka aka Savage, hungarian promoter, producer and co-owner of Harder & Louder who's helping to distribute our hard releases.
  • Inner Circle CD is our new project, idea is to gather best music producers of the underground Europe. This is not just a Various Artists album, this is strong concept of close friends circle who supports hard music with pure passion and love. This CD project is valuable because we're independent from big companies, distributors: all label success depends on our fanbase and followers only. 
  • Music artists involved for this project:  Freqax, BSA, Savage, eDUB, Gorebug, Peter Kurten, Throttler, Suicide, Mystification, Hardlogik. Some special guests can be added too: we'll see how campaign is going and will keep you informed about roster additions.
  • We need contributors help to print 100 copies of the CD, cover the artists & designer fee: we're not asking for funds, we're inviting you to became a part of big music project! You will receive a lot of bonus content like our digital music catalog, previous CD "Even Harder" and, above everything, you can be co-producer, mentioned on the CD cover.

What We Need & What You Get

  • 1200 euro we need = 100 euro cover design fee + 200 euro for mastering + 300 euro CD printing (100 copies) + 500 euro artists fee + 100 euro for shipping copies to artists. That's all we need.
  • Our perks will give you a lot of bonus content: you can choose CDs, digital copies of all our catalog. We have extra perk - your name will be on the CD cover as co-producer.
  • If we're not taking full sum - release will be prepared for digital distribution and all the backers will receive it as Full HQ download and bonus content from Harder & Louder like Even Harder CD, full label catalog (60+ releases), merchandise. For top backers i will make refund ASAP. As you can see, our campaign for Suicide CD failed, but we successfully released this one as digital and contacted all the backers to solve the possible problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the information to friends with link to the page: even 1 repost will help this project greatly. Thank you!
