story:
Hier klicken für deutsche Version!

Join Peter's quest to record a Jazz- and Crossover Cello-Album!


Who am I?

Hello, my name is Peter Hudler, I am a classical educated cellist from Vienna/Austria. After my studies both in Vienna and Salzburg with some of the finest Austrian musicians I have been working the last years in various classical music formations, as a freelancer and fully employed, including Camerata Salzburg, the Irish Chamber Orchestra, the Danish Chamber Players and others. Here's a short clip for you: 



Recently I have discovered my wish to develop myself more and embrace new musical styles and concepts and my first adventure lead me into the world of Jazz and Cross Over. 
And here I am, with a full evening Jazz and Cross-Over program for Cello Solo, diverse and virtuosic, tender and powerful, depicting the great range of colors and characters  the cello offers, that urgently needs to be promoted and spread amongst the people! 

What's the idea of the campaign?

The idea is: To make a  professional studio recording of this program to help this project to grow. For getting concerts, gigs or tours, the most important thing is to be able to present a very good and professionally made recording. Plus: It is a great opportunity for myself to be able to work in a studio because in these situations every musician simply has to perform and work at their absolute best. 
In any case it will warm my heart to give birth to this album and it will hopefully also warm yours, with the passionate and soothing qualities of the cello that come out so greatly with this kind of music!




What's going to be on the album?


Here's the program - not yet in its final order - like I intend to record it on the album: 

Erwin Schulhoff: Hot Sonata
Phillip Glass: Orbit
Nikolai Kapustin: Introduktion und Scherzino
Lucio Amanti: Jazz Suite
Erik Friedlander: Night White
Giovanni Sollima: Lamentatio
Mark o’Connor: Appalachian Waltz
Svane Henryson: Black Run
Mark Summer: Julie-O
Mark Summer: Kalimba

Bonus Track: Hurrian Hymn #6


What will it cost?

And here is what it costs to produce this kind of recording: 

recording time/studio, 19 hours:                             1235  EUR
post production, 19 hours:                                         1235  EUR
piano tuning:                                                                        92 EUR
CD layout, booklet design                                            600 EUR
CD production (500 pieces)                                        590 EUR                             
musicians                                                                           300 EUR
administration costs                                                      300 EUR
TOTAL                                                                               4352 EUR

I shall be very grateful for your donations! I have also made a list of exclusive and personal rewards for you and your generosity will be known to the people who buy this album! 
In case we don't reach the goal, I will at least make a shorter demo recording of 2 or 3 pieces, which would turn out to be much cheaper as the studio and postproduction time is payed by hour. 
In case we exceed the goal, there will be more time to record than planned and/or I can print more CDs. 

Why do we need this recording?

So why do we need this album?  I have chosen the music to this program very carefully and it's supposed to have a strong impact also regarded as a whole concept, from the first note to the last. Cello in Jazz has a long history, anyway many of the pieces I chose have never been recorded yet even though they definitely deserve it. 
As a musician I am always searching to grasp a deep understanding of the music, to reach the essence of the piece, its character and I try to convey this to the audience. A good performance is for me when I feel free to play from my heart and touch my audience, to move the people and reach their hearts. It's a lot about communication and about some kind of urge to tell the audience what this music is, what it is about, and to experience it together.
With this program I hope I can connect the depth of the music, how I feel and know it as a classical musician with the power and vitality of Cross Over and Jazz, that I can communicate to you the rich and colorful variety of characters in this music with the understanding of a classical trained musician. 


What else is there to know? 

One very special piece I have arranged myself and I would like to record it together with a friend of mine, Nikolaus Wagner, an Austrian pianist. This will be the only non-solo piece. Originally for Saxophone and Piano, Erwin Schulhoff's jazzy "Hot Sonata" I arranged to be played on the cello and it works surprisingly well like this! So this is going to be a WORLD PREMIERE RECORDING of a piece by a composer whose worth and talent was underestimated for decades. 
As an additional Bonus Track I have chosen another special piece. Looking for  "archaic"music, I found the most archaic, oldest piece of music ever to be written down in the history of mankind. It was written on a stone in Latakia/Syria 1400 BC. Originally played on the Lyra, I will record this "Hurrian Hymn" to the goddess Nikkal, wife of the moon god, on the cello, for THE FIRST TIME as well, trying to invoke the spirit of the Lyra, of the goddess Nikkal and a very very ancient time. 

Let me sum it up.

I have been dreaming of doing this for quite some while now, and the only thing that has been in the way of realizing this project has been the financial pressure I am under as a freelancing musican, who has no fix income and has to find concerts and projects by himself every month. With this recording I can make a huge step of getting my music out to the people and become more established as a Cellist and musician in a new field and a new genre and bring this beautiful music out to the people.


You don't have any money to spare?

In case you cannot help financially (and I am the first one to understand this) you can also support this project by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your network, friends, family and colleagues. Indiegogo provides all the tools for you to do that.

Thank you very much and I hope you will enjoy the outcome of this project/campaign!

Peter


Deutsche Version

Unterstütze Peter's Studio-Aufnahme eines Jazz und Cross Over Cello Albums!





Hallo, mein Name ist Peter Hudler, ich bin ein klassisch ausgebildeter Cellist aus Wien/Österreich. Nachdem ich am Konservatorium Wien und am Mozarteum Salzburg studiert habe, war ich in den letzten Jahren in verschiedenen Ensembles und Orchestern tätig, freischaffend und auch angestellt, ua. bei der Camerata Salzburg, beim Irish Chamber Orchestra und bei den Danish Chamber Players. Hier ein kleiner Clip: 





Im letzten Jahr habe ich begonnen mich auch für andere Stile und Genres zu interessieren und meine erste Entdeckungsreise hat mich in die Welt der Jazz und des Cross Over geführt.

Also habe ich, mit sehr viel Freude, aber mir auch der Herausforderung bewusst,  ein abendfüllendes Programm zusammengestellt mit den verschiedensten Stücken für Cello, fast alle solo, die, wie ich hoffe, auf kontrastreiche Weise die vielfältigen Farben, Charaktere und Spielweisen darstellen, die man auf dem Cello mit dieser Musik darstellen kann. 


Was ist die Idee der Kampagne?


Meine Idee ist: Ich möchte eine professionelle Studioaufnahme von diesem Programm machen, um diesem Projekt Auftrieb zu verleihen. Einerseits ist es wichtig, ausgezeichnete Tonmaterialien zu haben, um Engagements zu bekommen, andererseits finde ich das Programm selbst wertvoll und ganz sicherlich eine Bereicherung für Zuhörer und hoffentlich auch für Cellisten, die abseits vorgegebener Wege gehen wollen!




Was wird auf der CD sein? 

Hier das Programm, wie ich es gerne aufnehmen möchte: 

Erwin Schulhoff: Hot Sonata
Phillip Glass: Orbit
Nikolai Kapustin: Introduktion und Scherzino
Lucio Amanti: Jazz Suite
Erik Friedlander: Night White
Giovanni Sollima: Lamentatio
Mark o’Connor: Appalachian Waltz
Svane Henryson: Black Run
Mark Summer: Julie-O
Mark Summer: Kalimba
Bonus Track: Hurrian Hymn #6


Was sind die Kosten? 


Und das ist der Kostenvoranschlag für das Projekt: 

Aufnahmezeit im Studio 19h:                             1235 EUR
Nachbearbeitung 19h:                                           1235 EUR
Klavierstimmung:                                                        92 EUR
CD layout, booklet design                                      600 EUR
CD Produktion (500 Stück)                                   590 EUR                                       
Musiker                                                                         300 EUR
Administration                                                           300 EUR

SUMME                                                                       4352 EUR


Ich wäre sehr dankbar für einen Beitrag zu diesem Projekt! Ich habe natürlich exklusive und persönliche Geschenke („perks“) ausgewählt, und grössere Spenden werden im Booklet als Sponsor angeführt! 

Wenn wir das angestrebte Ziel nicht erreichen, werde ich einfach weniger Zeit im Studio verbringen und zumindest einige Nummern aufnehmen. Wenn mehr reinkommt, können wir auch mehr aufnehmen bzw. genauer. 


Warum so ein Programm aufnehmen? 


Ich habe lange an der Zusammenstellung dieses Programms gearbeitet und viel recherchiert und gesucht und ich hoffe dass es als Gesamtkonzept eine gute Wirkung hat und Sinn macht. 

Das Cello hat im Jazz eine lange Geschichte, trotzdem sind viele der Stücke, die ich ausgesucht habe, noch nie aufgenommen worden, oder selten, obwohl sie es verdienen. 

Das Interessante am Jazz und Cross Over ist für mich, dass ich einerseits mein Verständnis und meine Suche nach Tiefe und Struktur, wie ich es aus der klassischen Musik kenne, einbringen kann und andererseits die Möglichkeit habe, frei zu spielen, mich mit der mehr archaischen Kraft dieses Genres zu verbinden und das hat mir als Musiker sehr geholfen und neue Potentiale in mir zum Vorschein gebracht. Ich hoffe natürlich, dass auch die Zuhörer dieses Erfrischende und Belebende, das ich empfunden habe, spüren werden können!



Noch etwas?


Ein Stück ist etwas sehr besonderes, einerseits weil es das einzige ist, bei dem ich mit Klavier zusammen spielen werde, mit meinem Freund und Kollegen Klaus Wagne, andererseits weil ich es selbst arrangiert habe und es in dieser Form definitiv die allererste Aufnahme sein wird: Erwin Schulhoffs „Hot Sonata“ ist ursprünglich für Altsaxophon und Klavier geschrieben worden, ein jazziges Stück in klassischer Sonatenform, das auf dem Cello sehr gut klingt!

Als „Bonus Track“ möchte ich ein ganz spezielles Stück aufnehmen, und zwar das älteste jemals geschriebene Musikstück, aus dem Jahr 1400 vor Christus. Ursprünglich für Lyra geschrieben, habe ich diese aus dem heutigen Syrien stammende Stück für das Cello transponiert, um mit diesem „Hurrian Hymn“ die Mondgöttin Nikkal  heraufzubeschwören und den Geist der Lyra und einer lang vergangenen Zeit auf dem Cello zu erwecken.


Zusammenfassend… 


Ich habe mich lange darauf gefreut und mir gewünscht, dieses Projekt voranzubringen und bisher ist es nur am Geld gescheitert, da ich als freischaffender Musiker nicht immer die höchsten Gagen bekomme.

Mit dieser Aufnahme wäre mir sehr geholfen, da sie mir neue Türen öffnen würde in einem Genre und einer Szene, die mir bisher verschlossen war. 


Kein Geld? 


Wenn Sie kein Geld spenden können oder wollen, würde ich bitten, die Kampagne zu teilen, mit Familenmitgliedern, facebook-Freunden etc., damit möglichst viele Menschen davon hören. Indiegogo stellt dafür die nötigen Mittel zur Verfügung! Abgesehen davon hilft auch ein ganz kleiner Betrag (1 Euro) der Kampagne weiter, weil je mehr Leute involviert sind, desto präsenter wird die Kampagne auf dieser Seite!

Vielen Dank und ich hoffe Ihnen gefällt das Ergebnis dieser Kampagne!

Peter

Das Cello hat im Jazz eine lange Geschichte, trotzdem sind viele der Stücke, die ich ausgesucht habe, noch nie aufgenommen worden, oder selten, obwohl sie es verdienen. 
Das Interessante am Jazz und Cross Over ist für mich, dass ich einerseits mein Verständnis und meine Suche nach Tiefe und Struktur, wie ich es aus der klassischen Musik kenne, einbringen kann und andererseits die Möglichkeit habe, frei zu spielen, mich mit der mehr archaischen Kraft dieses Genres zu verbinden und das hat mir als Musiker sehr geholfen und neue Potentiale in mir zum Vorschein gebracht. Ich hoffe natürlich, dass auch die Zuhörer dieses Erfrischende und Belebende, das ich empfunden habe, spüren werden können!



Noch etwas?

Ein Stück ist etwas sehr besonderes, einerseits weil es das einzige ist, bei dem ich mit Klavier zusammen spielen werde, mit meinem Freund und Kollegen Klaus Wagne, andererseits weil ich es selbst arrangiert habe und es in dieser Form definitiv die allererste Aufnahme sein wird: Erwin Schulhoffs „Hot Sonata“ ist ursprünglich für Altsaxophon und Klavier geschrieben worden, ein jazziges Stück in klassischer Sonatenform, das auf dem Cello sehr gut klingt!
Als „Bonus Track“ möchte ich ein ganz spezielles Stück aufnehmen, und zwar das älteste jemals geschriebene Musikstück, aus dem Jahr 1400 vor Christus. Ursprünglich für Lyra geschrieben, habe ich diese aus dem heutigen Syrien stammende Stück für das Cello transponiert, um mit diesem „Hurrian Hymn“ die Mondgöttin Nikkal  heraufzubeschwören und den Geist der Lyra und einer lang vergangenen Zeit auf dem Cello zu erwecken.

Zusammenfassend… 

Ich habe mich lange darauf gefreut und mir gewünscht, dieses Projekt voranzubringen und bisher ist es nur am Geld gescheitert, da ich als freischaffender Musiker nicht immer die höchsten Gagen bekomme.
Mit dieser Aufnahme wäre mir sehr geholfen, da sie mir neue Türen öffnen würde in einem Genre und einer Szene, die mir bisher verschlossen war. 

Kein Geld? 

Wenn Sie kein Geld spenden können oder wollen, würde ich bitten, die Kampagne zu teilen, mit Familenmitgliedern, facebook-Freunden etc., damit möglichst viele Menschen davon hören. Indiegogo stellt dafür die nötigen Mittel zur Verfügung! Abgesehen davon hilft auch ein ganz kleiner Betrag (1 Euro) der Kampagne weiter, weil je mehr Leute involviert sind, desto präsenter wird die Kampagne auf dieser Seite!
Vielen Dank und ich hoffe Ihnen gefällt das Ergebnis dieser Kampagne!
Peter

story:
Background

Brian LaPoint & the Joints was founded in 2013. The first official performance took place on January 26th, 2013, at Valentines in Albany, NY. Since then it has been a revolving line-up of some the areas finest musicians, led by singer/songwriter Brian LaPoint. This eclectic mix of musicians allows us to deliver a unique sound and blend together all the genres we've come to love and share. 

There has been great support for our original material, and we finally have our chance to give them the recordings they deserve. We have given away our last demo, it's time to release our full-length, DEBUT ALBUM! 

Our Goal

It's simple!  We want to get our music out to the world and we want you to have the best quality album to listen to that we can make. To do that, all we ask is for you to pre-order your copy. This guarantees that you will have a copy of the debut album as soon as it is released this June. By pre-ordering our album, not only does it ensure that you get a first hand look at our work... It means you are an integral part of it. Without you, we would not able to reach our goal. Which is not only producing our first album, it's a far greater picture, it's where our future may lead. 

What It Takes

An album takes a hefty budget; for us $4,000 to be exact. We're saving a lot of money by self-producing, recording, editing, and mixing the entire album; which would usually cost more than $4,000 on it's own. Here's some expenses we still run into though:

  • $1,500 - Duplication/Printing (CD's, Download Cards)
  • $500 - Mastering 
  • $500 - Album Artwork 
  • $500 - Album Merchandise 
  • $500 - Advertising 
  • $500 - Copyrights

Perks 

There's plenty of perks in it for you! Browse through all of the options before you pick one. For as low as $12, you can guarantee yourself a digital download of our debut album the day it releases. $20 will get you a physical copy (CD). $50 or more will get your name printed on all copies of the album, in recognition of your contribution to our work. Only $60 for a complete merchandise package, including a limited edition T-Shirt and Signed Poster. $150 and we will record a cover song of your choice, and send you a digital download to listen to forever... Contribute $420 and we'll come to your home and rock you to sleep. EVERY DOLLAR GETS YOU SOMETHING, INCLUDING OUR ENDLESS GRATITUDE!!!


The Impact

This is our future we're talking about. A lot of energy and time went into recording this album, but we're not done. Ever dollar we make puts another CD in the hand of a potential fan. From inspiration to publication, this is where it all lies. This album is not only a debut for our original music, but also as a producers and engineers. We hope you thoroughly enjoy listening to our work as much as we appreciate your support!


Other Ways You Can Help!

We understand some people can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We need you to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to easily share with friends!
  • Use Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, or any other social media.

And that's all there is to it, see you at the Album Release Party, June 19th at the Rustic Barn Pub. 

THANK YOU!

story:
Last winter, we traveled to Springfield, MO and recorded our debut EP with our friend Kevin Gates. It was everything we had hoped it would be and it created a big response, especially on social media! However, as a new band, there were things we never considered when it came to releasing the EP. We didn't create a budget, and we never knew how important and expensive it was that we invest in publicity and good press so that the music we worked hard on actually got heard. As our producer Kevin always says, "a great song that's never heard is like a toy that's never played with." We feel like we have learned enough as a band with our first record not to make these same mistakes again on our second one, and that's where we desperately need your help.


We have decided to record a new record this summer! We will travel to Missouri in June and we are so super stoked! We want to make sure that we have the money and resources to make this new record amount to as much as it possibly can. We want as many ears to hear our new music as possible, so we're asking for your help financially. From the recording of the songs, to mastering, to artwork, logos, photographs, touring, travel expenses, publicist costs, and all other promotional material to push a record, it gets VERY expensive. Not to mention that all of this leaves us creatively exhausted. We want to make a record that stands tall where our first EP fell short. We will be offering some super cool perks and prizes as incentives for your donations! We can't do this without all of you. You guys have been here to help us since day 1, and we already know your contributions are the only thing making this record possible for us. This is your music! Help us get it out there!

We love you ALL!

--Love Brooklyn

story:
Who We Are

Sleep Signals is an independent, nationally touring rock band from Minneapolis, MN. We are returning to the studio in April to record our third release and we need your help to make it happen.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $10,000 USD for this album to cover the cost of recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, pressing, and distribution. We have already invested over $6,000 of our own money into the first single from the record (I'll Save You), that we released as a precursor for the album on 1/27/17. Your pledge helps us make this new album a reality!

We have a bunch of awesome limited-time perks in return for your contribution!

The Impact

Without label support, we are fully responsible for all of the costs related to putting out a new record. With your help, we can release this new album, put out a new music video, and get back out onto the road to tour!

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges to creating a new album. This is the third studio album we have written and we wrote over 40 candidates for this new record. We are deeply involved into the process of moving the record forward already and we have already recorded, mixed, and mastered one of the five tracks. Nothing will stop us from finishing this album!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign, you CAN still help! Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media outlets, helps us reach our fans! Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us make this campaign a success!

Thank you so much for helping us fund our new album! We are eternally grateful for all of the support we get from our fans and we appreciate it more than words can express! We can't wait for you to hear this new record!

Exclusive Limited Run T-Shirt/Hoodie Design:

Tour-Used Stage Scrims:

These are the 6'x6' stage scrims (see those giant Sleep Signals banners?!) that we used over the past two years on all of our tours, and now they can be YOURS! Only 2 available, so get 'em while you can!

story:
WTSQ is more than a radio station. We are a hub for the talent and creativity in our community. We serve Charleston, West Virginia and the greater Kanawha Valley with independent music curated and hosted by fifty passionate volunteers.

We've been on the air for a little more than eighteen months. In that brief time, we've become embedded in the life of the Charleston area. Countless local musicians have played at the station. We regularly interview folks from local non-profits, creative groups, and businesses. You may have seen us at events like Live on the Levee and ArtWalk.

We are here because we love Charleston and want to make it the best place it can be.

Join Us.

From March 31  - April 7, we want to raise $15,000. That money goes straight to our operating costs - things like rent, utilities, and web hosting. Microphones, computers, and cables. Funds from this year's drive will also help us relaunch an updated WTSQ.org, a project that will cost several thousand dollars.

What do you get when you give?

The satisfaction that comes when you are part of something special. WTSQ exists for the community, and it is the community that provides 100% or our support. We don't sell advertising, and we don't get money from federal or state government sources.

We do have a pretty cool t-shirt that was lovingly designed for us by Dog and Pony Press in Piney,  West Virginia. When you contribute at the $40 level, we will gladly send you one. The design was hand-carved from a wood block. We love the work put into this project because we are hand-made too.

Please support your community radio station - handmade just for Charleston.  We appreciate contributions in any amount. Thank you!

story:
**Please email me at karalockwood9@gmail.com with any questions as the email attached to this campaign is my old one. Thanks :) ** 

Who is Kara?

I am a blossoming young folk rock indie artist who in many ways is just beginning to step into my potential. I wrote first my EP "Free Child" https://karalockwood.bandcamp.com and had it was recorded and produced by Jim Kwan at the Creativ Music Centre in North Vancouver. Now after several shows in the Vancouver area, 1 Cross Canada Tour and my debut EP under my belt, I am ready to take my music to the next level. 

 

This campaign is for you and about you, my fans, supporters and future fans and supporters! With out you I could not make this happen! I have 6 songs written and ready to go, dates set in May at Blue Light Studio and the Lovely Bre McDaniel http://www.bremcdaniel.com will be doing my album artwork! 

 

 With your help I will be able to fund this musical project that has been close to my heart for years. Together we will build a strong family and community around my music that will stretch from sea to shining sea. My heart is to connect with people through the music and that's really what it's about! 

 

What I'm Asking For and What You Get in Return

So to bring this project to life I need your help! I am asking for $8000 + to make this happen. And I know asking is not always easy but most things worth doing in life aren't always quick and easy. So your contributions will go towards the following costs: 

Production and Studio Time: $6500

Outside Musicians to come into the studio: $900

Album Design and Artwork: $500

Mastering: $450

Printing of 300 CD's : $1000 

The project will come close to 10,000 to make, but I am leaving some room for me to fund it as well through my work, shows, busking and other misc ventures. Together we can make "Creative Heart" happen!

Of course I won't leave you hanging! In return for your generous donations you will get some amazing perks! Please see the right side bar for the list of what you can get. 

 

The Impact

I believe we were not put on this earth to go about life on our own. Creating art and music is a community effort. We weren't meant to hide ourselves and our art in our rooms and closets. So this is me putting myself out there and asking you to come on this journey with me. You will help me get my art out there to the people that need to hear it.

 

It Won't All Be Easy but I'm Committed! 

Putting yourself out there, asking for help and being vulnerable are not at all easy!  However I know I can't pursue and live my musical calling without your help. My commitment to you and this campaign is to be all in. I will treat it as a 2nd job and will seek to frequently update as well as post pictures and videos. 

 

Tight on Money But Still Want to Help? 

I recognize that everyone is at different levels financially in their lives. Not everyone can contribute financially to this project. If you can't then no problem! You can help me by spreading the word through social media (see the sharing buttons at the top right of the campaign), word of mouth, email and other platforms. 

 

Thanks from the bottom of my 'creative heart' and I can't wait to go on this journey and share this album with you!

story:
Jenna Syde & The Watchers need the help of our Watcher Army members to tour across the U.S. in the summer of 2017

We are Jenna Syde & The Watchers, a 5 piece, female fronted, hard rock act from Hollywood, California

We have a new album we want to play for the public but touring funds are short when you are a small, independent band.

With your contribution we will be able to keep touring cost out of our own pockets which means we can: Pay for our van rental, sleeping arrangements, gas, food and still be able to pay our bills and feed our families when we come home.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to hit a total of $6000 by the end of our campaign. $2500 goes to van rental, $1000 to gas, $500 food, $1000 for motels, $1000 for emergency expenses, example.... van breakdown, medical issues, equipment breakdown or stolen gear.

Our perks range from personal video thank yous to signed musical gear and all are sent our with an extra piece of swag you can only get from this campaign.

if we don't meet our goal we will still use the funds we have raised to help us along the way but of course we will have to pull some cash out of our own pockets ( because when we set out to do something we freaking do it no matter what!)

The Impact

The impact of your contribution means we get to spread our music to a much wider audience and grow our bands fan base in places we wouldn't normally be able to reach.

In this day and age where people sit on their phones and computers all day we believe that live music, art, and performances are the last thing that truly bring us all together.

Our summer campaign two years ago nearly doubled our fan base and our music was able to reach people all across the west coast and south west from ages 5-85 years old.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you cant help.

even if you cant afford to contribute just getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign is a huge help!

You can share our indiegogo campaign through all social media platforms, text, email and even your own blogs.

We thank you so much for your time and hope you rock your faces off out on the road!

story:
WHO AM I AND THE JOURNEY SO FAR

I’m Yasmin Kadi - an independent singer song-writer chosen by BBC Introducing as "some of London's best new music" and whose debut EP went to No.1 on iTunes Ireland in 2014. My music style is a mix of Afrobeats & Pop.

I've performed alongside the likes of Paloma Faith at the 02 Forum, headlined WOW Festival at the Royal Festival Hall Southbank London and played many festivals around the UK. I wrote and sang the top line melody for an episode in the American TV Series “Tyrant” staring Chris Noth aka Mr. Big. I've also performed live on several BBC Radio Shows, worked for the likes of BBC TV, Channel 4, Virgin Media, Universal Channel etc. and have had national radio play in Ireland, the UK and Sierra Leone in the last 12 months.

After my Debut EP charted at No.1 on iTunes Ireland, it lead me onto a UK tour with MOBO Award winning Hip Hop veteran Roots Manuva. While I was on tour, the makers of “Guitar Hero Live” (the video game) saw me and I landed the lead female role in the band “Vivid Screamz” in the game while I’m also in the boss level.

All of these experiences reassured me that I don’t have to change and become someone else in order to be successful, so now I am independently recording and releasing my debut album "No Drama".

The creation of this album is even more important now than ever because it promotes us as individuals and is about us embracing our true selves with all our "flaws". There is so much pressure in our society to look and be like all the girls and boys on TV. But no two people are alike, not even identical twins who are a division of the same egg.

So help me stay true to myself and my artistry. To make great music without copying some other popular artist, without plugging things I don't believe in, without promoting the temporary, shallow, self-obsessed unrealistic picture perfect world we live in - which leads to anxiety about our true selves. Let’s get back to the music: lyrics you can sing to that actually mean something, melody that makes you want to dance and embracing our differences.

Stay true to yourself! You don't have to join the system! Create, Live, Love, Laugh and JUST B U :)

SOME OF THE SPECIAL PERKS

  • Signed “No Drama” book mark with your name hand written
  • Signed “No Drama” A 5 size Post card & hand written thank you note
  • A digital download of the album directly from me -  straight to your email address. Very high quality sound that you would not be able to get on iTunes because of the file sizes. 
  • Signed physical album
  • Shorts, white top, necklace & shoes worn in "Go Down Low" video
  • Skirt and head scarf worn at live BBC Radio 4  performance
  • Bracelet worn in Guitar Hero the video game. Hand made with crystals by Blaithin Ennis
  • Jeffrey Campbell 'Lita'  Boots
  • Signed ‘Go Down Low’ T-shirts (only 2 available)
  • Long Kente Print scarf worn at 'BBC Arts Hour' performance 
  • Studed Stylish Waist Coat
  • Private performance  from Yasmin Kadi & a band member at your home, event, bar, or club  

WHERE WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION GO?

  • Studio time: Writing, Rehearsals & Recording
  • Musicians fees
  • Producers fees
  • Sound engineer: Mixing and mastering the final touches to add magic to the album
  • Manufacture: Pressing the first batch of 1000 CDs
  •  TV plugger
  • Online plugger
  • PR company

PARTIALLY RAISED FUNDS

Even if we don’t quite manage to raise the full amount, the project will still move forwards with whatever funds we raise and the funds will go towards the essential first stages of the album.

  • Studio time
  • Musicians
  • Producers
  • Finishing the recording of the album
  • And proceed from there to the mixing, mastering and manufacture.

If your amazing support helps us to tip above and beyond our target, any additional funds will be put towards getting a bigger PR campaign, which will give the album even more exposure, international PR and an album launch show.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know not everyone can contribute financially, but there are other ways you can help:

  • Make some noise about our campaign and share to your friends and family on the usual social media outlets: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat etc ..
  • Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign!

A HUGE thank you from all of us. Lots and lots of Love :) xx
story_txt:
WHO AM I AND THE JOURNEY SO FAR
I’m Yasmin Kadi - an independent singer song-writer chosen by BBC Introducing as "some of London's best new music" and whose debut EP went to No.1 on iTunes Ireland in 2014. My music style is a mix of Afrobeats & Pop.
I've performed alongside the likes of Paloma Faith at the 02 Forum, headlined WOW Festival at the Royal Festival Hall Southbank London and played many festivals around the UK. I wrote and sang the top line melody for an episode in the American TV Series “Tyrant” staring Chris Noth aka Mr. Big. I've also performed live on several BBC Radio Shows, worked for the likes of BBC TV, Channel 4, Virgin Media, Universal Channel etc. and have had national radio play in Ireland, the UK and Sierra Leone in the last 12 months.
After my Debut EP charted at No.1 on iTunes Ireland, it lead me onto a UK tour with MOBO Award winning Hip Hop veteran Roots Manuva. While I was on tour, the makers of “Guitar Hero Live” (the video game) saw me and I landed the lead female role in the band “Vivid Screamz” in the game while I’m also in the boss level.
All of these experiences reassured me that I don’t have to change and become someone else in order to be successful, so now I am independently recording and releasing my debut album "No Drama".
The creation of this album is even more important now than ever because it promotes us as individuals and is about us embracing our true selves with all our "flaws". There is so much pressure in our society to look and be like all the girls and boys on TV. But no two people are alike, not even identical twins who are a division of the same egg.
So help me stay true to myself and my artistry. story:
a glimpse of the new vinyl

First off, I'd like to thank everyone who has supported me over the past few years.

You came out to shows, bought records, adorned yourselves in exquisitely soft t-shirts, stayed late on Tuesdays, and shared stories and memories from the road and beyond. You are the reason I do this and you keep me going. Thank you!

Pre-ordering this record is like buying croissants

  • If your neighborhood baker asked you to pay for their flour, ovens, and a fancy new mixer, you would laugh in their powdery, sweaty face. But, if they asked you to pre-order a month of daily croissant deliveries, you'd probably start eating a lot of croissants.
  • This record is the croissants. 
  • I love croissants. 

The best part is you get a copy of HIGH AS THE STARS months before it's released!

If 116 people pre-order the vinyl, I can cover the cost of record production and give you what you deserve.

 

Here's what to do: 

  • If you are a vinyl fan, pre-order a HATS for $30 and get an instant WAV, LOSSY, or MP3 download
  • If you are a CD fan, pre-order HATS for $15 and you will get an instant WAV, LOSSY, or MP3 download as well
  • If you are just a fan, pre-order my love by giving what you can and you will also get an instant WAV, LOSSY, or MP3 download AND I will call you on the phone. Just leave your number. It's always nice to catch up. 

Thank you for supporting independent music. Dreams do come true. 

 

EXAMPLE PERKS:

T-shirts. Any size, any color, any style, if you want a custom design, I will provide. Examples:

 

Totes. Pick any color you desire. Light or dark logo of your choosing. Custom sizes and styling available.  Examples:

story:
Hey everyone!

We are DECIBEL! A collective indie group based in and around the New York area. This pass year we have been working diligently to create a sound that will have you tapping your feet and bopping your head. Performing at pubs, clubs, and dives all throughout the tristate area, we've manage to get some great feedback while establishing a small following. Feeling confident with our body of work, our next project is to drop an EP by the end of January, 2016 with a great production company. 

Budgeting with rehearsal space, equipment, and promoting, we were only able to raise money to produce one of our tracks "Out of Focus" (which you can listen on our soundcloud at: https://soundcloud.com/thisisdecibel/out-of-focus ). We need your help to come up with $2000 to finish the 3 remaining tracks which includes studio time, mixing and mastering. We know our tunes will demonstrate our hard work and creativeness. LETS MAKE THIS HAPPEN.

Of course, we aren't expecting money for nothing. We have a few little prizes for you all:

$10 donation - EP download

$20 donation - EP download and t-shirt 

$30 donation - EP download + acoustic b-sides + t-shirt

$50+ donation - EP + b-sides + t-shirt + invite to EP release party hosted by the one and only Matt Pinfield! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

...and if you really want to get intimate

$100 - signed photo of our singer Ian-Michael nude (lol)

$1,000 - a night with Ian-Michael (no limits)

ok maybe that was a little extreme hahaha

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We will be releasing the EP in the new year. Help us out and get some awesome music back!!

story:
5th gear

I have always owned manual transmission vehicles for a majority of my adult life. There's something about the feeling you get when you reach the point where it's time to change gears. The power, the speed, the acceleration...it takes you to that next level. But when you hit that top speed and shift into 5th gear... its all she wrote! Now you're flyin'! Now you're movin'! Well, that is how I would describe this project. My 5th gear! A long time coming with some of the best music I have ever written and I need your help to make it a reality so I can shop it to labels and tour. Would you consider helping me shift into my musical 5th gear!!! 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the nuts and bolts

  • We need $5,000. We (my wife and I) have already put over $6,000 of our own money into the existing 3 songs but I am still short. We are going to record 2 more songs and if we surpass our goal by $1,700 we will add one more song. That would be a total of 6 songs. A good healthy number for a debut EP. These songs are some of the best I have ever written and I want the world to hear them.  From the party anthem Sunshine State of Mind to the soulful heart break ballad of Awake, to the very personal ode to my late grandfather entitled "He Was There, these songs need to be heard! The way they were meant to be heard.
  • Whats in it for you? Take a look at our incentives to the right of this page and be incentivized! (Please note that the rewards are budgeted into the Goal amount. Should we not reach the goal the rewards will be null and void. I will however send everyone who did give a free digital copy of the project when released)

What will the money go to?

  • Production costs 
  • Tracking (recording)
  • Arranging
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Musicians
  • Branding (artwork, graphics, photoshoot etc.)
  • You (Rewards)


The Impact

  • If I can be honest, you will have the opportunity of assisting in the acceleration of the career of an artist who has worked extremely hard, sacrificed quite a bit and refuses to take no for an answer when it comes to his passion. My success is not just important to me but to a lot of people who have supported and believed in me for many years. I am very good at what I do and there are a lot of folks who agree with that statement. But I need your help for others to see that too. And if you learn anything about Business, not just the Music Business, it takes money to do that. In short, if you believe in me and my music, I could use your help now more than ever. 



Risks & Challenges

Balancing two jobs, a family and a music career has not been easy. But I have been faithful to my responsibilities as a husband, father and provider. And to be honest, I have thought of quitting many times. But every time I think that, one of my beautiful friends or family members encourages me to keep going. To not stop and to remember, my music is bigger than just me. Its for other people. Its for the world. This is a perspective that fuels my flame quite often. I have risked quite a bit to do this. Left my hometown, my friends and family to chase a dream. To follow a passion and go after something I love with all my heart. And my wife and kids have been my biggest supporters! To which I am forever grateful! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I am asking you whether you can give any money or not, to help me make some noise. Share, Share, Share. Share the link on your social media outlets. Share in emails. Tell somebody about it and encourage them to check it out. However you can help us build momentum and achieve our goal we're asking for your kind help. 
  • Also, remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Thank y'all a ton!!! We love y'all very much! #sunshinestateofmindbaby

story:
Do you love a good story?

Do you enjoy listening to great music?

Do you ever wish the book you were reading came with a soundtrack, just like a movie?

Do you think reading skills and arts education are important?

What if I told you there was a way to bring all of those things together in a fun, engaging way?

Would you be interested, intrigued, want to know more?

Well, we’re creating a series of multimedia projects to do just that.

The current project is an H.P. Lovecraft short story, “The Music of Erich Zann”. It’s a tale about a student’s encounter with an old string player whose music opens a portal to another dimension.

Hi, I’m Mike, I’m a composer, and in case you’ve never met one before, yes, we do exist. I say that because most people don’t really know much about new, or for lack of a better name, 21st.century classical music. And, if they’re aware of it at all, usually say they haven’t heard it, and, wouldn’t like or understand it. The reality is that it is around us all the time in the background of commercials, in movies, and on TV.

One of my goals with this series is to bring new music out of the background, making it the lead character in telling stories. There are several reasons I’m passionate about doing this:

  • It draws new audiences to 21st century music:
  • using the story as a guide through the music eliminates the intimidation factor; kind of like having GPS to guide you when you’re traveling somewhere new.
  • It helps audiences understand how to listen to new music, (something that, due to budget cuts in education, among other things, is often not taught in schools anymore)
  • It also works in the reverse, giving new readers something to guide them through the text of the story, as well as adding an additional layer of sensory experience for avid readers

In today’s world we are used to consuming information in a multimedia platform. As a result, fewer people are actually reading books. Still, reading is an important skill, and projects like this encourage reading, and enhance reader’s skill levels.

This project also provides an alternative to the “horrible movie adaptation”. I know you’ve all been there: the book you love gets turned into a film, you go to see it, and walk out of the theater thinking, “Wow, that really sucked.” Well, with this format, you are actually reading the story.

Make no mistake, although these projects may look like movies on the surface, they are much more than that. The music can be performed live and can stand alone as a concert work, and, the visual track is optional. The music was written to follow the text of the story and allow time for the story to unfold.

There are real advantages to this format. Someone could easily replace the current visual track and:

  • tell the story with dance, puppets, or anything else, or
  • create a whole new visual track to accompany the music, (really useful for those studying visual arts)

The possibilities are endless.

This has been a dream of mine to do something like this since college. Back then the technology wasn’t available, and the tools that were available were prohibitively expensive. Now technology has advanced, and our vision can become a reality. The world has caught up with our dreams, and it is time to bring them to life.

“The Music of Erich Zann” is a story about a musician and the power of music. What better way to tell this story than through music?! And, did I mention it is an H. P. Lovecraft story? How cool is that?  Lovecraft has a huge fan base, and if you are a Lovecraft fan watching this, please consider helping with this project.

What we need as far as funding are the fees to record and master the music, as well as release the project. I have personally funded everything else.

If you’ve looked at our funding goal, and are not familiar with the costs of recording you are probably thinking, “It costs that much?” “Are you serious?”

Yes, it costs that much, and No, I’m not serious, these guys are: 


They are the Sirius Quartet and will be the performers for this project. They are awesome! Check them out: 


and Here

We’re also partnering with the team at PARMA Recordings, with whom I’ve been recording with for years now. In case you haven’t heard of them, in addition to the usual welcome litany of outstanding rave reviews from  internationally renowned journals, more streams than you can shake a stick at, and prominent placements of their music in major television ad campaigns, Musical America names PARMA CEO Bob Lord one of 2015’s 30 Influencers:  www.musicalamerica.com/specialreports/PROFILES2015_FINAL.pdf

So as you can see we’ve assembled a fantastic team to guarantee the success of this project.

If you donate any amount, I will personally let you in on a little secret about the project. There are other cool perks as well. If you can’t donate, you can still help by getting the word out on social media, talking to friends, it all helps.

For those of you considering donating, you’re probably wondering: has this been done before? Well, yes, by me last year.

Working with a visual artist, the team at PARMA Recordings, the Moravian Philharmonic, and award winning bassoonist Jan Hudeĉek, we were able to release the first in this series, a short story by Anton Chekhov. Here’s a sample:


So was it successful? Well, here are excerpts from 2 reviews:


"This is an unusual presentation of an engrossing and imaginatively constructed new concerto for bassoon…"

"The solo bassoon part is written with carefully shaped phrases, and that final cadenza is poignant indeed. Performances are very fine, warm and polished".

Peter Burwasser Fanfare Magazine review


"The concept is fabulous: the bassoon directly represents the protagonist of Chekhov’s story "Misery"

"What looks on the surface like such a simple idea deepens as an experience on each subsequent viewing and listening".

"The piece is full of delightful touches, and the scoring remarkably assured".

“One feels the joy in storytelling itself, and in bringing to life Chekhov’s story. A remarkable idea, beautifully realized”.

Colin Clarke Fanfare Magazine review


So, whether you are an H. P. Lovecraft fan, you believe in arts education, you want to encourage reading, or you have some other motivation, please consider helping us fund this project and get the word out

Thank You!!!

And, did I mention it is an H. P. Lovecraft story? How cool is that?  Lovecraft has a huge fan base, and if you are
a Lovecraft fan watching this, please consider helping with this project.
What we need as far as funding are the fees to record and
master the music, as well as release the project. I have personally funded
everything else.
If you’ve looked at our funding goal, and are not
familiar with the costs of recording you are probably thinking, “It costs that
much?” “Are you serious?” 
Yes, it costs that much, and No, I’m not serious, these
guys are: 
They are the Sirius Quartet and will be the performers
for this project. They are awesome! Check them out: and Here
We’re also partnering with the team at PARMA Recordings,
with whom I’ve been recording with for years now. In case you haven’t heard of them, in addition to the usual welcome litany of outstanding
rave reviews from  internationally renowned journals,
more streams than you can shake a stick at,
and prominent placements of their music in major television ad campaigns, Musical America
names PARMA CEO Bob Lord one of 2015’s 30 Influencers:  www.musicalamerica.com/specialreports/PROFILES2015_FINAL.pdf
So as you can see we’ve assembled a fantastic team to guarantee
the success of this project.
If you donate any amount, I will personally let you in on
a little secret about the project. There are other cool perks as well. If you
can’t donate, you can still help by getting the word out on social media,
talking to friends, it all helps. 
For those of you considering donating, you’re probably
wondering: has this been done before? Well, yes, by me last year. 
Working with a visual artist, the team at PARMA
Recordings, the Moravian Philharmonic, and award winning bassoonist Jan
Hudeĉek, we were able to release the first in this series, a short story by
Anton Chekhov. Here’s a sample:
So was it successful? Well, here are excerpts from 2
reviews:
"This is an unusual presentation of an engrossing and
imaginatively constructed new concerto for bassoon…"
"The
solo bassoon part is written with carefully shaped phrases, and that final
cadenza is poignant indeed. Performances are very fine, warm and polished". 
Peter Burwasser Fanfare
Magazine review
"The
concept is fabulous: the bassoon directly represents the protagonist of
Chekhov’s story "Misery"

"What
looks on the surface like such a simple idea deepens as an experience on each
subsequent viewing and listening".
"The
piece is full of delightful touches, and the scoring remarkably assured".
“One feels the joy in storytelling itself, and in
bringing to life Chekhov’s story. A remarkable idea, beautifully realized”. 
Colin Clarke Fanfare Magazine review
So, whether you are an H. P. Lovecraft fan, you believe in
arts education, you want to encourage reading, or you have some other
motivation, please consider helping us fund this project and get the word out
Thank You!!!

story:
We made this campaign to raise funds for the Tam-Tam Music Festival in Croatia, which is held every summer on the island of Hvar. Apart from being the longest and definitely the sunniest on our coast, Hvar is also one of the most beautiful Croatian islands. In 2016, the Tam-Tam Festival will hopefully be held for the fifth time in a small place on the island called Sućuraj, with not more than 250 inhabitants during the winter.

Although the number of tourists in the summer increases the population on Hvar by 7 times or more, the main tourist action is still on the western side on the island. Sućuraj, located on the far east of the island, is known for its quiet, easygoing Mediterranean atmosphere and people of all ages socializing with tourists in the local tavern. The island was isolated in some periods of its history, as many other islands on the Croatian coast, due to war, economic scarcity or simply its geographic position. Sućuraj, on the other hand, is closer to the coast than the western part of the island and therefore easily accessible by car or public transport. 

 

 


Part of the festival team

 

 

 

A few friends born in Sućuraj, but frequently traveling to Split and other cities, became very passionate about bringing an alternative music festival to Sućuraj. A music festival was the logical thing since music is an important part of their lives and a medium for connecting people and cultures. It is only poetic justice that a rather isolated place on an island holds a festival that brings together people and bands from Croatia, the Balkans and Europe, don't you think?

Tam-Tam Music Festival has already become a known event among music lovers from Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia and Slovenia. Due to the lack of a language barrier, the visitors have a chance to hear various styles of music; from surf and post-punk to noise rock from the Balkan region -  indie and alternative music different from cheap turbo-folk many people listen to in these countries.

In the last four years, the festival brought more than twenty notable bands from France, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Slovenia and Croatia. The audience consisted of the locals from Sućuraj, rockers from Makarska, Ploče and other nearby cities and tourists, of which some came exclusively for the festival. Still, it is a small festival with not more than 400 tickets sold every year and we would like to keep it small and intimate. Your support is very important for us because it will enable us to pay the travel costs of the artists and to improve the overall infrastructure of the festival site. 

 

 

 

 

Repetitor playing on Tam-Tam Festival

 

 

This year we plan to hold workshops on various musical instruments for the children of Sućuraj and would like to build a comfortable chill out zone for the festival visitors during the day. The festival is held on a grass football field, without any shade. Despite that fact, there are more and more crazy campers every year that fall in love with Sućuraj and the festival. But this year we would like to improve the conditions for our guest bands and the festival visitors. We have support form the county Tourist Board in form of a small donation up to 1 500 USD, which will be used for the sound system. You could reasonably say that we already have the basics, but your help would really make a visible difference for everybody attending the festival. In our photo gallery and the attached video you can see the setting up of the stage with band members as volunteers. We understand completely why that is charming for our guests, but the main reason for that way of functioning were financial constraints. We would like to have a budget of at least 8 000  USD at our disposal so we can build a proper stage with protection from wind and rain. Hvar is the sunniest island, but you never know.

 

 

Festival atmosphere

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We prepared a rich set of perks for our supporters. For a contribution of 60 USD or more we will send you two festival tickets, a poster and a T-shirt. For contributions of 40-60 USD we prepared a CD from one of our resident bands and a festival poster. For contributions of 20-40 USD you will receive a festival ticket, and for a contribution of 10- 20 USD we will send you a festival poster, which is currently under development. 

If our entire goal is not reached, the purchase of stage equipment (e.g. stage lights) and improvements on the festival site are our priorities and we will take it from there, depending on the funds collected. A lot needs to be done, but we already started with the basics, maintaining close relationships with the bands and introducing some new music from Sućuraj and the region.

 

 

 Building the festival stage

Tam-Tam Music Festival has already become a known event among music lovers from Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia and Slovenia. Due to the lack of language barrier, the visitors have a chance to hear various styles of music – from surf and post-punk to noise rock from the Balkan region, indie and alternative music different from cheap folk many people listen to in these countries.

 

 

 

 

 

Each year we face the same risks, mostly ones we have no influence on, such as bad weather and ferries breaking down. But we established a close cooperation with the Tourist Board, the local municipality and local tourist workers to minimize the risks and hold the festival wherever possible. Remember, we are a small experienced crowd and therefore very flexible.

story:
RISE AND RUN      NEW ENDINGS FOR OLD STORIES

Produced by Tim Bryant
Executive Producer: Mitch Horn
Engineered and recorded by Jimmy Taylor
Recorded at The Mixing Room in Nacogdoches, Texas
Additional engineering and recording by John Lissauer
at Katonah Mill Studios in Katonah, New York
Steve Wickham recorded at his studio in Sligo, Ireland
More info coming soon!

RISE AND RUN:
Tim Bryant
Jimmy Mascorro

with
Steve Wickham
Liam o Maonlai
Jimmy Taylor

Love to Brad Busby, Todd Busby and Melanie Barnett.
Also Kurt Radnitzer, Chris Licce, Larry Reagan, Donnie Lawson, Moonbeam Baxter and Chris Janek.

An Album Thirty Years In The Making....

A true story you won't believe.

Thirty years ago, when Rise And Run began its journey in and out and back into my life, we had a handful of bands that we really looked up to. Two of these bands were The Waterboys and Hothouse Flowers, two amazingly fiery and passionate bands that were the best of everything I liked in music. The Waterboys were UK based (soon to relocate to Ireland) and Hothouse Flowers were from Ireland.

Along the way, amazingly, I became friends with Mike Scott and then Steve Wickham from The Waterboys— Steve and I have even written and recorded together a few times over the past fifteen years or so. I never approached Liam o Maonlai of Hothouse Flowers until just a couple of weeks ago, and I was overjoyed that he responded to me.

When I told him about the project I was working on, he expressed interest but said he didn't have any recording equipment at hand. We continued to talk, and a day or so later, I got a cryptic message from Liam: do you know anybody in NY? I thought about it and answered, "I've never been to New York. I have one good friend up there— Mitch Horn— but he's about an hour outside the city, in a little town called Bedford."

Well, soon I got a message back from Liam: 
"I'm going to be in Bedford next Monday and Tuesday."

I thought, surely someone is playing around with me, this can't be true. 
Then from Liam: "Do you know Tom O'Brien?"

Well, aside from the name sounding a bit like Tim Bryant, I'd never heard it before. I don't know anyone but Mitch in New York. So I get to Mitch, catch him up on this preposterous tale, and ask him, "Do you know someone named Tom O'Brien?"

And Mitch answers,"The architect?"

And I say, "Heck if I know, I don't know him!"

So I go back to Liam and I say, "The architect?"

And Liam answers back, "Yes! The same!"

So it transpires that Liam flew into New York on Monday to spend a couple of days in little Bedford (about half the size of Nacogdoches) with his architect friend Tom O'Brien, whom my friend Mitch knows.... and Tom and Mitch are both friends with a guy named John Lissauer who owns a really cool studio built inside an old barn, just minutes away from Tom's house.

And John Lissauer is a really nice guy (who recorded a bunch of Leonard Cohen's best albums, as well as Loudon Wainwright, Bette Midler and many others) who just so happened to have nothing scheduled for Tuesday morning, the time that Liam asked for, so Mitch picked Liam up and took him to the studio to play tin whistle and bodhran on the song Black Pig and sing along on one called Salvation.

The interesting part about that is, I wrote Salvation twenty years ago with Hothouse Flowers in my mind as I did. Truthfully. (Not too difficult to believe, really, as it does sound a bit like them.)

So today, I heard Liam o Maonlai of Hothouse Flowers sing along on my song. It's going to be a duet, Liam and me. I heard him play his whistle and bodhran and some other tuned percussion instrument on my (other) song, a song on which Steve Wickham already plays a blazing fiddle. Steve, Liam, and me. Unbelievable.

Liam, Mitch and John evidently had a great time in the studio this morning. And I was there in spirit, getting a continual feed of photos and snippets of sounds from Mitch as it all went down. John had all my notes on the songs, and he did an outstanding job of creating the perfect space for things to happen.

Thirty years after Rise And Run's first album, twenty years after the golden days when we wrote the songs that were recorded today, Rise And Run is back with Steve Wickham and Liam o Maonlai along for the ride. And it's not just them.

As Liam said, it's just mad, all the connections. We all sensed it. This was meant to be. Maybe today was meant to be for twenty years, I don't know. To paraphrase the late, great Curtis Mayfield, Serendipity is strong in here.

Rise and Run. Rock and Roll.

It Was Thirty Years Ago Today ...

Thirty years ago, my childhood best friend Brad Busby, his brother Todd Busby, my future ex-wife Melanie Barnett and I went into a recording studio and made our very first album. Our band's name was Rise And Run, and that album was called Marked For Life. And marked I was. Through thick and thin, music stayed beside me, and the band kept rocking. Soon enough, the Busbys went their separate ways, and we were joined by Jimmy Mascorro. The band continued, on and off, until 1997.

Almost twenty years later, Jimmy and I began to talk about going back into the studio and doing a new Rise And Run album to "mark" the occasion. What began as a good idea slowly became a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to record an album with some world-class musicians, a couple of whose posters were on the wall of our little recording space back in 1986. Serendipity had a big hand to play in this.

So, What We Need ...

We have 80% of the project done. Most of the recording has been done and paid for. We have musicians working on overdubs, putting their parts down in recording studios in New York, Nashville, and Sligo Ireland. Most of these people are playing out of the kindness of their hearts, but the work must be honored, and some things cost a little money.

In addition, as this project has grown into something Jimmy and I could have never planned or even hoped for, it has become more and more obvious that we will need to make some physical CDs available. What started as a download-only project is too good to be just on iTunes or Bandcamp. 

  • To do everything right, we would like to raise $1,000. We will do everything we can to make each and every dollar go as far as possible. There will be no lunch budget built into the project. This is purely to honor the work of the people who are helping us to make this a magical thing.
  • We will start out with as many cool perks as we can, and, if we think of others, we will add them as we go. 

Track Record ...

My track record with Indiegogo has been a successful one. My last campaign was for the album Tim Bryant: Andersonville, which was a big success and ended with many more contributors than expected. It made all the difference in that project, and I have faith that it will make the difference here again. I understand the power of the individual. I believe in many hands lifting large loads. If 100 of you give $10 each, we will be almost there. And, in exchange, each of you will be a part of this story and will have a copy to share with others.

FYI ...

I live, love and play with Asperger's syndrome. I try to advocate for those who live with it at every opportunity, and I hope to be of some help to those who suffer with it more than I do. As such, this album will hopefully serve to raise awareness of what people with Asperger's go through as well as what they are capable of. Having said that, contributing to this campaign is NOT the same as contributing to an Asperger's Awareness group. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There is an easy way that you can help, even if you can't contribute financially. That is by sharing this campaign on your social media pages. Indiegogo has easy-to-use sharing tools. Word of mouth is powerful and can make all the difference.

story:
SO WHAT'S THE DEAL?

My name is Dustin Paul and I have been involved in music full time for most of my life. The ironic thing about that is, I’ve never really had the chance to make music that was 100% me, my brand, or my message. Part of the reason for that, is I didn’t know what that was... until now. 
I am singer-songwriter who is about to jump from being in a band called The New Velvet, to debuting myself to the world as a solo artist, through my first song release/music video ever (potentially). The incredible friendships and fans I've made along the way have led me to this moment. I am on my way to something great, but I can't pull the trigger on this thing without YOU. 
Even after all The New Velvet has done as a band, we’ve never released any kind of official music video. I want to approach this new beginning for me in reverse. I want to jump-start my solo debut with an EPIC music video! It’s kind of a must if you want anyone to take you seriously. However, there is only one way to make this happen: I need all of my beloved friends and fans to come together with me on this! 

I encourage anyone reading right now to check out my website www.DustinPaulMusic.com - from there, you can listen to songs, get linked to videos, see all I have been up to etc...  If you look around a bit you will see that I am onto something. 

 


What We Need & What You Get


The amount that I have set as the goal here is $7,000. This is basically the minimum amount I would need to make a video that is competitive in today's market. Obviously, surpassing my goal will allow me to kick this to an even higher playing field. If we don't reach our goal, I will use whatever we have raised together, and save up the difference. No matter what happens,  all the money we raise will be making this video more and more possible. 
Let me break it down for you in a bit more detail:

1. Director/Producer/Cinematographer + Concept Creation/Execution – approx. $3300

2. Production (Camera, Lighting, Equipment rental, Post Production/Coloring/CG etc…) approx. $2000

3. Production crew (Wages, Food, Transportation, etc...) approx. $1200

4. Wardrobe/Misc – approx. $700

The more we raise, the crazier this video will be.

Beyond monetary contributions, there are many ways to help and be involved. Sharing this page with your friends and spreading the word is a huuuge help!  


Why should you contribute?

1. THE PERKS! You GOTTA check out the tons of perks I’ve listed in the column to the right! I've given them a lot of thought, and made sure there is something that appeals to everyone!

2.  If you've ever wanted to be a part of something big in music from the ground up- this is it.  

3. Connect with me. I want this to be your journey too. You will get exclusive updates and even the chance to give your input. 

4. YOUR contribution and belief alone, is worth more than any amount of money. I will make sure you are taken care of, attended for, & treated like a celeb. That is what you are to me.

                                     


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and I get it! I know what it's like to be eating cereal 3 meals a day trying to make ends meet! But that doesn't mean that you can't help:

- Help spread the word about my campaign! Share this page link on your on your social media! I'll be ever so grateful! 

- Write about this on a blog. Share my past music and what you liked about it

- "Like" and "Follow" me! Facebook, Twitter, Soundcloud  Instagram 

- Check out my new YouTube page, as well as The New Velvet's YouTube page, so you can be up to date on all of our progress.

That about covers it lovelies. If you have any more questions about any of the information/planning mentioned here feel free to msg me anytime on Facebook or e-mail DustinPaulMusic@gmail.com, I appreciate you taking the time and effort to read all the way through this!. 

XO

-DP
story_txt:
SO WHAT'S THE DEAL?
My name is Dustin Paul and I have been involved in music full time for most of my life. The ironic thing about that is, I’ve never really had the chance to make music that was 100% me, my brand, or my message. Part of the reason for that, is I didn’t know what that was... until now. 
I am singer-songwriter who is about to jump
from being in a band called The New Velvet, to debuting myself to the world as a solo artist, through my first song release/music video ever (potentially). The incredible friendships and fans I've made along the way have led me to this moment. I am on my way to something great, but I can't pull the trigger on this thing without YOU. 

Even after all The New Velvet has done as a band, we’ve never released any kind of official music video. I want to approach this new beginning for me in reverse. I want to jump-start my solo debut with an EPIC music video! It’s kind of a must if you want anyone to take you seriously. However, there is only one way to make this happen: I need all of my beloved friends and fans to come together with me on this! 
I encourage anyone reading right now to check out my website www.DustinPaulMusic.com - from there, you can listen to songs, get linked to videos, see all I have been up to etc...  If you look around a bit you will see that I am onto something. 
 


   What We Need & What You Get


The amount that I have set as the goal here is $7,000. This is basically the minimum amount I would need to make a video that is competitive in today's market. Obviously, surpassing my goal will allow me to kick this to an even higher playing field. If we don't reach our goal, I will use whatever we have raised together, and save up the difference. No matter what happens,  all the money we raise will be making this video more and more possible. 
Let me break it down for you in a bit more detail:

1. Director/Producer/Cinematographer
+ Concept Creation/Execution – approx. $3300
2. Production (Camera,
Lighting, Equipment rental, Post Production/Coloring/CG etc…) approx. $2000
3. Production crew (Wages, Food, Transportation, etc...) approx.
$1200
4. Wardrobe/Misc –
approx. $700
The more we raise, the crazier this video will be.
Beyond monetary contributions, there are many ways to help and be involved. Sharing this page with your friends and spreading the word is a huuuge help!  






Why should you contribute?

1. THE
PERKS! You GOTTA check out the tons
of perks I’ve listed in the column to the right! I've given them a lot of
thought, and made sure there is something that appeals to everyone!

2.  If you've ever wanted to be a part of something big in
music from the ground up- this is it.  
3. Connect with me. I want this to be your journey too. You will get exclusive updates and even the chance to give your input. 


4. YOUR contribution and belief alone, is worth more than
any amount of money. I will make sure you are taken care of, attended for,
& treated like a celeb. That is what you are to me.

                                     



    Other Ways You Can Help 
Some people just can't
contribute, and I get it! I know what it's like to be eating cereal 3 meals a day trying to make ends meet! But that doesn't mean
that you can't help:
- Help
spread the word about my campaign! Share this page link on your on your social media! I'll be ever
so grateful! - Write about this on a blog. Share my past music and what you liked about it
- "Like" and "Follow" me! Facebook, Twitter, Soundcloud  Instagram - Check out my new YouTube page, as well as The New Velvet's YouTube page, so you can be up to date on all of our progress.That about covers it lovelies. If you have any more questions about any of the information/planning mentioned here feel free to msg me anytime on Facebook or e-mail DustinPaulMusic@gmail.com, I appreciate you taking the time and effort to read all the way through this!. XO-DP

story:
MILTON BABBITT'S CENTENARY CONCERTS

MOOT - music of our time's series CROSSING BOUNDARIES music at the edge (Brighton Fringe) features  the music of Milton Babbitt in a special centenary concert plus Ligeti Quartet performing Babbitt's String Quartet No.6 later in the week.

More details here

Earlier this year the Milton Babbitt Discovery Concert (Brighton Science Festival) included 15 works by Babbitt and the world premiere of Georgina Bowden's BREAKING THE SET. (See Programme)

100 TODAY! HAPPY BIRTHDAY MILTON BABBITT will include performances of Philomel and other works by Babbitt and many of his contemporaries and students including Samuel Adler, Newton Armstrong, Paul Lansky, Mel Powell and David Rakowski.

To help support these great event happen we rely strongly  on public funding. So, to help us to provide a platform for celebrating Babbitt's centenary and other great contemporary music please help us today!

IF YOU'RE ALL SET TO ATTEND BUY A TICKET NOW!
https://www.brightonfringe.org/box-office/shows/search?query=moot
 

What does the money raised help to cover?

The money needed for this project pays the following artistic, venue and other essential costs. (No admin costs included):

·  Professional performers: £2,500

·  Venue hire: £410

·  Publicity: £800

·  Engraving scores & parts fo four Babbitt works including String Quartet  No. 6: £800

·  Sheet music hire & purchase: £500

·  Sound & staging  equipment hire + sound engineer: £600

story:
I'm a thirteen year old guitar player looking for my first bass. I'm passionate about music and have been playing guitar for around a year. Some of my favorite bands are Megadeth, Mettalica, and Panic! at the Disco. I'm only asking for $200 USD to cover the price of the bass and shipping.  The only thing I want for christmas is a bass. Thanks for any contibutions. 

The Picture didn't fit right and there's no options to adjust the image. If you want to see the right pictures, here's the link to the bass:  

 https://reverb.com/item/1464010-2005-ibanez-srx500-4-string-electric-bass-guitar-honey-sunburst

My email is chesswizard456@gmail.com

story:
Hi Y'all 

My name is Jonny and I have been a small town musician in Quinte,Ontario for the past ten plus years. I am currently working on a new album set to release the summer of 2016. This project means so much to me not only because I am finally pulling back the curtains and giving people honest, raw music but I also get to make a difference in the lives of many others fighting something I've personally battled with my last 24 years. My mother was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis at 16, she's been paralyzed, blind, weak and strong but she's always remained a phenomenal mother. She is my biggest fan and this album is for her, and those like her who suffer day in and day out without any answers. I asked myself while creating this album how I could make an impact beyond just the music and this is why I stand in front of you today. 

What I Need & what you get

- I am looking to fundraise a total of $10,000 to totally fund the album. This amount will take care of the production of the album itself, three studio musicians, the physical copies of the album printed, wrapped and signed. The music videos and promotional photo shoots to bring you the best product possible. I am offering a wide range of packages in exchange for your donations. Everything from signed copies of the album, to live cover songs of your request and EVEN booking me to perform at the  private event of your choice. In planning this fundraiser I decided that a total of 20% of ALL fundraising generated through this campaign will be donated directly to the Multiple Sclerosis society of Canada. From what I've explained you can understand that this album is going to cost a great amount and I am just one guy. If the campaign does not reach it's goal I may need to push the release date of the album back, but I believe that we can do this, together. Believe in my dream, pre-order your copy or package and let's Fight M.S together. 
With this campaign everyone wins, you get a guaranteed copy of a new country artist. I get the funding to bring you the best possible product and together we get to impact the lives of millions by furthering research. I am a small town boy with a population under 50,000. You've allowed me to travel the province playing my music, you've watched my videos over a quarter million times, you voted for me in nation-wide contests and made me a winner. Let me give something back to you, something you can carry with you on your next journey. Let's make this album fly!
Know someone affected by Multiple sclerosis or that you think might want to get involved?
Please take the time to share this link with them or tell them about my journey. 

Thank you for taking the time to hear about my campaign, 
I appreciate your time and donations. 
Let's make a big impact in a small town. 

With love,
Jon

story:
My Next Album!

I am Pete Mako, A singer-Songwriter from Columbus Ohio. My first album, Relationships with Monsters was solely funded by myself, however the next album is going to need a little help. I don't have the resources to do it alone! I'm looking to raise $850 to help finance my sophomore release. 

To those of you who are new to me, i am a pop-culture, nerd inspired, acoustic rock n' roll musician. I love all things supernatural and sci-fi. My first album "relationships with monsters" is available on iTunes and Spotify by searching "Pete Mako". I am looking to bring another Acoustic nerd-rock album to the table. 

The Following links are where you can find me and my music!

My Facebook! 

My Website!

My BandCamp!

What I Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise the money to record the next ten songs i have written, studio time is not cheap! I am also trying to press physical copies of the new album upon completion.

I am not a fan of crowd funding, so in return if you donate at any level you will get a digital copy of the album. I will set up various Perks for those who contribute to the cause! I have T-shirts, buttons, stickers, posters, and upon completion,  a physical copy of my next release. 

If i do not reach my goal, at a very minimum i will make sure that everyone who contributes gets a copy of whatever i can afford to record whether it be an EP or full album (and or any physical merch like tee shirts, buttons, stickers, etc. will get delivered). 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is that i don't raise enough to record a full album, no matter what i will deliver new content to everyone. The challenge is going to be spreading the word via social media, and various sources. If everyone can help by sharing the campaign and tagging friends, it will go a long way. It's a pretty cut and dry campaign. 

All perk packs will be shipped and or fulfilled otherwise.

THANKS FOR ALL THE HELP!
