story:
Short Summary

Hip Hop artist Enoch 7th Prophet has joined forces with Music Industry Veteran DJ King Cee aka Bolo God to form CHAKRA MUSIC, LLC. His first release will be Enoch’s 10th Studio album "Sonic Gods" slated to come out in Summer 2016. 

What We Need & What You Get

Rewards

Pledge $5 

Give Thanks! 

Pledge $10

Digital download link for the new Enoch 7TH Prophet “Sonic Gods” Album & advance private link.

Pledge $15

Autographed copy of the new Enoch 7TH Prophet “Sonic Gods” Album on CD plus advance private link. Enoch will also tweet a personal thank you for your support.

Pledge $20 

One paid entry to a live Enoch 7TH Prophet show in Washington, DC or upcoming show in your area this Summer 2016 (worldwide) Tour dates and cities TBA plus a copy of the new Enoch 7th Prophet “Sonic Gods” Album on CD plus advance private link.

Pledge $25 

One Autographed copy of the Limited Edition colored 12” vinyl of Enoch 7TH Prophet “Sonic Gods” (limited to 100 piece pressing).

Pledge $35 

Autographed copy of Enoch 7th Prophet album “Sonic Gods” on CD and an exclusive limited edition Enoch 7th Prophet T-shirt available exclusively for supporters.

Pledge $100 

Autographed copy of the limited edition Enoch 7th Prophet single “Sonic Gods” colored 12’ vinyl (limited to 100 piece pressing), exclusive limited edition Enoch 7TH Prophet T-Shirt available exclusively for supporters (Size L or XL), CD copy of “Sonic Gods” album and limited edition autographed copy of the Enoch 7TH Prophet photography coffee table book and your name on the artwork credits for the Enoch 7th Prophet album “Sonic Gods” album.

  • If we don't reach the goal the rewards will be cut down to the bare minimum, but I know YOU won't let that happen.

The Impact

The difference that you're  contribution will make:

  • This project is very different for Enoch because he has targeted  a few industry producers to help with the album such as:  DJ Evil Dee, 9th Wonder, Notz, Kwame, Large Professor, Freddy Foxx , DJ Premier and Kwamè.
  • This is Enoch 7th Prophet's first time doing a campaign on this level; which he's asking people from all over the world to help him complete.
  • We need your support to help make this project possible.  The funding of this project goes toward mixing and mastering, producer fees, graphic artwork fees, manufacturing the CD & limited edition colored double vinyl LP along with the Enoch “ALL GOLD EVERYTHING” book, and Limited edition Enoch T-Shirt. This is history in the making. It's the first time partnering on a label venture and releasing a coffee table book with my 10th studio project. We want you to be part of this experience. Thank you for your support!

Risks & Challenges

The Risk we may face is NOT reaching the goal and having to cut back on the wonderful perks. 

  • Overcoming the challenge starts NOW.... 
  • The plan to over come this goal is to set aside the fear of asking for help and just have faith in the supporters, knowing that YOU want to hear and see greatness .

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us PROMOTE! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! to tell a friend, co-worker and love ones 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who the Hell Are We?

Finite Automata got it's start in Pensacola Florida as a one man side project by Mod Eschar (Dom Price). Over the years they've fought tooth and nail to bring their twisted and hard hitting flavor of old-meets-new electro-industrial to the fold of industrial music scene.


The early shows

Having done small mini-tours over the years and having been plagued with line-up changes and setbacks, it was not until the release of Recurse and subsequent move to Atlanta, Georgia where we began to gain traction. Today Finite Automata consists of vocalist/songwriter/producer Mod Eschar, keyboardist Scott Storey (formerly of Skabdriver and Voodoo Velkro), and guitarist Damian Turner of Atlanta based EctoProxy.



A taste of things to come. We are hard at work on our next release! And will be playing material from "Dogma Eye" on tour!

Now is the moment we've been waiting for. The next phase of a journey we started almost 10 years ago. Our first multi-week national tour, as special guests for God Module! We'll be hitting 12 cities (with more being added as we speak) throughout the South, the East, and the Midwest.

We live for the stage. It's where Finite Automata truly belongs. We are performance artists first, and this is what we want to help bring back to live industrial. A sensory onslaught that harkens back to the early days when industrial music was more than just an art form.... it was a statement.

The Breakdown:

We will of course be able to recoup some of the costs on tour with some merch sales, however Mod, Damian, and Scott will be putting in over $3000 of their own personal money to make this happen. There is no label backing us financially, no external revenue. Just us, and whatever we can scrounge together ourselves to make this happen, to finally bring our statement to you in person.... and we are going to do it regardless of whether or not we get fully funded.... because we are driven to do it, and we must. However before we embark on our long journey, we want to give you a chance to be part of the next chapter.

Here's the breakdown of the costs:
$1400 for direct tour costs which have to be paid upfront.
$1000 for merch pressings to help us eat and get lodging on the road.
$600 for fuel and toll costs

Here's our Itinerary so far:

5.27 Orlando FL - Bombshell's Tavern
5.31 Atlanta, GA - Club Famous
6.01 Richmond, VA - Fall Out
6.02 Washington, D.C. - Tropicalia
6.03 Wilmington, DE - Bar XIII
6.04 New York City, NY - Smack! XX
6.05 Providence, RI - Firehouse 13
6.08 Pittsburgh, PA - Howlers
6.09 Cleveland, OH - Phantasy
6.01 Detroit, MI - Smalls
6.11 Chicago, IL - Underground Lounge
6.12 Cincinnati, OH - The Mockbee
6.13 Minneapolis, MN - The Saloon

More TBA!

Here's Where You Can Help and Get In On The Action!

(This is the fun part, we promise!)

We have a lot of one of a kind, and exclusive things to give away. A lot of these items cannot be purchased anywhere, including one of a kind stage items that have not only seen showtime, but bear the scars and trauma from show after show of abuse. We also have personalized art and collaboration packages. After all, collaboration, experimentation, creativity, and comradery is what our little incestuous musical family is all about, right?

Backers over $50 will get a personal, hand written, thank you letter from the band itself. Written in Mod Eschar's glorious (and hopefully readable chicken scratch! :) ) All backers will get a digital copy of our discography to date (Here Won No One, Recurse,  Second Circle, and a special forthcoming Finite Automata split release with Damain's project Ectoproxy; which will feature a little taste of what's to come: two brand new tracks from our upcoming album Dogma Eye!)

This campaign is flex funding, so we keep whatever you find in your necrotic little hearts to give. You can donate as many times as you like! Every dime of your contribution will go towards making this tour a reality. If we happen to make more than our goal, that money will be reinvested into the band for things like new equipment, future tours, new merch, and recording time and mixing/mastering services. We'll also be sure to throw our backers some extra swag as well!

On to the Perks!

$5 - Finite Automata Digital Discog

All backers will receive a copy of our entire up to date digital discography (including the upcoming Finite Automata/EctoProxy Split EP), but if you wanna just order it direct from us, that’s fine too! Also available on our bandcamp (finiteautomata.bandcamp.com), but you can get it for less here!

$10 - Here Won No One EP - Signed

This record was our first ever released, and even though it’s available digitally,  There are only 100 physical copies in existence, and it’s been out of print for years. We managed to dig up a few remaining copies in storage and want to pass them on to you! There’s only a few copies left, each manually pressed and labeled, and all signed by Mod himself.  Once they’re gone, they’re gone! We will never print them again!

$10 - Second Circle (Latext re-Release) Signed NEW!

A SIGNED, physical copy of the Latex Records re-release of Second Circle, featuring an exclusive remix by Machines on Blast! Includes the digital version.

$15 Machine States EP (Finite Automata/EctoProxy Split) Signed NEW!

Our forthcoming split EP "Machine States", with Damian's project, EctoProxy; featuring two new tracks, "Brand New and Perfect", and "Phosgene"; which will appear on Dogma Eye. Also two tracks from the forthcoming EctoProxy full length, AND two exclusive remixes! Here's your chance to get a signed copy of this limited 100 copy release, and get a taste of what's to come! Includes the digital version as well. Signed by both Finite Automata and EctoProxy!

$15 - Recurse - Signed Full Length (First Run) SOLD OUT!

Our first full length Album, released in 2012 featuring Rot Inside, a remastered version of Here Won No One, and Caustic. We have a few copies of the original run left and we'll be signing them for a few lucky backers!

$25 - Recurse, Machine States, Second Circle Package, Signed NEW!

Includes Recurse, the upcoming Machine States Split EP, and the Second Circle latex records reissue! All signed! Those of you who ordered Recurse separately and order this will get a free 'Brand New and Perfect' T-shirt in lieu of an extra copy of Recurse. Includes all digital versions as well!

On to the Hardcore Perks!


$50 - SKUD’s corpse - Signed

"SKUD" was the infamous baby doll prop used at various Finite Automata shows over the years. It was present during the Medical Meat tour and many of Finite Automata’s earlier shows.  Unfortunately SKUD met his demise at Finite Automata’s last show before relocating to Georgia, in Pensacola Florida; where a very excited fan snatched him away and "ate him alive", tearing him limb from limb. We managed to salvage his head and torso though! (live photos circa 2010, other photo is recent)

$50 - Recurse Era Mask - Signed

This mask was used on several of Finite Automata's earlier live performances as well as a few recent ones, and has appeared in various photo shoots throughout the years. Spattered with stage blood (although some might be real) from almost a decade’s worth of performances, its eyes are caged and mouth closed to represent blind ignorance.  Best of all, it’s wearable! Here’s your chance to make it yours!

$50 - Mod's Bloody “fodder” shirt - Signed

One of two worn by Mod for most of Finite Automata’s live performances over the years, the shirt has seen better days. Tattered and torn, smeared with fake blood, paint, dirt, grime, and beer from various national venues, and likely some of Mod’s DNA, it’s time to retire it. What better place to retire to than the hands of one of our supporters!  But please do us the courtesy of letting us know if you intend to use said DNA to clone Mod.

$50 - Mod's Other Bloody Shirt - Signed

This is another bloody shirt worn by Mod over the years. Just like the fodder shirt, it’s seen many a show, and is also likely contaminated with bio-matter.  Again, please let us know if you intend to clone Mod.

$75 - Custom Artwork - Signed

Mod is also a visual artist and has a distinctive style of line and ink work. He will gladly sketch something up for you and send you the original piece! Give him a theme, or just let him surprise you. Here are some samples of his work:

$75 - All Physical Releases Ever

The ultimate way of paying it forward. Just like the name says, you will receive a physical copy of every physical release we have made or will ever make, starting with Recurse! No need to remind us, when it drops and we print it, we’ll automatically mail one off to you! Just make sure you let us know when you move! Includes digital versions of the releases, as well as limited releases, and exclusive unreleased demos. Literally everything we have, or will ever, put out!

$100 - Mod Will Design Your Album Art

The cover art for all Finite Automata releases have been done by Mod Eschar himself. His distinctive style of combining his horror inspired style of line art with various photo collages produces an interesting combination that will make your release stand out! Storyboard the idea or let Mod come up with something. This includes the whole shebang! The front panel, back panel, inside panels, and the CD itself. Deeply discounted! Professional quality. All files delivered as 300DPI, CMYK, layered PSDs and TIFF for immediate use!

$100 - Doppelganger Mask, Signed

Used during Finite Automata’s early performances in 2008-2010. The mask has been sitting on a shelf since then.  Meant to display the dichotomy of Man vs Nature, and Ugliness vs Beauty, the mask was a centerpiece in many of Finite Automata’s early performance art spectacles. Hand made by Mod, (and yes that is his real hair on the mask for extra creepiness.) Put it on your coat rack or shelf above the TV to make guests feel uneasy as it stares at them menacingly! (photo circa 2009)

$100 - Guest Appearance on a Song

Mod will perform guest vocals, Scott will perform guest keyboards, or Damian will perform guest guitars on your song. Take your pick! If your song needs a little something different, then this will help send you over the edge, and certainly opens the door to collaboration. We love collaborating with our supporters!  Send us the track, lyrics and tabs or have us write them, and we’ll get to work. Keep in mind we’ll be on tour until the end of June.

$100 - We Will Remix Your Song!

Maybe a remix is more your flavor? We’ll remix one of your songs for an upcoming release. Send us your stems and we’ll get to work!

More to come!
This is not all. We are digging around for other neat artifacts and ideas to offer you guys! So keep checking in!

Can't Donate? That's Okay!

You can still help out by sharing this campaign with your friends on social media and encouraging them to contribute and come out to the shows and catch us live!

We'll see all of you soon!
story_txt:
Who the Hell Are We?
Finite Automata got it's start in Pensacola Florida as a one man side project by Mod Eschar (Dom Price). Over the years they've fought tooth and nail to bring their twisted and hard hitting flavor of old-meets-new electro-industrial to the fold of industrial music scene.The early showsHaving done small mini-tours over the years and having been plagued with line-up changes and setbacks, it was not until the release of Recurse and subsequent move to Atlanta, Georgia where we began to gain traction. Today Finite Automata consists of vocalist/songwriter/producer Mod Eschar, keyboardist Scott Storey (formerly of Skabdriver and Voodoo Velkro), and guitarist Damian Turner of Atlanta based EctoProxy. A taste of things to come. We are hard at work on our next release! And will be playing material from "Dogma Eye" on tour!Now is the moment we've been waiting for. The next phase of a journey we started almost 10 years ago. Our first multi-week national tour, as special guests for God Module! We'll be hitting 12 cities (with more being added as we speak) throughout the South, the East, and the Midwest. We live for the stage. It's where Finite Automata truly belongs. We are performance artists first, and this is what we want to help bring back to live industrial. A sensory onslaught that harkens back to the early days when industrial music was more than just an art form.... it was a statement. The Breakdown:We will of course be able to recoup some of the costs on tour with some merch sales, however Mod, Damian, and Scott will be putting in over $3000 of their own personal money to make this happen. There is no label backing us financially, no external revenue. Just us, and whatever we can scrounge together ourselves to make this happen, to finally bring our statement to you in person.... and we are going to do it regardless of whether or not we get fully funded.... because we are driven to do it, and we must. However before we embark on our long journey, we want to give you a chance to be part of the next chapter.Here's the breakdown of the costs:$1400 for direct tour costs which have to be paid upfront.$1000 for merch pressings to help us eat and get lodging on the road.$600 for fuel and toll costsHere's our Itinerary so far:5.27 Orlando FL - Bombshell's Tavern5.31 Atlanta, GA - Club Famous6.01 Richmond, VA - Fall Out6.02 Washington, D.C. - Tropicalia6.03 Wilmington, DE - Bar XIII6.04 New York City, NY - Smack! XX6.05 Providence, RI - Firehouse 136.08 Pittsburgh, PA - Howlers6.09 Cleveland, OH - Phantasy6.01 Detroit, MI - Smalls6.11 Chicago, IL - Underground Lounge6.12 Cincinnati, OH - The Mockbee6.13 Minneapolis, MN - The SaloonMore TBA!Here's Where You Can Help and Get In On The Action!(This is the fun part, we promise!)We have a lot of one of a kind, and exclusive things to give away. A lot of these items cannot be purchased anywhere, including one of a kind stage items that have not only seen showtime, but bear the scars and trauma from show after show of abuse. We also have personalized art and collaboration packages. After all, collaboration, experimentation, creativity, and comradery is what our little incestuous musical family is all about, right?Backers over $50 will get a personal, hand written, thank you letter from the band itself. Written in Mod Eschar's glorious (and hopefully readable chicken scratch! :) ) All backers will get a digital copy of our discography to date (Here Won No One, Recurse,  Second Circle, and a special forthcoming Finite Automata split release with Damain's project Ectoproxy; which will feature a little taste of what's to come: two brand new tracks from our upcoming album Dogma Eye!)This campaign is flex funding, so we keep whatever you find in your necrotic little hearts to give. You can donate as many times as you like! Every dime of your contribution will go towards making this tour a 
reality. If we happen to make more than our goal, that money will be 
reinvested into the band for things like new equipment, future tours, 
new merch, and recording time and mixing/mastering services. We'll also be sure to throw our backers 
some extra swag as well! On to the Perks!$5 - Finite Automata Digital Discog All
 backers will receive a copy of our entire up to date digital 
discography (including the upcoming Finite Automata/EctoProxy Split EP), but if you wanna just order it direct from us, that’s fine 
too! Also available on our bandcamp (finiteautomata.bandcamp.com), but you can get it for less here!$10 - Here Won No One EP - SignedThis record was our first ever released, and even though it’s available digitally,  There are only 100 physical copies in existence, and it’s been out of print for years. We managed to dig up a few remaining copies in storage and want to pass them on to you! There’s only a few copies left, each manually pressed and labeled, and all signed by Mod himself.  Once they’re gone, they’re gone! We will never print them again!$10 - Second Circle (Latext re-Release) Signed NEW! A SIGNED, physical copy of the Latex Records re-release of Second Circle, featuring an exclusive remix by Machines on Blast! Includes the digital version.$15 Machine States EP (Finite Automata/EctoProxy Split) Signed NEW!Our forthcoming split EP "Machine States", with Damian's project, EctoProxy; featuring two new tracks, "Brand New and Perfect", and "Phosgene"; which will appear on Dogma Eye. Also two tracks from the forthcoming EctoProxy full length, AND two exclusive remixes! Here's your chance to get a signed copy of this limited 100 copy release, and get a taste of what's to come! Includes the digital version as well. Signed by both Finite Automata and EctoProxy!$15 - Recurse - Signed Full Length (First Run) SOLD OUT!Our first full length Album, released in 2012 featuring Rot Inside, a remastered version of Here Won No One, and Caustic. We have a few copies of the original run left and we'll be signing them for a few lucky backers!$25 - Recurse, Machine States, Second Circle Package, Signed NEW! Includes Recurse, the upcoming Machine States Split EP, and the Second Circle latex records reissue! All signed! Those of you who ordered Recurse separately and order this will get a free 'Brand New and Perfect' T-shirt in lieu of an extra copy of Recurse. Includes all digital versions as well!On to the Hardcore Perks!

story:
Elizabeth Knudson is an internationally award-winning freelance composer and Associate of the Canadian Music Centre.  She is based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.  This project , "Blueprint", represents her fifth work for full orchestra: a concerto for jazz trio (tenor saxophone, trombone, and double bass), and full orchestra.  (To read more about Elizabeth, please see her bio at the Canadian Music Centre: http://www.musiccentre.ca/node/37862/showcase, or check out her website here: http://elizabethknudson.ca/).  The jazz trio involved in the project are freelance professional musicians also based in Vancouver: saxophonist Brent Mah, trombonist Jim Hopson (http://www.jimhopsonmusic.com/Home.html), and bassist Graham Clark.

"Blueprint" is set for premiere at Christ Church Cathedral, Vancouver, BC, Canada, on June 10th, 2016, with the West Coast Symphony Orchestra under the direction of internationally-acclaimed maestro Bujar Llapaj.   It will also receive a second performance on June 12th, at the Bowen Island Community School on Bowen Island, BC, Canada.  (http://www.westcoastsymphony.ca/concerts-schedu...).

The idea for the piece came together just over a year ago-- and the draft has just been completed.  Although the work did not receive any funding from provincial/national arts grants as had been hoped, we look forward to your support in bringing this unique and exciting project to life! 

Your donation will go directly toward supporting the composer's work, as well as supplementing performance fees for the soloists. (For an accurate idea of the Canadian League of Composers commissioning and music copying rates, please see: http://www.composition.org/commissioning/commis...).  Based on the CLC's minimum commissioning guidelines, a modest fee to the composer (for a 23-minute piece for full orchestra) would be in the range of $18,000.  We are not aiming to raise the full amount, though we would like to raise enough to supplement the hundreds of hours put into the composing and editing of this new work.

The orchestra performing the work, West Coast Symphony Orchestra, is comprised of a mix of professional and high-calibre amateur musicians who donate their performance services to the orchestra (the orchestra musicians are not paid).  Featured soloists are paid by the orchestra, though a very modest fee.  Currently $100 is set aside by the orchestra to pay each of the trio members for their work on this project.  We would like to raise enough to make a decent payment to each of the trio musicians, for their valuable input and time.

"Blueprint" is a 23-and-a-half minute piece, written in three movements-- to read more about it, please see the programme notes below:
_______
“For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And what is to cease breathing, but to free the breath from its restless tides, that it may rise and expand and seek God unencumbered? Only when you drink from the river of silence shall you indeed sing. And when you have reached the mountain top, then shall you begin to climb. And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.”
–Kahlil Gibran (1883-1931)
- - -
I’ve always thought of jazz as being the language of imagination and freedom— a conversational, fluid melding of ideas. This piece features a jazz trio (tenor saxophone, trombone, and double bass), set against the backdrop of an orchestra. The first movement of Blueprint opens with some precise, dancing Balkan rhythms, which set the tone and reveal the architecture of the work. The second movement begins as a slow meditation (taking its inspiration from the evocative quote by poet Kahlil Gibran, above), and builds toward a climax—“melting into the sun”—the idea of the release of the spirit from the body. The third movement mirrors the first movement in its exuberant rhythmic drive, and also draws a bit of inspiration for its raw melodic language from the delta blues. This was an incredibly fun piece to write, and I’d like to acknowledge with thanks the trio of musicians involved in the premiere: Brent Mah (tenor saxophone), Jim Hopson (trombone), and Graham Clark (double bass).
_______

We really appreciate your donation to support bringing this exciting piece to life!  Even if you can't afford a monetary donation to the project, we'd love it if you could help spread the word!  Hope to see you at the premiere, too!

Musically yours,

Elizabeth, Brent, Jim, and Graham

story:
Power The Tour

  • On surface level The Battery Tour is a national FREE live music tour brought directly to the people, for the people, and is performed with the people, on the street. The Battery tour is a group of passionate, talented millennial’s powered by batteries. We reach all generations so we are cross generational. 

 Be an Outlet

  • We want to keep bringing YOU our show, but our sound system is failing. After about 100+ FREE street shows, and events across the U.S.A. this year we are left with 2 busted speakers, ruined cords, and batteries that have damaged cells

 The People keep Us Charged

  • You "THE PEOPLE" are our everything! You guys power each show financially through tips, and donation. Word of mouth drives the success of our movement and bring foot traffic to the show. Physically your bodies are the movement behind the music, without YOU physically dancing there is no show. You are everything, and we need your help as always.

Needs

The BreakDown

  • New Batteries - The use of batteries permits the Battery Tour to travel, setup and perform anywhere without having to connect to an alternating current (AC) power supply, thus allowing the show to be simplistic and mobile.
  • Speakers, Cords, Microphones - Speakers and amplified sound are the key to truly enjoying the battery tour. Unlike any other street show in the U.S.A the Battery Tour is a concert on the street corner. We need a new sound system that can give YOU the show you deserve.
  • *Equipment List: QSC K10 speakers, Wireless Microphones (3), 4 New Batteries, QSC KSUB Powered speaker, Speaker Stands, Microphone stands (3), Heavy Duty Keyboard Stand, XLR Cables (6-10), Stereo Cables (2-4), QSC Carrying Bag, Cajun Drum.

Other Ways You Can Help

Engage. Engage. Engage. 

We need you to "Smash those like buttons'' & share this story on social media. Thanks for being the driving force behind the biggest grassroots movement in the USA. Find our social media channels @batteryTour and follow them! Tell friends and family, but more importanlty come to a show (-.-)

story:
Le projet

Cela va faire maintenant deux ans qu'on a enregistré notre album "Dear Morpheus", et nous composons actuellement notre nouvel album qui sera enregistré cet été.


Une dizaine de titres sont déjà écrits et seront enregistrés cet été au studio The Office / The Artist, en collaboration avec Dooweet Agency. Nous avons besoin de vous, pour participer à l'aventure Evenline.

On a pensé qu'impliquer notre public dans ce projet nous garantirait une certaine indépendance. On a prit notre temps, on a travaillé dur et on a des chansons dont on est vraiment fiers.

On a vraiment hâte de vous faire écouter notre nouvel album !



Pourquoi 10000€?

Avec 10000€, nous pourrons couvrir une partie des frais de notre nouvel album. Entre autres, vous nous permettrez de financer le studio, la fabrication des disques, un clip, la promotion autour de l'album mais surtout, vous deviendrez producteurs de l'album et nous aiderez ainsi à garder notre indépendance, nos libres choix et la direction artistique que nous souhaitons prendre.



Historique de Evenline

Nous avons joué en première partie des groupes suivants :
- Alter Bridge au Den Atelier.
- Seether au Forum de Vauréal
- Glamour of the Kill au Batofar (Paris)
- Lower than Atlantis au Point Ephémère (Paris)
- AqME au Glazart (Paris)
- Bukowski au Barde Atomique (Ecquevilly)


Et sommes parti en tournée en 2015 :
09/03 - Le Batofar w/ Glamour of the Kill (Paris)
28/03 - Le Barde Atomique w/ Bukowski (Ecquevilly)
17/04 - Péniche Antipode, Acoustique (Paris)
24/04 - Le Chopper (Roubaix)
25/04 - Péniche Alternat (Paris)
26/04 - Hurricane's (Tour)
28/04 - La Marquise (Lyon)
29/04 - O'CD acoustic session (Lyon)
30/04 - Bluerose (Bresso - Italy)
01/05 - Borderline (Modena - Italy)
02/05 - Circolo Magoa (Pavia - Italy)
03/05 - Live 23 (Alessandria - Italy)
04/05 - Point Ephémère w/ Lower than Atlantis (Paris)
23/05 - Printemps du Rock (Marly la Ville)
29/05 - Glazart w/ AqME (Paris)
30/05 - Kustom (Fontainebleau)


Nos premiers clips sur VEVO






Merci pour votre soutien, et n'hésitez pas à nous suivre :
http://evenline-music.com
http://facebook.com/evenlinemusic

Pourquoi 10000€?
Avec 10000€, nous pourrons couvrir une partie des frais de notre nouvel album. Entre autres, vous nous permettrez de financer le studio, la fabrication des disques, un clip, la promotion autour de l'album mais surtout, vous deviendrez producteurs de l'album et nous aiderez ainsi à garder notre indépendance, nos libres choix et la direction artistique que nous souhaitons prendre.


Historique de Evenline

    Nous avons joué en première partie des groupes suivants :- Alter Bridge au Den Atelier. 
    - Seether au Forum de Vauréal
    - Glamour of the Kill au Batofar (Paris)
    - Lower than Atlantis au Point Ephémère (Paris)
    - AqME au Glazart (Paris)
    - Bukowski au Barde Atomique (Ecquevilly)
Et sommes parti en tournée en 2015 :09/03 - Le Batofar w/ Glamour of the Kill (Paris)
    28/03 - Le Barde Atomique w/ Bukowski (Ecquevilly)
    17/04 - Péniche Antipode, Acoustique (Paris)
    24/04 - Le Chopper (Roubaix)
    25/04 - Péniche Alternat (Paris)
    26/04 - Hurricane's (Tour)
    28/04 - La Marquise (Lyon)
    29/04 - O'CD acoustic session (Lyon)
    30/04 - Bluerose (Bresso - Italy)
    01/05 - Borderline (Modena - Italy)
    02/05 - Circolo Magoa (Pavia - Italy)
    03/05 - Live 23 (Alessandria - Italy)
    04/05 - Point Ephémère w/ Lower than Atlantis (Paris)
    23/05 - Printemps du Rock (Marly la Ville)
    29/05 - Glazart w/ AqME (Paris)
    30/05 - Kustom (Fontainebleau)
Nos premiers clips sur VEVO




Merci pour votre soutien, et n'hésitez pas à nous suivre :http://evenline-music.comhttp://facebook.com/evenlinemusic

story:
Powerful Partnership Possible

Ever since my eyes were opened to the fact that many Jamaicans think in Jamaican Creole - aka 'Patwa' - I have been passionate about making sure that as many as possible hear the Word of God in the language they think in. One of the best ways has been simply using my MacBook Pro to video tape myself reading from the Jamaican New Testament, and uploading it to Facebook and Youtube.

Since January I have been without a laptop, and the quality of production has been decreased since I've been using an iPad - which I'm very happy to report I was able to purchase because of a previous Indiegogo campaign! This campaign is very simply focused on raising funds to purchase a MacBook Pro so that my production can be restored to better quality.

What We Need & What You Get

US$2000 should be able to cover the cost of a good Macbook Pro  plus shipping and custom fees. Even if we do not raise that total, we should be able to purchase something that will work better than what we are currently using.

Some of the perks from the previous campaign remain. Participating can bring rewards such as signed copies of the Jamaican New Testament and copies of the highly acclaimed collection of Jamaican worship songs Kom Mek Wi Worship.

Powerful Impact

I cannot begin to explain adequately the powerful impact these readings have been having on Jamaicans and non-Jamaicans alike. A most recent testimonial stated that the readings caused the listener to see all the action taking place vividly, blow by blow. In fact, he said if he had heard God's Word like that from the beginning, he would have accepted Christ years ago! Listen to a sample here from St. John 10. Here's another sample from St. Luke 11 - The Lord's Prayer.


Please Share!

So there it is! Here is your chance to contribute to making a huge difference in the lives of many persons. Even if you cannot make a financial contribution, please use your influence to invite others to be a part of this life-changing project. Hit the 'share' button and spread the word!!

story:
Short Summary:

The Revival 2016 is the 2nd annual music and cultural arts festival located 20 minutes north of Squamish, BC. A group of avid music lovers who share a love and respect for the great outdoors have been gathering casually in the in the beautiful countryside surrounding Squamish for the last few summers. Until last year when event founder Benjamin Wise turned what was once a camping trip into something so much more. He had 12 top-notch local bands perform throughout the weekend, some of the finest yoga teachers in Vancouver teaching morning classes; A solid team of volunteers came together and pulled off a truly unforgettable weekend for everyone involved. 

Benny Wise is from the UK, he's lived in Vancouver booking and producing local shows now for five years and has made more friends than some people make in a lifetime. The 2015 Revival Festival lineup was 100% curated by him - and everyone involved volunteered their time and efforts simply because they love and believe in Benny. The event was an enormous success, but not without financial loss which Benny took the brunt of. We understand it takes a lot to make a festival like this work - we pledge to use every hard earned dollar you give us to put on a truly memorable event for you this summer, and hopefully every summer going forward.

What we need & what you'll get: 

This year - we want to ensure that everyone involved in bringing this magical weekend come to life are compensated properly for their time and efforts. That's where you come in: we need to raise $7000 above and beyond what we expect to make in ticket sales to make this event happen. We want to keep tickets down to an affordable price for our guests, and in order to do that, we need some help to raise money to cover the running costs of the production.

The money will go directly to festival operations: The venue cost, insurance, staging, lighting & sound, washroom facilities, waste management, first aid and paying the performers.

We appreciate you! If you are able to donate to bring The Revival to life - you will get some really sweet stuff in return: including free music downloads from the festival artists, a copy of the post-festival compilation album, a high quality event poster signed by all of the artists, a full festival kit and more. If you contribute enough, your entire festival pass will be covered. VIP Camping Experiences are also available.

Impact:

The Revival is a weekend to revive our bodies and minds with creativity, yoga, music, the outdoors and personal connection. It revives core values of love, and acceptance. This year we are upping our musical roster to 15. We have local sustainable food vendors, supplying our guests with healthy and affordable food and drink. In addition to last year, we also have local artists and designers showcasing their work and daily Hula Hoop lessons.

We believe in The Revival because it is completely grassroots, full of truly home grown talent and is such a quality experience for both our audience and our contributors. Everyone leaves the weekend feeling richer, having made new friends and having discovered new things. It is also very important to us that our event be sustainable - we have plans in place for waste management and are working closely with the property owner to leave zero carbon footprint in our wake.

Risks and Challenges:

Last year, Benny took a huge risk putting on the first Revival Festival. Although everyone had an amazing time and the event appeared to be a success from the point of view of the attendees, he did suffer a financial loss, as is expected when one person takes on such a large endeavor themselves.

In addition to the financial risk - running an outdoor production like this comes with other variables - there's weather, noise restrictions, fire bans and other unforeseen circumstances to consider. This event will go on rain or shine - we have contingencies in place to combat these issues, as long as we have the support we need from people like you.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially - we totally get it - and if you can share this campaign with your friends and networks - that will still help us tremendously!

If you want to support this project, going above and beyond this campaign - BUY A TICKET! Early bird tickets are only $75 (an absolute steal of a deal for an event of this caliber) and will be on sale on Friday, March 18th.

story:
Society has collectively accomplished more than we've ever dreamed possible. And still, we remain perpetually dissatisfied, hardwired never to be content, to always keep reaching. Yet, this allows us to transcend boundaries. We've left the caves. We are reaching for the heavens. At Cervelio, we continue the evolution, reimagining how you interact with the abstract—how you listen to music.

Listening to music has become easier than ever with technology removing friction from the experience. However, in removing the barriers to music, technology has overwhelmed us. When you want to listen to music, you have to sort through millions and millions of songs, artists, and genres. And most commonly, you'll be indecisive. We want to remove all of that. So here is our proposition: our headphones will detect your emotion through biofeedback sensing. And this is beautiful. You, as the listener, will become the artist. You get to coordinate music through your own mind. Join us on our journey to unleash the power of the human mind.

We are offering you headphones that constantly analyze many streams of information to build awareness of your context, emotions, and habits.

  • Listen to beautiful music.
  • Get songs tailored for you.
  • Device learns your habits based on your reactions.
  • Listen to even more beautiful music.

We are a group of diverse entrepreneurial students coming from various backgrounds, such as neuroscience, biochemistry, biomedical, electrical, mechanical and computer systems engineering, physics, marketing, and business. How we met was through the largest entrepreneurship study abroad program called the European Innovation Academy held in Turin, Italy. Here we learned the necessary tools and knowledge to build a startup company from scratch.

Like what we're doing? Share the Cervelio headphones with your friends and family!

   

Emerging technologies provide new investment opportunities, such as elevated growth rates, higher expected returns, and diversification benefits. The challenge we see here, however, is the difficulty in raising capital. The production and manufacturing processes involved in making our device require a substantial amount of capital. We are, however, working tirelessly to acquire the necessary capital to develop our technology.

Do I have to use my phone to use the headphones?

Yes. You'll need to use your phone to access the companion app, so the headphones can measure and store your data. The headphones will communicate information to your phone through the use of Bluetooth. The sensors on the headphones will still run even if you don't have the companion app open; however, for the best experience, we recommend using both the app and the headphones concurrently.

When will I receive my pair?

We will start releasing our field prototype in December. 

Can the headphones be paired with two separate devices at the same time?

At the moment, the headphones cannot be paired with two separate devices at the same time. 

Can I use a different music app to listen to music?

We provide you songs from Spotify and SoundCloud.

Why am I receiving a field test prototype?

We will be sending you a field test prototype, so we can start collecting data to input onto our algorithm. Once we're ready to release a fully-functioning product, just simply send us the prototype and we'll provide you with credit for buying the end product.

 

Cervelio.com | Reimagining Your Music Experience

story: .

"In Between" - Free Song Download!
 

Short Summary

Hello, I'm Stephen Cox. I've been playing bass and writing music for over 15 years. For most of that time, I have dreamed of having my own album. "Transitions," will not only be a work of art to share with friends and family, it is also a key to countless opportunities! It will allow me to get radio play, T.V. placement, shows out of state and possibly even the country, and it will let other artists know why they should hire me for their projects and shows. By contributing to this, you are propelling my career forward, as well as helping to support the other musicians, photographer(s) and sound engineers involved in this project.

What I Need & What You Get

In order to achieve this goal, I need to pay a lot of people: The musicians, the audio engineer, the mastering engineer, the manufacturers of the CDs, the graphic arts designer, the online music distributors, the photographer of the cover art (Drew Stawin)...It ends up being a lot of money! $5,000 is an estimate of all of these costs, but it may cost more depending on unforeseen obstacles.

If you help me achieve this goal, there are many cool rewards you will receive including your name on the album Acknowledgements, a copy of the cd, and even a private house concert!

If the entire goal is not met, I will still finish the album! I am willing to do whatever it takes to complete this project! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can help fund my project or not, you can help me out in a few ways: 

1) Please share this page and video with anyone that might be interested! There are tools on here to share this page, as well as just copying the link.

2) Help put me in contact with industry people who can help me get on radio, morning T.V. shows, and events/festivals!

3) If you can't afford to help now, you can always get a copy of the CD when it comes out!

Thank you for helping me reach my goal!

story:
Who We Are

We are an alternative indie band from Portland, Oregon, and are ready to take our music to the next level. We are extremely passionate about what we do, however, we lack the funds to do so. We are incredibly dedicated to our band and our music, so any contribution in which you make would go straight to making new music monthly, new gear when needed, and quality of live shows. Any contribution, small or large, is extremely appreciated, every single dollar counts.

What We Need & What You Get

All donations provided would go to gear of which is vital to our sound. While we are incredibly passionate about our music, we are as well very passionate about providing quality new music for our growing fanbase. Feedback is very important to us, and our goal as a band is to increase the level of positive feedback and satisfaction for listeners. The $1500 would go entirely to only what we need to make quality music for fans as and contributors. 

The Impact

We have always told ourselves that the satisfaction of our listeners is vital to what we do. We want more than anything to write, record, and release good music that people can relate to. Your contribution would help us a massive amount in achieving this, and when we receive your contributions and apply them to what we are going to do, we in return will record and release music for you.  

Risks & Challenges

Our main challenge or hurtle is obtaining the money for what we want to do, which is why we are creating this campaign. Our biggest hurdle has always been not being able to afford the gear we need to be as successful as we wish to be. With the contributions, we would make our sound as quality as possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Although not all people can afford to contribute, you can still help by simply offering feedback and spreading the word about our band! Money is great, but exposure is just as valuable. Any amount of attention or contribution means the world to us. We are trying very hard to make this work and we are enjoying every moment we are creating music. You are helping us make that possible.

story:
Below are two songs that are mixed and ready for mastering. The first one is entitled, "Everybody Loves To Hate L.A." and the second one is "I'll Meet You There". Enjoy!!!! This will give you a little glimpse to what I am doing in the studio!

           

 

 

                                       
 

I am Jaynee Thorne. I’ve lived in the Los Angeles area since 1962, an import from Roslyn, New York. The Beatles opened my ears to music in 1964. My maternal grandfather was a popular songwriter of the late 1920’s. My paternal grandmother was an opera singer. Music was in my blood. For most  of my musical endeavors, I have enjoyed being a harmony singer. I love feeling the resonance of other singers' voices in my chest. This album will force me to take center stage, a place not really in my comfort zone.

THIS ALBUM IS DEDICATED TO MY PARENTS AND MY GRANDPARENTS WHO GAVE ME THE GIFT OF MUSIC! ... And to the community of musicians and friends who now have BECOME my family.

Music became very important to me in my pre-teen years, when the dysfunction of family life and changes in life became difficult for me to cope with. I began writing when my best friend died from leukemia, and I performed a song I wrote for her at our Junior High School graduation.  I witnessed the power of music as the attendees of the graduation cried during my performance. I knew then, the significance of music, and the healing power of writing positive songs.

We are all a product of DNA and environment. We are also a product of our parents' beliefs and fears, along with the exact way we are all hard-wired. Bottom line, my desire to follow my heart in music lost out to putting a roof over my head. A practical decision. One that I am not ashamed of making. However, as I am getting older, I see that I need to put my music in physical form… and MAKE AN ALBUM.  Up to this point in my life, I have succeeded in some things, but taking the time, money and courage to record my music has not come to fruition for over forty-something years. Thus, the title of this project… “The Forty-Something First Album.” I see that I have not been able to do this alone. I need the support of those who care for me to keep me focused; to help me follow through on this most important journey – making an album. Music IS important - for its own artistic sake... even if it doesn’t pay the mortgage.

 
 

 

  • Where does your contribution go?

Everyone needs to know this and it's important that you understand the details in what it takes to make an album. Until I started to go in the studio, and started the process of recording the album, I didn’t even know how much goes into this process. The album itself will take many dozens of hours of studio time alone. After the album is recorded, the mixing process begins, then mastering makes the recordings ready for the CD manufacturing.

Your contributions will cover all of these aspects of this project:

  • Producing the album
  • Mixing and Mastering the album
  • The Musicians in the studio
  • The Musicians promoting the album
  • Pressing and packaging of CD's 
  • Paying for the cover art
  • Shipping the album to YOU
  • Shipping the album to radio stations
  • Shipping the album along with other materials to festivals
  • Promoting the album
  • Paying the Indiegogo fee
 
 

 


 

  • The Impact:

Music is a powerful healer. I hope that those who listen to my music feel moved and inspired by the lyrics and dance to the melodies! I hope my vulnerability and honesty will help others see that they are not alone in their experiences.

  • Risks & Challenges:

The risk that a songwriter takes is feeling vulnerable when they write a song that reveals a lot about themselves. But that is what writing music is about! My songs are cathartic. I've had to let go of feeling fearful and let myself and others see all aspects of my heart. That is what music is: what feelings would sound like. The only risk in this project, is not doing it… not being willing to allow creativity to come through. This album will get finished. I see this project becoming fully funded and blessed by all who join in its manifestation. Those who need to hear this music ...will… just as the Universe works.

  • Other Ways You Can Help:

I understand money can be tight. Whether or not contributing to the campaign is feasible, there are other ways you can be a valuable part of the “Forty-Something First Album” project. HELP SPREAD THE WORD about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and thereby ultimately assisting us in reaching our goal! Thank you for your love!

I so look forward to making this magical journey with you! Thank you for being a part of this moment in my life.   ….Jaynee

 

Leslie Beauvais and Jaynee singing with the Severin Browne band.

 

Penny Nichols, Jaynee Thorne, Severin Browne and Janice Smith at Summersongs West.

 A song collage of my grandfather, Billy Stone.
story_txt:
Below are two songs that are mixed and ready for mastering. The first one is entitled, "Everybody Loves To Hate L.A." and the second one is "I'll Meet You There". Enjoy!!!! This will give you a little glimpse to what I am doing in the studio!


           
 

 

                                        

 
I am Jaynee Thorne. I’ve lived in the Los Angeles area since 1962, an import from Roslyn, New York. The Beatles opened my ears to music in 1964. My maternal grandfather was a popular songwriter of the late 1920’s. My paternal grandmother was an opera singer. Music was in my blood. For most  of my musical endeavors, I have enjoyed being a harmony singer. I love feeling the resonance of other singers' voices in my chest. This album will force me to take center stage, a place not really in my comfort zone.THIS ALBUM IS DEDICATED TO MY PARENTS AND MY GRANDPARENTS WHO GAVE ME THE GIFT OF MUSIC! ... And to the community of musicians and friends who now have BECOME my family.Music became very important to me in my pre-teen years, when the dysfunction of family life and changes in life became difficult for me to cope with. I began writing when my best friend died from leukemia, and I performed a song I wrote for her at our Junior High School graduation.  I witnessed the power of music as the attendees of the graduation cried during my performance. I knew then, the significance of music, and the healing power of writing positive songs.We are all a product of DNA and environment. We are also a product of our parents' beliefs and fears, along with the exact way we are all hard-wired. Bottom line, my desire to follow my heart in music lost out to putting a roof over my head. A practical decision. One that I am not ashamed of making. However, as I am getting older, I see that I need to put my music in physical form… and MAKE AN ALBUM.  Up to this point in my life, I have succeeded in some things, but taking the time, money and courage to record my music has not come to fruition for over forty-something years. Thus, the title of this project… “The Forty-Something First Album.” I see that I have not been able to do this alone. I need the support of those who care for me to keep me focused; to help me follow through on this most important journey – making an album. Music IS important - for its own artistic sake... even if it doesn’t pay the mortgage.   Where does your contribution go?Everyone needs to know this and it's important that you understand the details in what it takes to make an album. Until I started to go in the studio, and started the process of recording the album, I didn’t even know how much goes into this process. The album itself will take many dozens of hours of studio time alone. After the album is recorded, the mixing process begins, then mastering makes the recordings ready for the CD manufacturing.Your contributions will cover all of these aspects of this project:
Producing the album
Mixing and Mastering the album
The Musicians in the studio
The Musicians promoting the album
Pressing and packaging of CD's 
Paying for the cover art
Shipping the album to YOU
Shipping the album to radio stations
Shipping the album along with other materials to festivals
Promoting the album
Paying the Indiegogo fee

 

 


  The Impact:Music is a powerful healer. I hope that those who listen to my music feel moved and inspired by the lyrics and dance to the melodies! I hope my vulnerability and honesty will help others see that they are not alone in their experiences.Risks & Challenges:The risk that a songwriter takes is feeling vulnerable when they write a song that reveals a lot about themselves. But that is what writing music is about! My songs are cathartic. I've had to let go of feeling fearful and let myself and others see all aspects of my heart. That is what music is: what feelings would sound like. The only risk in this project, is not doing it… not being willing to allow creativity to come through. This album will get finished. I see this project becoming fully funded and blessed by all who join in its manifestation. Those who need to hear this music ...will… just as the Universe works.Other Ways You Can Help:I understand money can be tight. Whether or not contributing to the campaign is feasible, there are other ways you can be a valuable part of the “Forty-Something First Album” project. HELP SPREAD THE WORD about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and thereby ultimately assisting us in reaching our goal! Thank you for your love!I so look forward to making this magical journey with you! Thank you for being a part of this moment in my life.   ….Jaynee Leslie Beauvais and Jaynee singing with the Severin Browne band. Penny Nichols, Jaynee Thorne, Severin Browne and Janice Smith at Summersongs West. A song collage of my grandfather, Billy Stone.

story:
New Vibe. New Trend. New Hope.

Ask anyone who has ever had a dream, a goal, and ambition—it requires hard work, dedication, and passion.  It requires creativity.  It requires ingenuity.  It requires inspiration.

Founded in 2007, Jeigh B. Records is a digital & project based record label that strives to bring together all genres and lovers of great music and film.  Jeigh B. Records was established to build a platform for creative artists from all walks of life to launch and fuel their careers with support and resources every step of the way.  Our diverse collaborations with artists include: Def Bananas, Emma Stuart, Oh No, 513 Elevators and Amber Riley.  

[* In 2016 Def Bananas song “Something New” became the theme song for the new web series “the new shade of Black”.]

This campaign was created to aid in the production of the following: 
1. Free Download Mix Tape by Arjay Smith (a.k.a. Jus Beyond) 
2. iTunes LP Album by Yngcult 
3. A Short Film (Directed by Oz Scott, Created by Arjay Smith & Brittany Smith) 

This campaign will provide Jeigh B. Records with the capital we need to support our artists! We are proud to bring forth these five exciting and inspiring projects that promote diversity, creativity, and individuality.  Our goal is to elevate and transform the culture through great artists, production, visuals and a streamlined digital distribution approach.  

Your kind donation will help support the dreams of several artists in music and film.  To show our appreciation we have some unique perks.  There’s an exclusive opportunity to be featured in the short film, attend a listening party and receive a credit on all of our projects.  Even if we don’t reach our goal, the money that we do raise will help advance the Jeigh B. Records label.

Please show additional support for our campaign by spreading the word to family and friends using the Indiegogo share tools.

JEIGH B. RECORDS WEBSITE: http://jeighbrecords.com/

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jordi Baizan.  I am a singer-songwriter, writer, and public speaker.  I have had an amazing journey in the last 10 years since I got back into music after a long hiatus. It started with playing covers for friends and family and has grown to three records released in the last 6 years with my band, QandA.  We are playing all over Texas to growing audiences and will continue to do so.

But now I have the opportunity to take things to a whole new level.  Our four great kids are grown and off pursuing their own dreams.  My wife Carmen and I are experiencing the freedom of the empty nest! This new flexibility gives me the opportunity to travel as a solo artist in a way that I cannot travel with a full band.  My vision is to travel the United States and beyond to help and inspire people to be their best selves by sharing myself through my music, writing and public speaking.  It is a childhood dream come true!

My mission is to do more, much more, but I cannot do it without you. With you as my partner and with a great deal of hard work and investment on my part,  I will release my first solo record in early 2017 and go from doing 6 live events in 2016 as Jordi Baizan to 60 live events in 2017.  Live events are solo shows or speaking engagements.   I will also produce and release new videos, songs, blog posts and speaking presentations that will inspire and serve those that are gracious enough to listen and engage.

I am humbled by the wonderful feedback and support that you guys have always given me in the past.  Together, we can continue to produce great music and content, reach out to people across the globe, and inspire them with the best that I can give.

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we need a total of $10,000.  These funds will help me to release my first solo record, provide marketing support, and engage potential fans with a new website and quality video.  Not only will you make a tremendous impact on the success of our mission, but you will enjoy some really cool rewards and experiences that include advance copies of the new record, unique merchandise, private concerts in your own home, behind the scenes access, and, if we achieve the campaign goal, a live video stream concert for everyone who partners with me on this project!  

The Impact

By joining Team Jordi, you will make a massive difference.  Here is more detail on how the resources from this campaign will be used to create and connect more than ever before.

There are basically three things that we need in order to accomplish our 2017 goals:

1) Smart Marketing to expose our work to those who might be interested.  I will travel to Industry conferences like the Southwest Regional Folk Alliance, International Folk Alliance, and Far West Folk Alliance to perform for and network with venue owners, booking agents, industry professionals, and fellow artists.  We will do some targeted Facebook advertising for live events and/or to get people to our website.  We will do some radio promotion to get our music to new fans.  Finally, I  will enter songwriting competitions and festivals to increase exposure and recognition of the work.

2)  Website and Video to involve those who want to know more using the power of multimedia to create connection.  We will build a new website and create videos to involve those that want to know more and give them the opportunity to sign up for the email list, attend or book a live event, or buy the new record.

3)  Quality Content to bring value to the community and create the resources to grow the mission.  We will release my first solo record, Like the First Time.  These songs are inspired by loving relationships,  the triumph of the human spirit in the face of tragedy, the beauty of nature, how our decisions give us the power to shape our destiny,  and the importance of family and where I grew up.  To listen to the title track and read about what moved me to write it, CLICK HERE. I am honored that this project was recorded and produced in Nashville by the brilliant Ren Renfree.  The songs are taken to a whole other level by a short list of amazing players including Lloyd Maines, (Dobro and Slide Guitar), Chris Gage (Accordion), John Pointer (Cello), Peter "Ren" Renfree (Guitar, Mandolin, Bass and Percussion) and Steve Thomas (Fiddle).  We had so much fun and I believe you will enjoy the record as much as we got a kick out of making it! 

Risks & Challenges

There is a great deal of work ahead, and many challenges that we do not foresee.  I might find that there are areas in which I need to improve as an artist, writer, or speaker to reach my full potential.   Some of our efforts might not have the impact we expected or desired.  

To combat these challenges, I have committed to spending my time primarily on the creative side of the mission, on improving my craft.  I have also brought on a very experienced team to manage the business side of the mission.  They are Ren and Andi Renfree of Aren Creative and Charlie Stewart of Handshake Management.  Their experience in all areas of the music industry will help me to avoid common pitfalls and make good strategic and tactical decisions every step of the way.  They will also handle the details that bog down so many artists such as booking, promotion, website management, networking, and so much more.  They are as passionate as I am about the vision and mission.   We hope you will bring your own passion to the campaign and partner with us today!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

I am asking all of you to please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well as email, Facebook and Twitter!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well as email, Facebook and Twitter!

story:
The Project

Hello! My name is Joshuah Noah Snel, I'm an aspiring artist trying to fulfill my goal of creating and releasing my first ever studio album! I was born and raised in Redding, a small town in northern California, and since birth have always desired to add my artistic innovative mark to the world. I recently moved to Southern California in order to further pursue my passions and gain a successful career. I'm here on Indiegogo to promote and gather support for just that! With your help, I can finally be able to share my music and passion on a significantly larger scale. Having a complete album is not only a magnificent accomplishment for myself and my supporters but, also gives a stronger value towards my career when finding venues to perform at for the future touring I intend to do.

 

 

 

How You Can Help!

The goal is to raise $1,600 for the creation of the album. All the money raised will go directly into paying for the the total cost of the process and make of the album. If the $1,600 goal is exceeded, the rest of the money will go towards making  professional music videos for the album or a community help foundation of my choosing. The sooner the goal is met, the faster I can bring you a fresh palate of music for you to listen to! A shared win win project that helps  make my dream become a reality and provides you with an engaging heart felt body of music. Let's do this!

 

Below is the first of many songs that would be on the album. If you like it and want to here more please donate so I can get back into the recording studio to make it for you! Donors will also get exclusive snipets of the songs on the album as the production progresses.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Support

It's Been a Long (at times) difficult road to get to where I am today with the opportunity before me, even though I'm still at the beginnings of my singing career. But, I am so thankful for you and all my supporters for helping where you can and believing in me. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.

 

Feel free to look up my youtube channel and facebook page for updates and cover songs under, Joshuah Noah snel or use this link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCt_0zWB_wpoFKCWpLakU86A You can also support and follow my journey on instagram: @joshuah.noah.snel

story:
Das neue Album "Karussell" von Till Simon

 

Till Simon, passionierter Songschreiber mit eigener “Music School” in Achim, präsentiert “Geschichten über das Leben mit der Wahrheit, ungeschminkt und ehrlich”. Seine enorme Präsenz macht den großen Blonden auf der Bühne unüberseh- und –hörbar. Simon steht wie ein Fels in der Brandung, seine sonore, markante Stimme geht sofort ins Ohr. Als “deutschen Pop” charakterisiert der Singer-Songwriter seine melodiösen Songs, die mal munter und spielerisch, mal leise und verträumt daherkommen. 

Seit Anfang 2016 arbeitet Till Simon mit Hochdruck an neuem Material und hat schon einige Aufnahmesessions mit seiner Band absolviert. Die Produktion des neuen Albums "Karussell" befindet sich nunmehr in der entscheidenen Phase.

In dieser Phase würde er sich über die Unterstützung seiner Fans freuen um das Album abschliessend zu realisieren.

Im Gegenzug erhalten die Unterstützer viele Interessante Perks, vor allen Dingen werden sie schon vor dem geplanten Release Termin am 18.03.2017 exklusiv das neue Album erhalten.  

 

 

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

 

 Ein Album zu produzieren ist kostenaufwändig. Gerade zum Ende einer Produktion kommt das Budget an seine Grenzen. An dieser Stelle könnt ihr euch als  Unterstützer einbringen und das Album über die Ziellinie tragen. 

Es ist möglich das Album als Download oder CD einen Monat vor dem Release (18.03.2017) zu erhalten. Weiter gibt es die Möglichkeit ein Wohnzimmerkonzert zu buchen. 

weitere Perks:

- Songwriter-Coaching

- das erste Album "Von Innen nach Außen" 

- ein personalisiertes Geburtstagslied

- und mehr
