story:
Short Summary

We're a four piece stoner rock band based in Trondheim, Norway. On 1st September 2015 we released "Down With the Sun", our first full length album, on Nasoni Records. It was all good fun, but we want to make an even better album this time. We have already signed a deal with All Good Clean Records, and are set for release of a 7" single this spring and the full album in autumn.

The deal is a split kind of deal, so we pay some of the pressings and all of the mixing and mastering, plus artwork. Now, that's a decent amount of money we currently don't have, as everything was spent on the recordings.

What we found when releasing the first album was an incredible supportive audience ranging from countries like Russia in east to Brazil in west and many in between. Asking anyone for money isn't something you really wanna do, but maybe it can be a bit of a win-win as we think this album is a much stronger and more complete album than the last one. 

So what if no one contributes here? Well, we have to have a plan for that, and that's pretty much applying for every penny (or krone) we can in different funds and organisations. Most likely, that won't be enough anyways. So the album will have to be put off for a while, and the whole process basically put on pause until we all have regular incomes or something like that.

What am I paying for?

Okay, let's break it down to the details of this puzzle:

The recordings set us back about £2500, and that's what we had from gigs + selling albums and merch.

Coming up we have three main outcome posts to overcome:

  • Pressing: £750 (our share of a given total amount, split with record company)
  • Mixing: £1800
  • Mastering: £900
  • Artwork: £500

Total: £3950

We haven't included the merch here, that's gonna have to come later. The sums are approximate, but pretty realistic with the amounts coming from the people involved in these processes.

Okay. We're nothing without our fans/listeners. We so desperately want to give you this, and would have gladly given it all to you for free! But turns out the music business wants its money beforehand and do not give a shit about your little songs unless they sell out Wembley on a Sunday. So we figured we'd turn to the people who listen to, and buy, these songs we put out and ask the biggest of favours: Let's make this album happen together!!

No matter if we reach our goal or not, every penny we get will be put into getting this album out. And should we surpass the amount, then we'll make merch. And if we drastically surpass the amount, we're heading straight out to Europe to play the autumn of 2017!

A bit about the album

The album is possibly a bit heavier than the first one. Even more sluggish. Maybe a bit darker? We've written pretty much all the songs together as a band this time, and that has influenced the songs quite a lot. They fit a bit better together than on the first album, and have a wholeness over them.

We've also used another studio for the recordings, and will be using another sound engineer to mix and master the album. The sound on the first album was killer, but it's always good to change things around and look for other potentials in our sound.

The single will be out this autumn no matter the amount we can generate here, so hopefully you'll be eager to hear more after that. 

So basically, we've got all the planning done. It's all pretty much set. As long as we can find a way to fund it all!

The ifs

Yeah.. well, really, if we achieve our goal here, there aren't too many ifs. We're too focused on releasing this to getting stuck in anything else than the economical. The only risk we don't want to take is loaning money to realise the album. We need the money we put into it to be ours, so that if the investment doesn't pay off somehow, we're not in personal debt that we can't handle. One of us mentioned that we each have £2000 on our mastercards. He now takes no further part in our financial planning anymore.

Wish I could help man, but I've literally got no money..

That's cool. We'd appreciate it if you told a very very very rich stoner rock friend about it. They're all over the place.

 

Thank You!

All the best,

Jostein, Magnus, Simen and Sverre
story_txt:
Short Summary
We're a four piece stoner rock band based in Trondheim, Norway. On 1st September 2015 we released "Down With the Sun", our first full length album, on Nasoni Records. It was all good fun, but we want to make an even better album this time. We have already signed a deal with All Good Clean Records, and are set for release of a 7" single this spring and the full album in autumn.
The deal is a split kind of deal, so we pay some of the pressings and all of the mixing and mastering, plus artwork. Now, that's a decent amount of money we currently don't have, as everything was spent on the recordings.
What we found when releasing the first album was an incredible supportive audience ranging from countries like Russia in east to Brazil in west and many in between. Asking anyone for money isn't something you really wanna do, but maybe it can be a bit of a win-win as we think this album is a much stronger and more complete album than the last one. 
So what if no one contributes here? Well, we have to have a plan for that, and that's pretty much applying for every penny (or krone) we can in different funds and organisations. Most likely, that won't be enough anyways. So the album will have to be put off for a while, and the whole process basically put on pause until we all have regular incomes or something like that.

What am I paying for?
Okay, let's break it down to the details of this puzzle:
The recordings set us back about £2500, and that's what we had from gigs + selling albums and merch.
Coming up we have three main outcome posts to overcome:

Pressing: £750 (our share of a given total amount, split with record company)
Mixing: £1800
Mastering: £900
Artwork: £500

Total: £3950
We haven't included the merch here, that's gonna have to come later. The sums are approximate, but pretty realistic with the amounts coming from the people involved in these processes.
Okay. We're nothing without our fans/listeners. We so desperately want to give you this, and would have gladly given it all to you for free! But turns out the music business wants its money beforehand and do not give a shit about your little songs unless they sell out Wembley on a Sunday. So we figured we'd turn to the people who listen to, and buy, these songs we put out and ask the biggest of favours: Let's make this album happen together!!
No matter if we reach our goal or not, every penny we get will be put into getting this album out. And should we surpass the amount, then we'll make merch. And if we drastically surpass the amount, we're heading straight out to Europe to play the autumn of 2017!

A bit about the album
The album is possibly a bit heavier than the first one. Even more sluggish. Maybe a bit darker? We've written pretty much all the songs together as a band this time, and that has influenced the songs quite a lot. They fit a bit better together than on the first album, and have a wholeness over them.
We've also used another studio for the recordings, and will be using another sound engineer to mix and master the album. The sound on the first album was killer, but it's always good to change things around and look for other potentials in our sound.
The single will be out this autumn no matter the amount we can generate here, so hopefully you'll be eager to hear more after that. 
So basically, we've got all the planning done. It's all pretty much set. As long as we can find a way to fund it all!

The ifs
Yeah.. well, really, if we achieve our goal here, there aren't too many ifs. We're too focused on releasing this to getting stuck in anything else than the economical. The only risk we don't want to take is loaning money to realise the album. We need the money we put into it to be ours, so that if the investment doesn't pay off somehow, we're not in personal debt that we can't handle. One of us mentioned that we each have £2000 on our mastercards. He now takes no further part in our financial planning anymore.
Wish I could help man, but I've literally got no money..
That's cool. We'd appreciate it if you told a very very very rich stoner rock friend about it. They're all over the place.
 
Thank You!
All the best,
Jostein, Magnus, Simen and Sverre

story:
Hello!

My name is Lottie, and I'm making a record. I'm a Nashville based singer-songwriter, writing and singing what I call soul-infused Americana. With this donation-driven crowd funding campaign, I am inviting my fans and patrons to embark on the indescribable journey it is to make a record, and thus, to be an integral part of creating this work of art that I've been meticulously crafting for the past two and a half years. By donating, you are essentially making my purpose and musical calling in life become a possibility, and I, for one, happen to think that that's pretty amazing!

Where my  last release, Leaving the Labyrinth, was melancholy, this new one is triumphant. Where the last record showed the view from the trenches, this next record shows what happened when I finally made it out. Where Leaving emanated Alison Krauss, Judy Collins and Joni Mitchell, this new work channels Margo Price, Susan Tedeschi and Bonnie Raitt, with a splash of those beautifully sad hues that colored my last release.

The growth that my songwriting and I have gone through since that last record could never have been a possibility without the support and honest feedback from you, the fans. In that sense, you really are an essential part of the fabric that makes up my new work and sound in general, so I want to welcome all of you in helping me finish what you've helped me start. I couldn't have done it without you, and I honestly couldn't imagine doing this record any other way. Please donate today and experience, with me, the breathtaking views from the other side. Thank you so much, I love you!

Lottie

How could a record possibly cost $26,800?

Believe it or not, $26,800 is a modest number compared to the cost of many records made these days, especially major label records, which can run into the hundreds of thousands when everything's all said and done. So think about it like this! All I need to complete my goal, is for 268 of you amazing and lovely people to donate just $100. That's it! Sounds a little more doable now, right? Here's a more detailed picture of where your money will be going:

  • $17,500 = 6 musicians for 12 songs at $100 per musician per song + $500 per day for 12 days for the studio rental + $3,000 in producer fees for the amazing guys behind the music + $1,300 for professional audio mixing
  • $900 = mastering of 12 songs at $75 per song
  • $4,000 = manufacturing cost of CDs and 12" vinyl records
  • $2,000 = photos, artwork, and album cover design

  • $24,400 x IndieGoGo's 10% fee = $24,400 + $2,440 = $26,840

Your generosity and support in helping me reach my goals for this project will be well rewarded, because with every donation, you guys receive all kinds of backer-exclusive perk packages! The more you donate, the cooler your rewards get. Some of these backer-exclusive perks include an inside view into the creative and record-making process, unreleased songs, exclusive live and behind-the-scenes footage, an hour in the recording studio with me and my production team, and even private concert packages in your very own living room.

Should I not reach my funding goal, I'll do my best to make this record in the most professional way possible, but it will be much more difficult to produce these songs in the way that I envision them, and will take me much longer to complete as I try and save up the money this project will require. Should I somehow raise more than my goal, any extra funds will go towards distribution, publicity, marketing, and advertising for the new record, as well as costs to put a national tour together after the record is released.

So Why Do I Make Music?

You may be asking yourself why, exactly, it is that I continue to pursue a fickle and uncertain future in a field where I'm honestly losing far more money than I am making for the first 5 to 10 years, at minimum. The short and honest answer to that question is this: I don't have a choice, and there is no "Plan B". This is it, and I'm going to pursue my God-given purpose and calling in this life until there is simply nothing left for me to give, and nowhere else to go but up.

Far too long I ignored that voice in my head, beckoning  me to pursue my dream of a successful career in music, and eventually, that voice became louder and louder as the days rolled by, until it was an undeniable, torturous scream that I simply couldn't ignore any longer. My fears of vulnerability and rejection had finally been overpowered by my innate need to create music, so I picked up my pen and my guitar, and I started to write. 

You see, I know something about keeping feelings in because I have done it my whole life, and eventually, those feelings begin to eat you from the inside out. Writing and singing about the sadness and hardships in my life is healing for me, and I hope to help others by saying to them in my music, I've been there too. I know how you feel. You are not alone.

 With my music, I strive to share a message of kindness, strength, and love to those in need. Music has been my rock and steadfast companion throughout my entire life because music says to its listeners, "You are not alone. Someone else has been there before. You will get through this." Love and acceptance are said to be the two things that we as human beings ultimately must have, and sometimes it seems like those two things are hard to come by. Music gives us hope during those dark times, or it gives solace by saying that someone else has gone through what we're going through. In that sense, music is power, and if I have the power to make someone feel even just a little bit better and less alone because of a song of mine that they can relate to, then I've done a small part in making the world a better place. Music is my gift to the world, and my ultimate goal is just to share it with a willing and responsive audience that will use my words however they need, to get where they're going.

The Impact

In addition to helping me spread a message of love and kindness through the power of music,  you are, by donating, giving me the opportunity to fulfill another creative calling of mine by allowing me to become what I call a "warrior of the arts," specifically music. It is my belief that good music, music that has both substance and appeal, is dying a slow and painful death, due to the new and ever-evolving mechanics of the music industry that hardly, if ever, benefit the artists and songwriters who work so tirelessly to create the music you know and love. Simply put, because of ever more common music streaming services that pay artists a mere $0.00058 or less per song play, there is virtually no money to be made for independent artists such as myself, until a certain threshold has been crossed, and oddly enough, this threshold is extraordinarily difficult to cross without proper funding. It's a catch-22, as you all can imagine. There's a definite "chicken or the egg" dilemma, and it is a problem that I face head-on every single day. So, in addition to fulfilling my own creative musical needs and aspirations by recording this new record, my hope is that with more visibility in the public eye that results from a very successful record release, I can fulfill my intentions of advocating for all musicians and artists in every way necessary to insight real change and ensure that we are, one day, paid fairly.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! The best way to help, other than donating, is to share, share, share. Copy and paste this link to all your social media accounts, text the link to your friends and family, and email the campaign link to everyone you know who loves music and might be willing to lend a helping hand. Help me get the word out, every little bit helps! Remember to use the IndieGoGo share tools, and go out there and make some noise!

Important Campaign Update Tuesday, April 11th, 2017:

Hello to all of my lovely, supportive friends! I am excited to announce that I am now 51% funded, thanks to YOU ALL!! Now go on and give yahself a pat on the back - you've earned it! In addition, I'm delighted to announce to you all that we've extended my campaign by 12 days from yesterday, to include a fundraising party in Montgomery, AL this upcoming Easter weekend! That means that my campaign now officially ends on Sunday, April 23, 2017 at 9:59 pm PDT, and will include a fundraising party event to benefit my campaign, held this upcoming Saturday, April 15th at 8 pm, at The Luquire Lodge. That address is:

2015 E 2nd Street, Montgomery, AL 36106

The party will be generously hosted by my great friends Keyton Luquire and Andrew McCorkle (live sound by Penn Cook), and I'll be performing with my band, all the way from Nashville, TN! This is a BYOB event for all ages, so please bring your friends and family, and stop by for a great night of music and fun if you live in the Montgomery area! We'll be playing the new record from start to finish, so you'll get a sneak peak of the music you've all so generously supported.

Here's a special ticket link to the fundraising party (event poster and 10% off new merchandise coupon included upon purchase!): https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/2016276/x/15937714?secret_perk_token=b93c425f 

But wait! There's more! We've just added three brand new merchandise apparel items (my first merch ever!) to the campaign to bring in some last minute donation orders, and to help us cross over that finish line in these last 11 days. We've still got a hefty 49% of the total goal left to raise, so help us out, and treat yo'self to a new vintage dyed hat, a 100% cotton jersey knit t-shirt, and/or a summer-ready backpack cooler bag, available now in two colors each: T-Shirts available in white or heather gray; Hats available in navy or black; Bags available in yellow or red, all (tastefully!) embroidered with Lottie's hip new logo. Get the bundle of all three and save $5! Hurry and snag yo "Lottie" swag!!! And remember, when you purchase this weekend's fundraising event ticket, you will receive a 10% off coupon for 1 piece of merchandise of your choosing, so buy both and save money! I love you all!!! Can't wait to see you this weekend!!!

story:
Introducing Prosper & GPM!

Patrick “Prosper” Laguerre and his wife Melissa Laguerre, founded GPM in 2003. Called not only to entertain, but also to encourage a positive change to the masses, Prosper the leader of GPM, is a talented artist who has sincerely dedicated his gift to change and to affect the world through his music. 

GPM, also known as Gifted Powerful Movement, has the ability to capture the attention of a wide variety of listeners through Prosper’s energetic character, catchy hooks, and skilled band. GPM brings forth a powerful message through the musical influence of Inspirational Urban content and different styles of music like Pop, House, R&B, Rock and Hip-Hop. 

GPM has shared the stage at world class events with some international and award winning performers such as: Wyclef Jean, Kanye West, Kirk Franklin, Akon, Papa San, Canton Jones, New World Son, Mali Music and many more.

In today’s society, mainstream popular music tends to focus on negative messages, steering youth down paths that don’t lead to much success. Over the past 10 years, Prosper and GPM's mandate has been to influence change. Through albums like Takeover and L.I.T.A. (Love Is The Answer), GPM has done exactly that. With every album, show and festival, GPM gains more popularity within the youth who have a positive representation of what it means to be an inspiration within mainstream pop culture.

We Need You!

Every donation counts! Through your contribution, Prosper and GPM will be able to take their music to the next level. Through each donation and purchase of our album, you will be helping to bring inspirational urban music into the forefront of pop music culture.

Though we have set a goal $10,000, if we do not achieve it, we will still use your contribution to fund the promotion of Synergy to various media outlets, while also allotting funds for future GPM albums and touring to a city near you.

Though we appreciate monetary donations, if you can’t donate, still spread the word! Share our campaign across your social media platforms and then follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Listen to our music on SoundCloud!

story:
About Perujazz (That's us)

You've probably never heard of neither Perujazz nor its members. 32 years ago Jean Pierre and I (Manongo) immersed ourselves in a never-ending journey to discover the sounds of this magical country -Peru- the later on we tried to  recreate by using jazz elements. Thus was born Perujazz. Since then, we have been invited to many festivals to share this very and unique music that belongs in a category of its own. We have even played after Sting at the Umbria Festival in Italy, but ironically we never had the chance to perform at the cradle of jazz until now.  

Throughout these years, Perujazz has organically reinvented itself, bringing in new elements and talented musicians to finally achieve what we believe is the "Dream Team".  

We waited patiently nurturing and maturing our music and our souls.  As you might realise we are not in our 20s anymore but we feel more than ready to conquer the world.  A friend of ours contacted some live music venues and in a leap of faith got us three gigs in Chicago, New York and Los Angeles!  And now, we ONLY have to figure out how to get there. 

And that's where you step in.  You will make sure we stay away from either robbing a bank or living in debt for quite a long time. Now it is up to you to support us, at least by sharing our campaign and getting others involved.  These shows in the US not only represent a major milestone for the band's history. Actually they represent the beginning of a new adventure, a new era of Perujazz and you could be part of it.   

Chicago (Oct 5th) - Old Town School.  More info and tickets

New York (Oct 6th) - Subrosa. More info and tickets
Los Angeles (Oct 7th) - East Los Angeles College. More info


The hard stuff (what we need)

Lima, Peru is about 3,700 miles away from Chicago, the first city we will visiting in this trip.  After Chicago comes New York and finally Los Angeles.  We are 5 members in need of the basics: air tickets, accommodation, meals, transportation and visas fees.  In addition, we have to cover promotion expenses if we want people to show up at the concerts and finally someone to film our performance to show the rest of the world that we really made it.  Summing it up, this makes a total of US$ 15,000.

We can help each other (if you like what we do)

But let's get to the exciting stuff!  We really appreciate your interest on our dream and that is why we took the time to think about amazing perks for you. From digital downloads for those who feel touched by our music up to limited edition collectibles and merchandising for those who want to get immersed into Perujazz's world. No matter how small your contribution is, you still get in return an awesome perk from us and the best of all, the opportunity to be part of this milestone in our lives.   So, please make a pledge TODAY, we never know what could happen tomorrow.  

Share, share and share!

Even if we do not reach our entire goal, every dollar we get will still make a difference on how we get to the tour.  We could either arrive in the U.S. by walking, cycling or by plane which at the end of the day could impact our performance on stage.  Eventually, if we do not even make a dollar out of this entire campaign, going viral could have a positive impact on our music.  So, please again SHARE!  If you think there could be another way to collaborate with our campaign, please send us an e-mail to info@perujazz.com and tell us about your idea!

Thank you for making it all possible!
story_txt:
About
Perujazz (That's us)
You've probably never heard of neither Perujazz nor its members. 32 years ago Jean
Pierre and I (Manongo) immersed ourselves in a never-ending journey to discover
the sounds of this magical country -Peru- the later on we tried to  recreate by using jazz
elements. Thus was born Perujazz. Since then, we have
been invited to many festivals to share this very and unique music that belongs in a category of its own. We have
even played after Sting at the Umbria Festival in Italy, but ironically we never
had the chance to perform at the cradle of jazz until now.  
Throughout
these years, Perujazz has organically reinvented itself, bringing in new
elements and talented musicians to finally achieve what we believe is the "Dream Team".  We waited patiently nurturing and maturing our
music and our souls.  As you might realise we are not in our 20s anymore
but we feel more than ready to conquer the world.  A friend of ours
contacted some live music venues and in a leap of faith got us three gigs in
Chicago, New York and Los Angeles!  And now, we ONLY have to figure out how to get there. 
And that's where you step in.  You will make sure we
stay away from either robbing a bank or living in debt for quite a long time. Now it is up to you to support us, at least by sharing our campaign and getting others
involved.  These
shows in the US not only represent a major milestone for the band's history.
Actually they represent the beginning of a new adventure, a new era of
Perujazz and you could be part of it.   Chicago (Oct 5th) - Old Town School.  More info and tickets
New York (Oct 6th) - Subrosa. More info and ticketsLos Angeles (Oct 7th) - East Los Angeles College. More info

The
hard stuff (what we need)
Lima,
Peru is about 3,700 miles away from Chicago, the first city we will visiting in this
trip.  After Chicago comes New York and finally Los Angeles.  We are 5 members in need of the basics: air tickets, accommodation, meals, transportation and visas fees.  In addition, we have
to cover promotion expenses if we want people to show up at the concerts and finally someone to film our performance to show the rest of the world that we
really made it.  Summing it up, this makes a total of US$ 15,000.
We
can help each other (if you like what we do)
But
let's get to the exciting stuff!  We really appreciate your interest on
our dream and that is why we took the time to think about amazing perks for
you. From digital downloads for those who feel touched by our music up to limited edition collectibles and merchandising for those who want to get immersed into Perujazz's world. No matter how small your contribution is, you still get in return an
awesome perk from us and the best of all, the opportunity to be part of
this milestone in our lives.   So, please make a pledge TODAY, we never
know what could happen tomorrow.  
Share, share and share!
Even if we do not reach our entire goal, every dollar
we get will still make a difference on how we get to the tour.  We could either
arrive in the U.S. by walking, cycling or by plane which at the end of the day
could impact our performance on stage.  Eventually, if we do not even make a
dollar out of this entire campaign, going viral could have a positive impact on our
music.  So, please again SHARE!  If you think there could be another way to collaborate with our campaign, please send us an e-mail to info@perujazz.com and tell us about your idea!
Thank you for making it all possible!

story:
2 E-Bücher für Verweigerer des Rundfunkbeitrags

(auch für nur teilweise Verweigerung)

Auf mehreren 100 Seiten A4 (.pdf nach Themen geordnet finden Sie nun endlich ein Waffen-Arsenal und alle Hintergründe und Fakten. Nun können Sie endlich effizient für ihre vollständige oder teilweise Verweigerung streiten.

Erfüllen Sie Ihre Bürgerpflicht gegen Staatsunrecht: Der Rundfunkbeitrag ist Unrecht?

Das Autor (Wirtschaftsfachmann - Volkswirt): "Der Rundfunkbeitrag ist für rund 5 Millionen Haushalte in Deutschland meines Erachtens Unrecht."

"Darunter wohl rund 1 Millionen finanziell knappe alleinerziehende Mütter: Reich an Kind, arm an Geld. Ihnen nimmt man von den rund 50 frei verfügbaren Euros pro Monat ein rundes Drittel - wofür? Hier geht es um das Kindeswohl."

"In Politiker-Sonntagsreden also das übliche Blabla für das Wohl der alleinerziehenden Mütter, und am Montag kommt der Gerichtsvollzieher, geschickt wegen der Gesetze eben dieser Politiker, und vollstreckt ihr über das Bankkonto die Auskunftei kaputt. Das Kind weint, weil es das gestern versprochene kleine Geschenk heute nicht bekommt, und die Mutter weint, weil sie sich wehrlos einer wild gewordenen Juristen-Mannschaft ausgeliefert fühlt. Der Zorn des Buch-Autors über die Kultur heuchelnden profitierenden Millionäre und Multi-Millionäre des Staatsfernsehens zu Lasten des Kindeswohls ist grenzenlos."

Der Autor: "Das Unrecht betrifft auch andere Gruppen. Wer finanziell knapp ist, aber ohne Geld anderer Leute sich unter Opfern durchkämpfen will und kann, wird bestraft. Nur wer sich vom Steuerzahler helfen lässt (will oder muss), wird bereits mit Beitragsfreiheit belohnt. Die gleiche Beitragsfreiheit kann ein anderer 'finanziell Armer' nur erreichen, wer sich nicht mehr 'irgendwie durchboxt', sondern wer Staatshilfe - also das Geld anderer Leute - zum Lebensunterhalt beantragt. Was meinen Sie, ist das eine Unverschämtheit?"

Der Autor: "Außerdem ist der Beitrag meiner Meinung nach zu zwei Dritteln für Verschwendung. Also: 6 Euro pro Monat müssten genügen."

Der Autor: "Dies und so viel anderes beim Rundfunkbeitrag halte ich für unerträgliches Unrecht. Das Gesamtsystem des Rundfunkbeitrags und seiner Eintreibung und überwiegenden Rechtsprechung halte ich nach der Menge der Betroffenen für die größte Eiterbeule in der Geschichte des bundesdeutschen Justiz. Diese Beule gilt es auszubeulen."

Spannende Lektüre... alles, wovon der Beitragsservice Ihnen nichts erzählen würde.

Das edle kulturbeflissene Staatsfernsehen?

Der Autor hält es für Heuchelei. In Wahrheit sei es verdeckte zwangsfinanzierte faktische Privatwirtschaft mit der Schaffung von Millionären und Multi-Millionären - die Intendanten und Komödianten. 

Eine neue Währung: "1 BKG" = "1 Bundeskanzlerin-Gehalt". Die Chefs der Sender, die Intendanten, erhalten rund 1 BKG. Die Komödianten aller Art erhalten teils ein mehrfaches BKG. - Was für eine Verantwortung trägt eine Bundeskanzlerin? Was für eine Verantwortung tragen Fernseh-Moderatoren?

1 Intendant verdient so viel wie man rund 1000 oder mehr alleinerziehenden finanzknappen Müttern vom monatlichen Geldrest für das Kindeswohl fort nimmt. Dies alles mit der Hilfe von Juristen, von Vertretern von Recht und Gerechtigkeit. Eine Schande, meint der Autor.

Wehrt euch gegen den Rundfunkbeitrag.

Diese Bücher sind eure Waffenkiste.

Alle wichtigen rechtlichen Gesichtspunkte sind in verständlicher Sprache und ohne Juristen-Latein für Sie aufbereitet worden. Endlich können Sie klar erkennen, wie Sie Ihre Rechte wahrnehmen können.

Der Autor ist bemüht, alle Heucheleien und verheimlichten Wahrheiten aufzudecken. Machen Sie sich auf eine Ansammlung von Unvorstellbarkeiten gefasst. Sobald Sie die aufgedeckten Hintergründe des "Staatsfernsehens" glasklar begreifen, werden Sie Ihren Staat mit anderen Augen sehen.

Klar kommt mit der eigenen Abwehr dank der vielen Arbeitshilfen sodann, wer es beruflich gewohnt ist, Vorgänge zu bearbeiten, Briefe abzufassen und zu verhandeln.

Alle, die diese Fertigkeiten sich nicht zutrauen, sollen Möglichkeiten geboten erhalten, dennoch von dem Vorgehen der anderen zu profitieren. Die Lektüre der Unvorstellbarkeiten ist sowieso für alle. Ein spannender Krimi über Ihren real existierenden Staat und lustige Realsatire - alles kommt vor. 

Was geschieht mit Ihrem Geld? Viel viel Arbeit.

(1) Autorenarbeit:

Die beiden E-Bücher (.pdf) sollen mit Themenübersichten und Suchhilfen ausgestattet werden. Der Leser soll dann umgehend zu denjenigen Textabschnitten finden, die ihn am meisten interessieren. 

(2) Arbeitshilfen für Selbstanwender sind weitergehend zu optimieren.

Die Rechtsfragen sind komplex. Schon jetzt sind Beispieltexte zu vielen Fragen eingefügt. Dies soll ausgeweitet werden.

(Irgendwann später kommt dann vielleicht mit einer weiteren Finanzierungsrunde ein software-basierter intelligenter Roboter-Autor, der jedem Bürger nach Klick-Anweisung seinen individuellen Widerspruch textet.)

(3) Verfassungsbeschwerde beim Landesverfassungsgericht Berlin

(es handelt sich ja vorwiegend um Landesrecht). Die Auswirkung ist aber bundesweit, weil die Staatsverträge der Bundesländer bei Erfolg anzupassen wären.

Ihre wichtigste Hilfe: Bitte verbreiten!

Insbesondere Facebook und Foren für Verweigerer.

Links dieser Kampagne:  ...
Verschiedene Links: uno7.org/pev-amenu-de.htm
Google-Suche:    uno7 flamingo

story:
Who I am and Why I'm Here

My name's Leslie McKee and I'm an independent Christian music artist, worship leader, musician, and roster artist with Creative Soul Records.  I'm super excited to let you know that I've been working on my first full-length recording project!  It's actually been in the works for some time now, but like I said, life comes at us and it has come at me full on for the past few years.  There have been many times I've felt like giving up, but I've come out on the other side alive and full of hope, and in turn, want to encourage others to hold on.  I've pretty much lived out 2 Corinthians 4: 8-10: We are pressed on every side by troubles, but we are not crushed.  We are perplexed, but not driven to despair.  We are hunted down, but never abandoned by God.  We get knocked down, but we are not destroyed.  Through suffering, our bodies continue to share in the death of Jesus so that the life of Jesus may also be seen in our bodies. 

​I've teamed up with Eric Copeland of Creative Soul Records to create the best product possible for you.  He has a heart for giving voice to  independent artists, helps us to reach our creative goals and equips us to do the work God has created us to do.  For this project, he has put together a team of the best players in Nashville.  We have put together an incredible track list  of songs, including songs that I have co-written, songs from other writer-friends, and songs that were acquired through Word Records.  In addition to the amazing players and producers I've worked with on this project, I've also had the opportunity to work with incredible vocal producers.  I want to tell you so much more about all these people that were involved and the process of getting to this point, but I'm going to save that for an update that will follow soon.  The album is going to be amazing and will show quite a different side of me than what was heard on my debut EP, True to You.  

I've been overwhelmed by the support and encouragement of family, friends, and fans since stepping out in ministry, and I would like to invite you to partner with me on getting these songs of hope out to the world.  Together, we can make a difference!

So...how can you be involved?

That's a great question and I have a couple answers for you.  One way to help is to offer prayer support.  Prayer is such a vital part in all aspects of this kind of undertaking: from choosing and writing songs, to petitioning for the means to complete it, and to getting the finished product into the hands of people who need to hear the message of the songs.  

Another way to help is to contribute financially to the project.  The overall cost of the album will be around $25,000.  I've set a goal of $5000 to help see us through the end of production.  We've been able to track the songs with the band and I've recently been able to cut vocals and do a photo shoot.  Now we're in the home stretch!  The songs need to be mixed and mastered, album artwork needs to be done, and lastly,  the CDs will be sent off for duplication.  

Perhaps you're not able to contribute but you'd still like to show your support. Social media is a great way to get news out quickly to a lot of people.  Please consider sharing this with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  

What's in it for you?

We are putting together some great perks for you as a way to say thank you for your support. You'll be the first to hear of updates as they're available.  Plus, you'll experience joy in knowing your contribution will help in sharing music that will influence and make a difference in the lives of others.    

What happens to any additional funds that are raised? 

We had some songs that didn't make the cut on this CD, so there is talk of doing an EP to follow-up within a year of this album release.  Funds could go toward production on the EP, production on video for some of the songs, promotion and marketing of the new songs, and/or toward touring expenses for sharing the new songs.  

Risks & Challenges

It is not easy for me to ask for financial support and doing so creates a sense of vulnerability.  It's easy to feel that there are so many other worthy causes out there for people to contribute to, why would they choose to help me meet my goal?  

I'm launching this campaign as we enter into the Thanksgiving and Christmas seasons which may cause decreased visibility of the campaign.  

My response to both concerns is prayer and trusting that God hasn't brought me this far to abandon me, but rather plans to do great things through the message of the songs. 

Closing thoughts

Thank you so much for stopping by my page and for supporting this project in whatever way you have chosen.  Please feel free to visit my website for more information about what I do, to read my blog posts, or to listen to songs from my EP.  I'd also love to have you join me on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.   

~ Leslie

** Thank you to Bryce Mentzer for putting together my video and putting up with my awkwardness on camera!

story:
My name is Kristi Hoopes and my heart beats for country music.

I'm a proud Colorado native who recently planted her Rocky Mountain roots in Nashville, Tennessee to chase a singer-songwriter's dream and study Music Business at Middle Tennessee State University. (Go True Blue!)

From the moment I hopped up onto our living room coffee table at the age of 2 and started belting my lungs out, everyone in the family knew I was destined to be on stage. After singing Loretta Lynn's version of "These Boots Are Made For Walking" in my 3rd grade talent show, I was sold.  

My entire childhood was spent riding from town to town singing anywhere that I could, performing in local community plays, or writing original songs.

In the past 10 years, I have been blessed beyond measure. From recording at RCA Studio A to performing before 13 million people as a member of Team Blake on Season 13 of NBC's The Voice, this musical journey has been more than I could have ever imagined.

And it's all thanks to you. 

Whether you have been with me since the beginning or just recently joined the KHKountry family, you have given me the courage to follow my heart and make the music I believe in. 

So what is my heart telling me right now?

The 70's Are Coming Back, Baby! 

Honest, authentic songwriting. Steel guitars. Bell bottoms. A little less beer and truck.  Don't you wish country radio had more of that right about now? I know I do!

The rhinestone-studded country sounds of the 70s that inspired me as a little girl have all but vanished from the airwaves in 2018, but I think it's time they came back. Fortunately, I've teamed up with some incredible folks, like the EP's producers Biff Watson (Crystal Gayle, Don Williams) and Paul Worley (Lady Antebellum, Dixie Chicks), who think the same thing and are ready to make the old new again.    

For the Record

It might not come as a surprise when I tell you that recording costs are pretty darn expensive...especially when you're on a ramen noodle budget. But if we're going to make this EP together, we're gonna make it right!

The funds raised will cover the following: 

  • Hiring the best session musicians, engineers, and studio wizards to make this 6 song EP sound like it came straight out of the glory days.
  • Studio time at Sound Emporium Studio B. 
  • Physical EP design, production and distribution.
  • Exclusive Kristi Hoopes merchandise packages featuring work from local artists Chris Hall, Kaylie Stremler, and Joseph Wasileski.
  • Behind the scenes footage of the EP in the making shot by videographers John "Moose" Miller and Joseph Wasileski. 

So what's in it for you?

I'm offering everything from autographed copies of the EP to handwritten song lyrics to (drum roll please)  a chance for you and a friend to be my guests at the official EP listening party in Nashville!

You are the best part of what I do and I can't wait to make some beautiful country music together. 

Let's get groovy, y'all! 

XO,

Kristi 

 

**************************************************************************************

DISCLAIMER - Any contribution made to Kristi Hoopes (KJH Enterprises LLC) for this project does not entitle you to any ownership of KJH Enterprises LLC or any intellectual property included on the EP, nor does it entitle you to any revenues generated by the sale and exploitation of such EP.
story_txt:
My name is Kristi Hoopes and my heart beats for country music.
I'm a proud Colorado native who recently planted her Rocky Mountain roots in Nashville, Tennessee to chase a singer-songwriter's dream and study Music Business at Middle Tennessee State University. (Go True Blue!)

From the moment I hopped up onto our living room coffee table at the age of 2 and started belting my lungs out, everyone in the family knew I was destined to be on stage. After singing Loretta Lynn's version of "These Boots Are Made For Walking" in my 3rd grade talent show, I was sold.  
My entire childhood was spent riding from town to town singing anywhere that I could, performing in local community plays, or writing original songs.

In the past 10 years, I have been blessed beyond measure. From recording at RCA Studio A to performing before 13 million people as a member of Team Blake on Season 13 of NBC's The Voice, this musical journey has been more than I could have ever imagined.
And it's all thanks to you. 
Whether you have been with me since the beginning or just recently joined the KHKountry family, you have given me the courage to follow my heart and make the music I believe in. 
So what is my heart telling me right now?
The 70's Are Coming Back, Baby! 


Honest, authentic songwriting. Steel guitars. Bell bottoms. A little less beer and truck.  Don't you wish country radio had more of that right about now? I know I do!
The rhinestone-studded country sounds of the 70s that inspired me as a little girl have all but vanished from the airwaves in 2018, but I think it's time they came back. Fortunately, I've teamed up with some incredible folks, like the EP's producers Biff Watson (Crystal Gayle, Don Williams) and Paul Worley (Lady Antebellum, Dixie Chicks), who think the same thing and are ready to make the old new again.    

For the Record
It might not come as a surprise when I tell you that recording costs are pretty darn expensive...especially when you're on a ramen noodle budget. But if we're going to make this EP together, we're gonna make it right!
The funds raised will cover the following: 

Hiring the best session musicians, engineers, and studio wizards to make this 6 song EP sound like it came straight out of the glory days.
Studio time at Sound Emporium Studio B. 
Physical EP design, production and distribution.
Exclusive Kristi Hoopes merchandise packages featuring work from local artists Chris Hall, Kaylie Stremler, and Joseph Wasileski.
Behind the scenes footage of the EP in the making shot by videographers John "Moose" Miller and Joseph Wasileski. 

So what's in it for you?

I'm offering everything from autographed copies of the EP to handwritten song lyrics to (drum roll please)  a chance for you and a friend to be my guests at the official EP listening party in Nashville!
You are the best part of what I do and I can't wait to make some beautiful country music together. 
Let's get groovy, y'all! 
XO,
Kristi  **************************************************************************************DISCLAIMER - Any contribution made to Kristi Hoopes (KJH Enterprises LLC) for this project does not entitle you to any ownership of KJH Enterprises LLC or any intellectual property included on the EP, nor does it entitle you to any revenues generated by the sale and exploitation of such EP.

story:
AMERICANA!

Pegasus: The Orchestra is dedicated to bringing "symphony hall" sounds to intimate venues, making full-bodied orchestral arrangements accessible to everyone. On April 12, 2018, we will present three American masterpieces that everyone loves and recognizes: Copland's Appalachian Spring, Barber's incredibly moving and poignant Adagio for Strings, and the premiere of Karen Hakobyan's arrangement of Gershwin's Rhapsody in Blue. At its largest, our ensemble will be eighteen-strong.

FLEET FOR FLIGHT

The good news:  We are compact.  In our largest configuration, Pegasus: The Orchestra stands at 35 members.  We are flexible.  We can perform works as duos, trios, septets, octets, string orchestras, winds, all the way up to full orchestra.  We do NOT require a huge venue.  This keeps costs low.  We have top-notch principal players whom we feature in our chamber series, fulfilling our mission to give rising musicians a platform for artistic expression and plenty of opportunities to perform.  We have a composer-arranger as our founder, artistic director, and principal conductor:  Karen Hakobyan is the resident musician who can take a piece by George Gershwin and create the special arrangement for a Pegasus ensemble to take on the road and share with American cities and American citizens in them in venues where orchestral music of this caliber and on this level is rarely heard.  

Yes.

We want to take AMERICANA! on the road.  Jersey City is its birthplace, and we need your help to launch it on April 12th.  The first $12,000 of our budget will accomplish April. It will pay for licensing, score rentals, honoraria for the orchestra, promotion, and staffing.  But here is our vision:  we have created this program specifically with bringing it to more and more people as our goal.

Mana Contemporary is also in Chicago and Miami.  We have hopes to expand the Music Residency to those two cities.  It is a plan right now, not yet a reality, because even though the buildings are there, and we may soon have pianos in those buildings, there is the logistical reality of transporting an orchestra still to cope with.  

That's where you come in.

We've also heard from a presenter with a venue in Philadelphia.  He's ready and willing to collaborate with Pegasus.  Boston.  California.  Connecticut.  New York. Southhampton.  The potential exists for us to have an extensive road trip, bringing world-class performances in a scaled-down orchestra to small venues at a reduced cost in each of these states and cities.

For that, we need the other $36,000* just to get a leg up.  It won't cover all our costs, but our partners in these other cities will be meeting us halfway in many cases.  Some are presenters who can provide the venue, or accommodation, or both, but may not be able to pay the orchestra, or the transportation.  Each situation is different, but each and every partnership has a similar goal and objective:  we want to bring affordable and accessible world class performances to people, neighborhoods, and venues where they don't currently exist.

The first $5K we see donated after our April 12th budget is met and spent will be allocated to hiring a project-based grant-writer. Your donations will fuel our long-term prospects for thriving as well as this short-term project.

_____________________________________________

*Just a footnote, for a little perspective.  A concert that was recently planned for Carnegie Hall had a budget of $50K for publicity.  That's right.  One concert, one evening, $50K just for the publicity budget, which did not, incidentally, include television; just print, online, radio, and email.  We're looking for $50K to help us fund a TOUR.  Multiple performances in multiple cities.

MUSIC EDUCATION & AMERICANA!​

There is something else, VERY important, that we want to do in the course of our AMERICANA! rollout, and in ALL our endeavors as Pegasus expands its projects and horizons:  we want to be able to invite buses full of schoolchildren in each and every city we visit or occupy (in the case of our residencies) and their teachers and families to visit us in our musical home.  We want them to see us at work, and not only for formal performances, but we'd like to have schoolchildren come to working rehearsals to see how an orchestra puts a concert together, how a conductor works from a score, how each member of the orchestra is integral to the whole.  We would like to make this a formal lecture-rehearsal-performance series, designed to inspire, inform, and enlarge the hearts and minds of young people in our communities.

It isn't part of this project or fundraiser today, but we want to share with you our larger vision, just so you know that we have no plans to go anywhere anytime soon:  As Pegasus grows and gains its footing here in Jersey City and perhaps in Chicago and Miami, we hope very much to get started on much more extensive youth programming than what we just described.  We have a dream.  We would like to have a fully functional professional youth orchestra some day.  Help us now with our short-term goal, and you will be helping us on our way toward this long-horizon goal, too.  The more we do now, the more momentum we build, the more visibility we have, the more people know about us, the sooner that can happen.

 

SUPPORTING EMERGING COMPOSERS WITH AMERICANA PART II!

For AMERICANA PART II we are right here, right now announcing a call for works by living American composers.  The composer who wins will have their music premiered in the Fall program, which will include music by Bernstein.  

 

LOOKING FOR MORE?  WHO WE ARE.

We are Pegasus: The Orchestra, a New York-based professional orchestra  currently in residence at Mana Contemporary, with an Orchestra Series, a Chamber Series, a Piano Series, and plans for World Music, Jazz, and Music Education on the boards.*

We have ambitious plans because we believe passionately that

  • rising musicians must be empowered with artistic freedom and ample opportunity to perform;
  • artists should have an environment that fosters creative thought and expression to promote innovative repertoire and showcase world premieres;
  • music can weave a strong community fabric when we bring musicians and audiences having diverse cultural backgrounds together;
  • youth need and deserve music education, and that music education is integral to human education;
  • music has the power to promote humanity and equality.

Ambitious plans, yes, and ambitious budgets.  But not backbreaking budgets.  Not the kind of budgets that call for $50-and-up-ticket prices.  In fact, it is also our deeply felt hope to make as many of our performances free or close-to-free as possible, so that anyone who wants to hear highest level performances of superb music may do so.  That is why we are asking for your help.  We cannot do this without your support, and we know you are with us.  Musicians need to perform, communities need world-class music, and kids need music education.

We are deeply honored and grateful to Mana Contemporary for granting us this Residency.  It is offering us the possibility to realize our vision, and our vision is big, and it is a little different.  

We are not different for the sake of being different.  Quite the contrary.  Each of us is a quintessentially professional musician, has studied in conservatory, and has performance credits, often internationally.  We perform at the very highest level.  We dress professionally.  Our venue is professionally equipped.  There is not one iota of “funk” in what we present.

What we do suggest, however, is that our audience need not feel it must also be professional.  We want our doors to be open to everyone in the communities we play in, whatever their means, whatever their backgrounds.  We want people to feel comfortable at our events.  It sounds simple and easy, but it definitely is not.  It will take time to build relationships with our neighbors, to build trust and rapport.  To build trust with you, our donors.  We are asking you to give us a chance to begin that process.  Just a head-start.

We are not sold on the “outreach” model, where concerts are brought in as some kind of charitable event.  As we proposed above, we want to weave a community fabric with music as the catalyst; a human fabric where music brings human beings together who might otherwise never meet, never be in the same space together, and makes it possible for them to relate to each other in new and powerful ways.  We want to do this often, on an ongoing basis. 

And when we take our programs on the road, we want to create the same atmosphere of communion with local neighborhoods, whether we are performing in a Mana Contemporary residency in Chicago or Miami, or in a venue where we’ve been invited in some other city or state.  We don’t just want to reach out (there? that’s already better than outreach, isn’t it?), but we want everyone to feel they can reach in––to us.  Our doors are open and our music is available to any and all who want to hear it, and in intimate, comfortable, affordable surroundings.

A friend in our circle once said, “We artists, we really believe that we can save the world.”  Well, maybe not quite, but close; something like that!  One of Margaret Mead’s most compelling quotes was: “Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.”

We don’t doubt it.

We have been in existence since just October 2017, and in this short time, have already had three sold-out performances, launched a piano series, a chamber series, and an orchestra series.  Our performances have garnered positive media attention.  We are excited, our supporters are excited, and our vision of where we want to go is becoming clear.  It is also very clear that we need financial support.  But not as much as you might think.

_____________________________________________

*  We are not yet a non-profit, although our application for 501(c)(3) status with the Internal Revenue Service is in its final stages and may be approved very soon.  If it is approved in the current fiscal year, a substantial portion of your donation may qualify as tax-deductible, and you will receive a letter from us that that effect.

Risks & Challenges

If we miss the boat, and don't raise $48,000 in this campaign, the consequences will be long-lasting.  Assuming we raise only enough to get us through April 12th, that means that our plans to bring AMERICANA! to cities like Chicago and Miami are not going to be realized.  Will Philadelphia, New York, or Connecticut be possible?  Only if the hosts can get grants to fund the entire concert, and that's a long shot.  These are collaborative opportunities.  And if we don't get a tour for AMERICANA! we are losing performance opportunities for our orchestra members, and failing to deliver on two core elements of our mission.  We don't want to go there.

And AMERICANA PART II will surely be in doubt.

We are going to promote this campaign vigorously, through every channel we can imagine.  Every member of Pegasus: The Orchestra will be asked to share it in their social media channels, and our staff are all doing the same.

You

We understand that not every person who has taken the time to read this campaign can contribute money.  Money is not the only thing of value in an effort like this.  We value your time, your thoughts, your perspectives, and your network of friends.  Please, let us know what you think about what we are doing.  Write to us. 

Share the campaign, would you?  Post it, email it, talk about it.  

There are share tools right here, easy to use.  Believe us, it makes a huge difference.

Thank you.

story:
Who I am

My name is Emile Janse and I have been playing music for healing for around 5 years now. I am 25 now and when I was almost 18, a good friend of mine introduced me to the Native American Flute. At that point my relationship to music became deeply entwined with my desire to experience blissful states of peace and tranquility. I played many kinds of indigenous and cultural flutes from around the world and in my early twenties I picked up the didgeridoo and began practicing Tuvan Throatsinging. After many years of self-teaching I have reached a proficiency that I share as a gift to groups of people.

This campaign is important to me because I want to put high quality sounds out that come from what I do and what I'm very good at bringing to the world. I have done many spontaneous youtube videos and facebook livestreams, but I've never sat down and really worked with the sound or had it produced such that someone or myself would want to listen to it over and over again. Creating and producing quality music is a real project, and I think it is worth it so people can experience what I do.

Contributors will help me achieve the creation of quality musical recordings particularly with the flute, handpan, didgeridoo, and overtone throatsinging. All of these instruments and musical practices I do very proficiently and have played for thousands of people around the bay area and California. to support me makes the gift of these sounds available to even more people, and also helps me unlock more ability to travel and play around the world because I can send people good demonstrations of what I do so they know it is a good idea to bring me over.

What I need

I am asking for $1,000 to pay 1 or 2 engineers (one being Nick Hart) and Outland Recording Studio who are willing to help me produce this in their free time, because it an interesting and different project. They are being so generous and I want to support them as much as possible for helping me record and produce this healing music. Anything over $1,000 will go to them as well.

For people that help fund this project I am offering private sound healing sessions with the didgeridoo, flute, frame drum, handpan, and voice. Or, private music lessons on the didgeridoo, flute, or throatsinging.

Anyone that contributes will also receive a link to download the music when it comes out.

Spread the word, grateful to anyone and everyone that is willing to share this campaign as well :)

story:
Short Summary

  • Dirty Uncle Rose is hitting its stride as a band and we are ready to bring you an album. We have the songs ready to go, the musicians ready to play, and the studio ready to record! We just need your help to make our recording dreams a reality. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to pay for studio time, an engineer and mastering. We have priced it all out and it comes to the total we are campaigning for. 
  • Not only will you get a digital copy for download of the album when you give $15 or more, but you'll get a Dirty Uncle Rose sticker to display your love for the band. At the $100 level, you'll get a Dirty Uncle Rose poster. At the $500 level, Rose will play an acoustic solo show for your private house concert if you live in the Portland, OR area. At the $1,000 level, Dirty Uncle Rose will play a house show, party, or event for you if you live in the Portland, OR area. 
  • If you don't dig on digital, you can request an old school cassette tape, made by DUR guitarist Gabe Averre, complete with original artwork. Just send us a note with your order!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still put what we raise toward an album and begin the recording process. We will then chip away at it with our own funds until it is complete and still get you an album in the end.

The Impact

By chipping in today, not only will you get a great album, but you will help a great band get its music out in to the world! 

Risks & Challenges

There are very few, barring acts of god and nature. :  ) We have the studio time booked and are all ready to record!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't give, please share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family!
  • Follow us on Facebook
  • Come to our shows in Portland!

Not only will you get a digital copy for download of the album when you give $15 or more, but you'll get a Dirty Uncle Rose sticker to display your love for the band. At the $100 level, you'll get a Dirty Uncle Rose poster. At the $500 level, Rose will play an acoustic solo show for your private house concert if you live in the Portland, OR area. At the $1,000 level, Dirty Uncle Rose will play a house show, party, or event for you if you live in the Portland, OR area. 
If you don't dig on digital, you can request an old school cassette tape, made by DUR guitarist Gabe Averre, complete with original artwork. Just send us a note with your order!
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still put what we raise toward an album and begin the recording process. We will then chip away at it with our own funds until it is complete and still get you an album in the end.


The Impact
By chipping in today, not only will you get a great album, but you will help a great band get its music out in to the world! 

Risks & Challenges
There are very few, barring acts of god and nature. :  ) We have the studio time booked and are all ready to record!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give, please share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family!
Follow us on Facebook
Come to our shows in Portland!

story:
My Journey from the back-forty to Music City USA:

On August 5th, 2012, I moved from my hometown of Latham, IL to Music City U.S.A. to chase my dream of being “Eric Burgett,” the country artist. My first step was to hunker down and learn to be the best songwriter I could be, so I bundled up my cornfield roots with my 2 hands on 88 keys, and I hit the ground running. While writing every day and being present in the Nashville community, I knew that maintaining a solid performance schedule was crucial, so I traveled back and forth between Tennessee and my Illinois territory playing county fairs, bars, college shows, and festivals.

After a few months of living in Nashville, I met Grammy-nominated producer Matt Mcclure and we immediately struck up a friendship amongst the numerous cold beer conversations and talks about songs I had been writing. In September 2017, I signed an artist management and production deal with Matt and his company “Bow to Stern Group” after having released my current single, “Town You Never Heard Of.” It has been a fun ride so far, and I am thrilled to follow up the single with my debut record that will consist of 10 very special songs I have poured my heart and soul into...but I need YOUR help!!!!

So what’s happening now?

I am recording my debut record! I know deep down that it’s the right moment to release these tunes to the world and keep them from collecting any more dust! When the songs are ready to rock, sometimes it’s hard to roll, due to financial constraints. “INDIEGOGO” is a crowdfunding site that has been responsible for aiding in the careers of creators like me, who have a passion for music. “INDIEGOGO” allows artists to fund their projects and minimize debt (hopefully all of it!), and in return, anyone who pledges will be rewarded based on his or her “tier of giving” (see the rewards to the right of the page). Most importantly, we are all in this TOGETHER, and YOU will be a cohesive part of the project. Following the release of my project, the music will live on forever, so your generous gift will keep on giving and will spark more momentum, as time goes on.

My dad has always said, “Surround yourself with good people,” and that’s exactly what I’ve done, ever since moving to Nashville. From friends and co-writers to my management team and my amazing wife (as of recent!!), Aimee (and our dog Nora :)), I believe I have a strong and supportive circle of people around me to really power this thing, upon a (fingers crossed!) successful Indiegogo campaign. 

The Music

If you know me, you know my heart is full of back-forty skylines, sunsets, cornfield kisses, John Deere implements, hole-in-the-wall bars...it goes on and on and on...These songs are just the beginning of something bigger. I have written countless numbers of songs that I believe are ready to ROCK!

How does it work?

Through the Indiegogo platform, my goal is to raise $75,000 in 42 days to fund production, promotion, marketing, and branding of my debut 10-song record with my producer, Matt McClure. Everything will take place in Nashville, TN with the best people in the business (musicians, photographers, promoters, etc.) for the best fans in the world, YOU!!!  Upon finishing the record, it will be pressed and also available for download and streaming.  I know that $75,000 ain’t a small number, but with YOUR help, I have faith we can do it. From merchandise packages, truck bed concerts, and more, I can promise you a memorable reward in return for your generosity. 

My team and I have strategically planned our budgeting, based on recording, promoting, and delivering the final product with the money we raise.

Risks and Challenges

As with any fundraising project, there are risks and challenges. The amount of funding we raise will determine if the project will happen in a timely fashion. Our plan is to start recording in the Fall and have the project ready at the beginning of the year 2019. If we don't reach our goal of $75,000, the project will take longer to finish. Thankfully, the funds we DO raise will go towards the project and push it forward. When I release the project, no doubt it will have have a significant impact on my music career and will open more doors for me as an artist, which means I will be forever grateful for your support.

Throughout the recording process, you as a “backer” will receive ample updates on how the project is moving along. Most importantly, you as a “backer” will receive music BEFORE anyone else does, because, without YOU, none of this would be possible. As for the rewards, I will have a team behind me that will help me successfully get them to you in a timely fashion, following the close of the campaign!

I truly appreciate your consideration in donating to my project. I have poured my heart and soul into these tunes, and I hope they will mean as much to you as they do to me.

Sincerely,

Eric Burgett

story:
Hello Everyone!

 

My band and I have been invited to play SXSW Festival in Austin, Texas from the 11th-17th March 2019. This is the most exciting opportunity we've been given for shows, industry parties, meetings and the chance to bring our music to a new audience of fans and industry. 

 

We need YOUR help as - though we some of the funding covered, we still have a fair bit to go to make the trip happen! £500 will cover our Visa's, as well as actually getting our instruments over there! So any contributions will be a massive help and will be rewarded with our perks that you can find to the right, by way of our thanks.

 

I am incredibly grateful to everyone who has helped get us to this stage, and to anyone who can contribute to getting us over there to deliver our jazzy, freaky sounds to the good people of Austin, Texas, I will be forever grateful. If you can't give anything but still want to help, creating any noise about our campaign using the share buttons, would be massively appreciated!

 

Thank you so much, much love, and God bless America!

xx

story:
So why are we doing this?

1) Because...over the years, music has saved us. More than once. We aim to create wildly authentic music and tell honest stories that we can share with a world in desperate need of inspiration. 

2) Because...we want to create community around the notion that beauty will save the world. We say that a lot. It’s a constant reminder to us to keep going because when someone is inspired, they change the world. There are so many stories we could tell about conversations had in the grocery, at the bank, running into someone, MAYBE YOU, at the park or in an email or card we’ve gotten, talking about the ways the music we’ve written and shared has affected you, moved you, given you space to wrestle with things or simply reminded you that you’re not alone. This is the spark. Those conversations and encounters are the fuel to make more music - you inspire us, music is born, you get inspired, you do something inspiring. The circle widens. Ever expanding.

3) Because...our band has several members. Members with jobs, kids, bills, they have never ending to do lists and full calendars. It’s extremely important to us as we all pour ourselves into this project, we ensure not only that we can share it with the world, BUT we want to take care of the community we’ve been building as we go.

So why are YOU doing this?

Your contributions will help us with costs like:

Audio mixing/audio mastering (currently in progress)

Song copywriting

Design (album art, t-shirt design, merch designs)

Printing CDs & Vinyl (album covers, discs)

Filming videos

Creating merchandise (t-shirts, mugs, hats, art etc.)

Digital/physical marketing

Promotion (press/publicist costs)

Tour related costs

(We've got some great thank you gifts to give away to YOU as well! Check out all the different levels of contribution and perks on the right side of the page.)

A little more

This album is called Closets & Parkinglots because much of started out being written in stolen moments. Moments when we could get a little break from the chaos of daily life to write a new melody or work out lyrics. Often that would be hiding out in a broom closet at work with a guitar or taking a lunch break in our cars to work through a song arrangement. What can we say? We’re music people, completely obsessed. But now we find ourselves in a new place, able to throw all we have into the music we feel called to create. We have to create. To tell the most authentic, honest stories we can because 

We’ve been on a journey for a while, and this is the next big step. We’ve had so much love and support over the years as we’ve gone, we hope you will consider stepping into this larger circle WITH us.

Beauty will save the world - and it takes a community to empower that beauty into existence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends and family about this project! You can use the Indiegogo ‘share’ tools above to spread the word on social media.

Listen to Cedars on iTunes & Spotify.

Remind us to KEEP GOING. This stuff isn't easy. :)

Thank you so much for your support & encouragement.

story:
SAXON MOON’S NEWEST CD, AWAKENING: Help us get it across the finish line.

Saxon Moon is back in the studio, putting the finishing touches on their latest CD,  AWAKENING, which promises to be their most amazing musical production yet.

We chose the title, AWAKENING, because Saxon Moon has gone thru some pretty significant transitions this past year, and we feel we are breathing new life into the band, starting with this CD. For AWAKENING, we chose more traditional Celtic, Irish, Nordic, and Medieval songs for you. And you are going to hear a lot of whistle and powerful drums with our own Saxon Moon twist.

In the past, we’ve always been able to finance our albums on our own, but 2017 presented many unexpected challenges for Saxon Moon, making it impossible to complete the CD on our own this time. In addition to the costs involved in this final stage of recording a CD, like CD artwork; getting the CD pressed; and production costs (production, sound engineering, mixing, mastering, etc.), we have equipment that needs improvements and repairs for live performances; musicians to pay; and merchandise that has to be ordered.

AWAKENING has been in the works for well over a year, and is finally ready for our fans. We believe it will be our best CD yet, and we are pretty sure you will agree with us on that! As independent musicians, the biggest challenge in putting out a new CD is funding. That’s where you come in. We need $8,000 to finish the CD and cover all the expenses we previously explained or we won’t be able to bring you awesome new music this year.  

So we are turning to our strongest supporters, our fans, to ask for contributions. We just can’t finish this CD without you. And supporting our campaign is your way of supporting independent music and musicians.

In exchange, Saxon Moon has put together some fun and exciting rewards for all of you to enjoy - Mega Merchandise Package; VIP Experience Package; Musical instruments from the band’s personal collection that were played live and on previous CD’s; VIP House Concert; and best of all, the “Executive Producer”! The guys donated a lot of their personal gear so there's A LOT of reward options. Please be sure to read them all!

We have only 30 days to pull this together and make it a reality. So please, help us finish this amazing music CD, and be a part of making it happen. We know Awakenings will become a reality with the support of our fans!

*** Please message me for shipping rates outside of the USA. ***

And thank you in advance for sharing this campaign with your friends and networks. That is really the only way we will be able to do this!

Even if you can’t contribute financially, please show your support and share our campaign with each of your social networks!

Email!

Facebook!

Twitter!

Blogs!

Youtube!

Music forums!

Thanks a million and let’s have some fun with this!!!

story:
Le Centre et Marius Barbeau

Le Centre d’interprétation de la culture traditionnelle Marius-Barbeau est un Organisme à But Non Lucratif au service du patrimoine vivant.

Notre mandat est de sauvegarder le patrimoine immatériel et d’encourager la reconnaissance, la conservation, la diffusion et la transmission des arts et traditions populaires québécois et canadiens, incluant ceux des Premières Nations. Le centre s’est également donné pour mission de promouvoir la belle diversité culturelle de la ville de Montréal.

Fondé en 1977, le Centre a choisi de prendre le nom de l’anthropologue et folkloriste Marius Barbeau, afin de souligner le travail exceptionnel de ce pionnier, dans la sauvegarde, la collecte et la valorisation de notre patrimoine vivant.

 

Pour notre quarantième anniversaire, nous voulons dédier une exposition à ce personnage, qui nous a tant inspiré. Explorer le travail de Marius Barbeau, c’est renouer avec le passé, c’est approfondir notre connaissance de la société canadienne dans toute sa pluralité, mais c’est aussi se questionner sur ce qui définit notre identité aujourd’hui !

Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour concrétiser ce beau projet. Vos dons nous permettront d’organiser le grand voyage au cœur des traditions du Canada, pour le plaisir des petits et des grands !

Nos besoins et vos récompenses

Pour que notre exposition devienne réalité et que nous puissions la faire voyager aux quatre coins du Québec, nous avons besoin de rassembler près de 20.000 dollars. Par vos dons, cher public, nous espérons collecter 4.000$. Pour le reste, nous investissons beaucoup de nos efforts dans des demandes de financement auprès des entreprises québécoises et des pouvoirs gouvernementaux.

Vos 4.000$ seront utilisés pour combler les besoins techniques liés à la réalisation de l’exposition, tels que la rédaction des textes de l’exposition, les frais de reproduction d’images ou de prêt d’œuvres, l’impression d’outils de médiation pour les adultes et de jeux éducatifs pour les enfants, la création de visites guidées pour les écoles, ou encore, les coûts de transport, de montage et de démontage de l’exposition.

Vous ne le regretterez pas ! En soutenant le CMB vous courez aussi la chance de gagner de beaux cadeaux pour le temps des fêtes. Pour chaque don, vous serez récompensés : reproductions des collections du CMB sur cartes postales, tasses imprimées aux motifs du fléché, cours d’initiation au fléché gratuits, entre autres… Les plus chanceux pourraient même repartir avec une toile originale représentant un mariage traditionnel québécois !

Il n’y a pas de petit don ! Chaque geste compte. Le Centre Marius Barbeau a besoin de vous et nous vous en serons éternellement reconnaissants.

L’impact de nos projets

Depuis 2012, le CMB se consacre à la conception, la réalisation et la mise en marché d’expositions itinérantes en lien avec ses collections. Nous proposons également des activités de médiation culturelle, ainsi que des cours d’initiation au fléché.

Les thématiques que nous couvrons sont aussi riches que variées: danses, costumes, musiques traditionnelles du Québec et du monde entier, savoir-faire artisanaux, coutumes et légendes populaires.

Jusqu’à aujourd’hui, nos expositions ont rencontré un franc succès : plus de 20.000 personnes ont visité Montréal, capitale de la Fourrure, au Hall d’honneur de l’hôtel de Ville de Montréal en 2015. Les expositions Le fléché au bout des doigts et Masques, cotillons et envoûtement ont été présentées dans 5 différents lieux de diffusion et leurs portes ont été ouvertes au public pendant plus de 200 jours.

Notre objectif est de préserver notre patrimoine vivant et surtout de le partager avec vous, avec tous, car ce sont “les gens” qui lui ont donné vie, et c’est à eux qu’il revient de droit. Comme le disait Marius Barbeau, le patrimoine vivant est le berceau de notre identité, “l’âme d’un peuple qui s’exprime à travers ses danses, ses chants, sa musique [et son savoir-faire traditionnel.]”.

Alors, vous embarquez avec nous ?

 

Autres façons d’aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez toujours passer le message autour de vous ! Parlez-en à votre famille et vos amis, partagez sur les réseaux sociaux ! Vous pouvez aussi envoyez des courriels avec le lien vers notre page Indiegogo.

 

Le Centre Marius Barbeau vous remercie par avance de votre précieuse contribution !
