En soutenant le CMB vous courez aussi la chance de gagner de beaux cadeaux pour le temps des fêtes. Pour chaque don, vous serez récompensés : reproductions des collections du CMB sur cartes postales, tasses imprimées aux motifs du fléché, cours d’initiation au fléché gratuits, entre autres… Les plus chanceux pourraient même repartir avec une toile originale représentant un mariage traditionnel québécois !Il n’y a pas de petit don ! Chaque geste compte. Le Centre Marius Barbeau a besoin de vous et nous vous en serons éternellement reconnaissants.L’impact de nos projetsDepuis 2012, le CMB se consacre à la conception, la réalisation et la mise en marché d’expositions itinérantes en lien avec ses collections. Nous proposons également des activités de médiation culturelle, ainsi que des cours d’initiation au fléché.Les thématiques que nous couvrons sont aussi riches que variées: danses, costumes, musiques traditionnelles du Québec et du monde entier, savoir-faire artisanaux, coutumes et légendes populaires.Jusqu’à aujourd’hui, nos expositions ont rencontré un franc succès : plus de 20.000 personnes ont visité Montréal, capitale de la Fourrure, au Hall d’honneur de l’hôtel de Ville de Montréal en 2015. Les expositions Le fléché au bout des doigts et Masques, cotillons et envoûtement ont été présentées dans 5 différents lieux de diffusion et leurs portes ont été ouvertes au public pendant plus de 200 jours.Notre objectif est de préserver notre patrimoine vivant et surtout de le partager avec vous, avec tous, car ce sont “les gens” qui lui ont donné vie, et c’est à eux qu’il revient de droit. Comme le disait Marius Barbeau, le patrimoine vivant est le berceau de notre identité, “l’âme d’un peuple qui s’exprime à travers ses danses, ses chants, sa musique [et son savoir-faire traditionnel.]”.Alors, vous embarquez avec nous ? Autres façons d’aiderSi vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez toujours passer le message autour de vous ! Parlez-en à votre famille et vos amis, partagez sur les réseaux sociaux ! Vous pouvez aussi envoyez des courriels avec le lien vers notre page Indiegogo. Le Centre Marius Barbeau vous remercie par avance de votre précieuse contribution !

story:
Short Summary

We in URN® have felt extremely blessed by our fans over the span of our seventeen-year career as music is something that sustains us as people, and it allows to feel and express our personalities and allow us to connect with others that we might not be able to do otherwise.   Many of our fans have given us amazing feedback about our recent videos for some of our songs, expressing their appreciation for what some say is becoming a lost art form, and that they would like to see us produce more.

It is our mission statement in URN to provide our fans with the best possible products and experience when sharing in our music.    So we have been presented an incredible opportunity to raise the level of our production by working with Emmy Nominated make-up and special effects artist Cleve Hall, who many know from his own reality show MONSTER MAN on the SyFy Network. Besides creating FX for films, Mr Hall has worked with bands like KISS, Alice Cooper, Marilyn Manson, Insane Clown Posse, Tenaceous D, and DEVO, who actually wrote a song about him!

Seeking the creative opportunities available working with independent filmmakers and music acts, Mr. Hall has expressed a desire to produce/film a promotional video for our song "Black Widow" from our Epiphany album and we will be filming on location in Florida in April 2017.  

What We Need & What You Get

As one can expect, when working with the caliber and talent of an artist known world wide for 40 years of creating the fantastic, the end result of the product will be far superior to all previous releases.   Some great feedback we received from fans is they would like to us to get even more visual in our story line in our song videos and Mr. Hall has an fantastic vision for how he wishes to achieve this.

With this campaign, we are seeking to help raise funds to defray/cover the cost of the materials that are needed for set construction and costume designs for this production.   This will allow for the vision to come to life as it will be in a dark fantasy-whimsical setting where we weave a tale of misdirected romance.  

For this campaign we have some special perks that for those who make contributions will receive special URN merchandise items with some only available from this campaign such as a collector t-shirt in a commemorative display box!

All proceeds from this campaign will go directly towards the production cost of this video production and for all those who contribute will also get an exclusive invite to a special advance viewing of a "director's cut" of the video before it released worldwide with our media partner High Road Publicity.

The Impact

This video will also open for us additional opportunities to have our music marketed into major television and film productions and enhance our ability to produce another album for 2017 as many fans have indicated they are hoping to see a new one from us soon.

URN has been blessed in our past to have our music appear on major networks such as SyFy Channel, A&E, and Discovery Channel.    The production of this video will allow for us to further develop these relationship and collaborations and in turn, allow us more opportunities to share interactively with you our fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that at this time of year, it is difficult and some people are in a position where they can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can still support us by way of our social media sites:

- Visit our flagship site at www.urncentral.com

- Like us on Facebook:  www.facebook.com/urnband

- Follow us on Twitter:  www.twitter.com/urncentral

- Subscribe to our YouTube Channel (copy and paste link): https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCj4B-fbmHcNtSI...

Thank you so much for all of your support as you are the reason we make our art and music for!

______________


One of the perks we are offering is original mixed media 'URN' paintings and drawings by artist Lydia Burris! 
Check out the details in the perks section!

story:
We are Faeland, a folk band from Bristol writing heart-achingly beautiful music. We write songs to warm you up. Songs to make you melt a little.  Songs that pick you up and envelop you in a musical ear hug. We love creating music and sharing these good feelings. We have played many gigs and festivals and reached people through music in our professional and musical lives. We now want to bring our gifts together to record one very special album. 
 

 

This is not just another folk record.

We will be recording the album with the finest of Bristol's musicians. These recordings will then be flown to LA to receive production magic by cutting-edge virtual reality sound designer and producer John Hendicott. This is going to be a unique and beautiful creation and we cannot wait to make it happen. 

To make it, we need your help. To cover all basic costs of manufacturing and to pay all those involved fairly we need to raise a minimum of £7,000. The way crowdfunding works is perfect for this project. We are inviting you to pre-order the CD and choose from a number of our special gifts in return for your contribution.  Once ordered you'll be kept  up-to-date with our creative processes and progress, getting to share in the journey as much or as little as you wish. 

 

 

It's a community thing 

By using a crowd-funding website such as Indiegogo , the power is put in the hands of us artists. It's empowering, enabling us to be completely independent and taking away any reliance away on big business.  "Indiegogo challenges the top-down model by affording artists the opportunity to make their case directly to the public. It's profoundly empowering." Tanya Shaffer, Campaigner


The Music

Those who already know the music have said it's like a balm for the soul. A typical example is a recent Shambala Festival, when one fan came to us after the show saying "Thank you. I came here feeling broken and your music has just put me back together." We know the world needs music like this. We believe the world needs music that people can really connect with. Other reviews:

"Faeland delight with their ethereal vocals and lilting melodies...their soothing songs will bring a warm glow to even the most jaded hearts." - Tim Cant, Writer for Future Publishing, UK. 

"Listening to your songs..amazing song-writing! Your song's always 'hit' me." - Amita O'Toole, Author

You can hear some example of our songs  in this EP written and recorded by Faeland members Beccy Elder and Jacob Morrison. https://beccyelder.bandcamp.com/

And here's a recent remix by Bradley La. https://soundcloud.com/bradley-la/find-me

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of £7,000 in order to pay everyone involved and cover all basic costs. Your money will go directly to the musicians, artists and all those involved in this creative project. If we go over our target then we can print more copies of the album, pay ourselves for time spent on the project, cover extra unforeseen costs and give the music an extra PR boost.  Everyone is lined up and ready to go and it breaks down as follows:

  • Musicians' fees £1,000+ - We have some seriously talented musicians ready to go and rehearsals have already started. 
  • Recording £2,000 - We'll be recording with one of Bristol's most well-known sound engineers, Ben Capp, in the heart of Bristol. 
  • Production £2,500 - Once the songs are recorded they will fly to Los Angeles where extra magic will happen thanks to sound designer/producer John Hendicott. 
  • Mastering £500 - The songs will be made to sound great on any speaker system.
  • Artwork £100 - Artist Jen Howarth will be producing original designs inspired by the songs.
  • Manufacturing £1,000 - For the CDs to be made into CDs! Printing, pressing, costs of cases and all other materials used. We're going for a suave eco-friendly cardboard design. Funds will also contribute to covering costs of honouring all gifts or "perks" offered on this website by us. 
  • PR £250 - After so much love and effort going into this we want to get the music out there. So we will be starting by giving the album its first PR boost. 

 

What will people who contribute get in return?

Choose from a range of special gifts in return for your contribution. You can read about each gift to the right of this text. They range from a freshly-pressed signed copy of our album to exclusive bonus gifts such as an invitation to our VIP party or having us perform in your very own home.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

If we don't reach our financial goal then the money will still contribute to the recording of an album. We will still go into the studio. It will be made with a more simplistic process and will take years to finance but it'll still happen, we love making music too much for anything to stop this from happening. 


 

The Impact

Those who already love our music say that it's the heart of the songs, the feel of the words and music, that they value most when they're listening. We believe the world needs this kind of music and it makes us very happy to be able to give this to people. The impact will be different for each individual person who listens to the songs.

 

Risks & Challenges

Undoubtedly with a creative project such as this we may come across some risks and challenges. As professionals who have been working in music and running our own businesses for over 10 years we have no doubt that we can work creatively and effectively to overcome any hurdles which may come in our way.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions to this campaign don't have to be financial. Getting the word out there is one of the most important ways that you can help. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out there (these are located in the toolbar next to the campaign's pitch image and video).

Thank you!

 

 

Who Are Faeland?!

Faeland is comprised of a number of Bristol's finest folk musicians, with singer-songwriter Beccy Elder and guitarist/multi-instrumentalist Jacob Morrison at its songwriting musical core. 

Beccy Elder grew up surrounded by the sounds of 60s singer-songwriters such as Joni Mitchell, John Lennon and Bob Dylan. This music made it into her veins. By the time the house had a piano Beccy was primed for song-writing, creating music on a daily basis from the age of 8. Since graduating with a Commercial Music degree in London (2007) Beccy has become a published songwriter (Logical Publishing) and performs her original music in and around the South West. Beccy has played for (violin, vocals, piano, guitar) a number of signed and independent songwriters including Emily Teague, Padma (Just Music) and Rebecca Cant.

Jacob Morrison plays guitar, ukulele, banjo and mandolin. This multi-instrumentalist studied Popular & World Musics at Leeds University, before moving to Bristol to delight audiences with 8-piece acoustic band Pindrop. He went on to play and record with Ilya (Virgin Records) and Western Swing band Shinbone (Eddy Jay, Fiona Barrow, Paul Bradley, Stu Barker), as well as gaining a reputation for adding his unique embellishments to singer-songwriters' material, working with Emily Teague, Samantha Marais, Bex Baxter and Faeland singer Beccy Elder. Jacob regularly appears at Bristol's top music venues, including St George's and Colston Hall, and has shared the stage with Seth Lakeman, Polly Paulusma, and Oh Wander's Jose Vanders.

Beccy Elder and Jacob Morrison met in a music-filled room at Bristol's infamous "heart house" and have been collaborating ever since. This musical partnership quickly became a success seeing them play sell out gigs in Bristol as well as at festivals such as Shambala and Sark Folk Festival. They are very excited about recording their first album together.

story:
"The Singer"

Hi! Grizél here. I'm (very soon!) releasing an album that I'm really proud of, and I'm really looking forward to sharing it with you all. The album is rooted in Americana and Soul, and follows the journey of a young twenty-something Latina woman, as she searches for meaning and substance and ultimately finds it in the connection with those around her. 

My hope is that this album helps you experience something within yourself-- maybe you'll laugh; maybe you'll cry. Maybe your heart will leap with joy. And maybe it will ache with sadness. And hey, maybe your experience is not life changing at all; you just simply enjoy the sounds for the sounds that they are. I see beauty in and welcome all of it.

A Little About Me...

I am from a small town in the beautiful Appalachian Mountains, called Johnson City, TN. Johnson City is home for me, and it is where I learned my love for the violin, singing, learning, playing, and writing. And since you asked, I also love playing volleyball. And animals. And when I laugh, most people cannot tell if I am laughing or crying. Because they sound almost exactly the same.

By day, I am a mental health therapist. And by night, I am singing, writing, and creating songs of the soul- both of others and myself. This lifestyle-- being a singer/songwriter therapist-- unfortunately means that I don't have a lot of extra cash lying around. So I'm asking if you would help make this dream become a reality. You will not be disappointed!

What I Need & What you Get

So I am in need of 8,000 dollars, y'all. I know. I dislike typing it as much as you probably dislike reading it. I have been raising most of it on my own through social media, but I think it is time to take a bigger step.

Where does the money go? All of the money goes toward the work that has been done, is still being done, and that will be done. That's vague. I know. Let me break it down for you.

The album has actually already been recorded by my producer, Mitch Dane. But, until I get the 8k, I will not be able to put that album into your hands. What I am trying to say is that producing the album takes a lot of hard work for my producer friend, Mitch. And until I can get it to him, I don't get to put the album on the iTunes, the Spotify, or the Wal-Mart. Catch my drift?  This is the BIG GOAL.

So, throughout this fundraiser, I'm hoping to incentivize you all with free giveaways, song covers, and other fun promotions. I really want everyone to be involved in this process as much as possible!

Why Me?

Yeah. I ask myself this question all the time too. Why would you give money to a girl you may hardly or not at all know? What makes her so different from the millions of other aspiring songwriters out there?

Valid question. I guess the best way for me to answer this is that- I am ready.

I am ready to get my stuff out there. I am ready to be vulnerable. I am ready to experience rejection. I am ready to experience life. I am ready to allow others into my story. I am ready for others to hear the stories that have touched my soul. I am ready for others to hear the amazing musicians that were part of this album.  I am ready for others to experience the excellence that is Mitch Dane. I am ready to be critiqued. I am ready to grow. I am ready to experience fullness in this thing called creativity.

That's it. I'm ready. I know my legs are ready to run. I know my mind is determined. I know my lungs are in good condition. But to finish well in this race, I'll need proper shoes. And having a few cheerleaders along the way would be nice. 

That's where you come in.

This is not about “making it.” This is about experiencing the beauty that comes with creating music.

You all are the only way I can do this to my full potential.

Risks & Challenges

Hopefully you have gained an understanding of what the goal is, and how I am striving to meet those goals. I am aware that there are definite hurdles and obstacles that are standing in my way-money being the biggest challenge.

I've invested some of my own money in this album. I'm moving out of my one bedroom apartment to live with a friend, so that I can put that future rent money toward this goal. I a, in the process of selling most of my belongings. I have also minimized my grocery list and don't eat anymore (I'M KIDDING. I shop at Aldi's). All of this to say: I've already made some sacrifices of my own, because this process is worth it.

And I want you to be a part of this. You can trust me to carry this effort out to fruition. WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am TOTALLY aware that not everyone can contribute monetarily to this album. Finances are a stressful thing. But money isn't the only way to give. Sharing and spreading the word is something anyone can do! You can check out my Indiegogo page. You can share my work on social media. You can tell your plumber to check out this new up and coming musician you know. Anything and everything helps! So please: Tell all your friends. Tell all your enemies! I'm ready to make this dream happen! Who's with me?

This lifestyle-- being a singer/songwriter therapist-- unfortunately means that I don't have a lot of extra cash lying around. So I'm asking if you would help make this dream become a reality. You will not be disappointed!
What I Need & What you Get
So I am in need of 8,000 dollars, y'all. I know. I dislike typing it as much as you probably dislike reading it. I have been raising most of it on my own through social media, but I think it is time to take a bigger step.
Where does the money go? All of the money goes toward the work that has been done, is still being done, and that will be done. That's vague. I know. Let me break it down for you.
The album has actually already been recorded by my producer, Mitch Dane. But, until I get the 8k, I will not be able to put that album into your hands. What I am trying to say is that producing the album takes a lot of hard work for my producer friend, Mitch. And until I can get it to him, I don't get to put the album on the iTunes, the Spotify, or the Wal-Mart. Catch my drift?  This is the BIG GOAL.
So, throughout this fundraiser, I'm hoping to incentivize you all with free giveaways, song covers, and other fun promotions. I really want everyone to be involved in this process as much as possible!
Why Me?
Yeah. I ask myself this question all the time too. Why would you give money to a girl you may hardly or not at all know? What makes her so different from the millions of other aspiring songwriters out there?
Valid question. I guess the best way for me to answer this is that- I am ready.
I am ready to get my stuff out there. I am ready to be vulnerable. I am ready to experience rejection. I am ready to experience life. I am ready to allow others into my story. I am ready for others to hear the stories that have touched my soul. I am ready for others to hear the amazing musicians that were part of this album.  I am ready for others to experience the excellence that is Mitch Dane. I am ready to be critiqued. I am ready to grow. I am ready to experience fullness in this thing called creativity.
That's it. I'm ready. I know my legs are ready to run. I know my mind is determined. I know my lungs are in good condition. But to finish well in this race, I'll need proper shoes. And having a few cheerleaders along the way would be nice. 
That's where you come in.
This is not about “making it.” This is about experiencing the beauty that comes with creating music.
You all are the only way I can do this to my full potential.
Risks & Challenges
Hopefully you have gained an understanding of what the goal is, and how I am striving to meet those goals. I am aware that there are definite hurdles and obstacles that are standing in my way-money being the biggest challenge.
I've invested some of my own money in this album. I'm moving out of my one bedroom apartment to live with a friend, so that I can put that future rent money toward this goal. I a, in the process of selling most of my belongings. I have also minimized my grocery list and don't eat anymore (I'M KIDDING. I shop at Aldi's). All of this to say: I've already made some sacrifices of my own, because this process is worth it.
And I want you to be a part of this. You can trust me to carry this effort out to fruition. WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER.
Other Ways You Can Help
I am TOTALLY aware that not everyone can contribute monetarily to this album. Finances are a stressful thing. But money isn't the only way to give. Sharing and spreading the word is something anyone can do! You can check out my Indiegogo page. You can share my work on social media. You can tell your plumber to check out this new up and coming musician you know. Anything and everything helps! So please: Tell all your friends. Tell all your enemies! I'm ready to make this dream happen! Who's with me?

story:
WELCOME TO SINGEN UND SAGEN!

Greetings from Liza Malamut, Stephen Kennedy and Ben David Aronson, the production team for Singen und Sagen: Music for Peace in a Time of War.  We are all professional musicians and graduates of the Eastman School of Music in Rochester, New York.  In addition to being performers and educators, we are all passionate early music lovers.

One of the values we treasure most as musicians is to push ourselves not only to achieve the highest standards of professional excellence, but also to use our talents and passions to give back to our community in ways that only we can.  The concert program we are producing, Singen und Sagen: Music for Peace in a Time of War, is a purely musical expression of our wish for peace and good will within our community and all over the world.  We have chosen the music of Michael Praetorius, renowned German composer of the seventeenth century, as the perfect embodiment of this wish.  The purpose of our campaign is to raise the remainder of the costs of production which we have not yet covered through our independent efforts.

The framework of our program is that of a universal musical sermon during a time of war and strife, based on Praetorius’s interpretation of Martin Luther’s instruction to “singen und sagen,” or “to sing and say.” In the preface to his Polyhymnia Caduceatrix et Panegyrica, Praetorius writes:

“...it is not only appropriate to have a CONCIO, a good sermon, but also in addition the necessary CANTIO, good music and song...It is and remains God’s Word in the thinking of the mind, the singing of the voice, and also in the beating and playing upon instruments.”  

Polyhymnia contains some of the most sophisticated of all German sacred music. The collection’s publication date of 1619, one year after the official beginning of the Thirty Years’ War, adds further poignancy to its lushness, as the subsequent years of strife and famine would decimate the forces needed to perform it in full.

To reflect this, pieces from Polyhymnia will be alternated with selected texts, both uplifting and sorrowful, that reflect this theme.  Nearly four hundred years after its publication, performing such elaborate and joyous music as that of Polyhymnia during times of darkness and despair remains an act of courage and optimism.

Because of the sheer size of the forces needed, Polyhymnia is seldom programmed in modern performances. However, the musical resources of Rochester, New York provide a rare opportunity to bring this special music, and everything it represents, to life.  The Christ Church Schola Cantorum and Consort, under the direction of Stephen Kennedy, is one of Rochester's  great musical and spiritual treasures.  On Saturday afternoon, November 11th 2017, along with students, faculty and alumni from the Eastman School of Music, special guest artists, and wonderful community musicians, the Schola will present a rare, free concert of fully orchestrated works from Polyhymnia.

Polyhymnia requires a full instrumentarium of sackbuts, cornetti, violins, dulcians, viols, and more. This provides a special opportunity for students and community members in the city of Rochester to have a hands-on experience making music that is rarely performed even by professionals.  Prominent musicians in the field of early music will coach and perform alongside student instrumentalists. The concert will be an official event at the American Musicological Society's 2017 meeting, which guarantees a packed audience and exciting publicity.

The concert will make full use of the beautiful Christ Church sanctuary and its stunning Craighead-Saunders organ. The instruments, orchestration, pitch standards, and venue placement of the performance will adhere as closely as possible to Praetorius’s own specifications.

IMPACT

Singen und Sagen will be a fully immersive experience for the music students, Rochester community musicians, and professionals who have chosen to participate. The immediate impact of the project will serve a rough total of 40 individual students and community musicians. These musicians have already begun the hands-on work of immersing themselves in the music of Praetorius and late Renaissance performance practice to attain skills and knowledge they will apply not only to this concert, but also to future projects of their own.

The long-term impact of this project will be much greater, and extends far beyond our desire to give back to the Rochester community with our individual talents. New performing editions of music from Polyhymnia have been made specifically for this event, but the playability of the music is such that the program can be adapted to suit varying musical resources and circumstances. This aspect of the project ensures that the program may be performed again and again, with diverse groups of instrumentalists and singers, and at a variety of venues. The creation of Singen und Sagen will result in a sustainable and flexible program that can be used and enjoyed for the benefit of countless communities — students, amateurs, and professionals — for the foreseeable future.

What We Need & What You Get

Through traditional grant writing and fundraising, we have raised nearly two thirds of the total funds we need to produce Singen und Sagen.  The additional $2,500 we need would be used for three specific purposes:

  1.  Sponsorships and honorariums for guest professionals and volunteer performers.  We want to fully and generously express our gratitude to everyone lending us their time and talents to help bring our program to life.
  2. Various standard production costs, including printing and distribution of complete performing editions to our many participating musicians.
  3. Professional quality recording and video of our performance, to be used as a record of our efforts and to assist with future productions.

We are also offering some exciting musical perks.  A contribution could get you:

  • Your name printed in the official concert program
  • Programs autographed by the performers
  • A high quality video of the concert
  • Handwritten thank you notes
  • CDs featuring members of the Singen und Sagen performance
  • A free trombone (or sackbut!) lesson
  • A memorable outdoor performance by Liza (more details in the "perks" section)

What happens if we don't reach our funding goal?

Even if we do not reach our goal of $2500, the show will go on! Funds will be evenly distributed among the three purposes as described above.  On the other hand, if we exceed our goal, the extra funding will cover extraneous expenses associated with the project, as well as future costs associated with bringing Singen und Sagen to communities across the United States.

Risks & Challenges

Producing any concert of this scale requires a formidable amount of planning, assembling, and coordination of countless moving parts.  This is particularly true of a program composed of such special and unusual elements as Singen und Sagen.  Our work so far has helped us to identify and engage all of our musicians, and to transport and host each of our guest artists.  It has also helped us to cover much of the cost of production for our performing editions.  We have successfully ensured that the concert will proceed, no matter the outcome of our campaign.  We have come very far towards realizing our vision already, thanks to numerous grants and anonymous donors.  We have received contributions through programs sponsored by Early Music America, the American Musicological Society, and the Eastman School of Music.  We are also awaiting results for applications currently under review by additional granting institutions.

Because Singen und Sagen will be an official conference event sponsored by the American Musicological Society, we will not be accepting donations at the door.  That's why we need your help, and we've come up with lots of great incentives to thank YOU for lending a hand and for being a crucial part of our dream.

The additional funds we wish to raise are intended first and foremost to assist with our community service goals: our wish to generously thank everyone who freely gave of their time and talents for our project, despite their asking nothing in return.  Beyond that, remaining funds would be used for any leftover production costs, and to record our concert in the highest attainable audio and video quality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now, but want to help us make Singen und Sagen happen? We would love for you to share this campaign far and wide! The more people who are as excited as we are, the more likely we are to succeed!

Thank you!

Yours truly,

Liza, Stephen, and Ben David

story:
2 Albums Releasing in One Day

It's been 2 years since I, The Hyphenate, have released a studio album, but to make up for it, I'm dropping 2 complete albums in one day.  I constantly make such a variety of music that and have a lot of new songs for both underground hip hop and mainstream hip hop fans. One album will cater more to the mainstream hip hop supporters and the other to the underground hip hop supporters.  What you get is 2 totally different sounding albums that captivate the entire spectrum of hip hop music while at the same time still maintaining the lyrical, insightful, thought provoking, and entertaining lyricism/song-writing you've come to expect from me.  The songs I have lined up for these albums are powerful, insightful, fun, charismatic, and moving.  This is my best work yet and your help on this project is going to attribute to making a great impact on, not just hip hop, but all people across the globe that this music will reach to.  Both albums will release on January 30th, 2018.

How Your Contribution Will Help

Your contribution to this project, no matter the size, will be a HUGE help to my music career and movement. I'm 100% an independent artist and I put all my time, money, effort, and resources into making all of this happen on my own.  Unfortunately I don't have enough to make this album happen on my own in the way it should be done, but with your help, we can do incredible things with this project. Your donations and contributions will help directly with:

●Marketing and PR

●Album Distribution and Placements

●Professionally Mastered Albums

●Professionally Reproduced and Packaged Phsycial CD's of the Albums

●Official Album Merchandise (T-Shirts and More)

●Album Tour

Why This Is Important

My music has been used in high schools, colleges, and universities by students, teachers, and professors in various topical discussions, presentations, and more.  Within my plethora of songs, I always make sure to make a good amount that tackle social issues, history, current world events, and more, and because of that I have received many emails and messages from people across the world who've told me that my music has helped them personally or helped their friends and family.  Whether it's been my fun and entertaining songs that help make their days better, or my deep and emotional songs that others relate to and use and inspiration for their own lives, I'm able to brings art within my music that touches people in a positive way.  My new albums will continue that movement with even more to offer.

What You Get

For helping me finish my albums and starting my tour, every person who donates will receive something by way of the various perks offered. Signed Physical copies of the albums, entrance to the album release part, hand written lyrics from my songs, clothing, merchandise, exclusive collectibles, a guest cameo for you and your friends in one of my music videos. Check out the perks section for more info.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not all of you who support my movement will be able to contribute financially. I understand and will greatly appreciate if you can at least help make noise by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family via facebook, twitter, instagram, email, and more so that maybe others can help make a contribution.  I appreciate all your suport. Let's make history! 
#DoubtMe

story:
Short Summary

Hey! I’m Julie. And I’m Emily. We are the cofounders of Eclectic Comfort.

We started Eclectic Comfort from a desire to bring people together from our community, in our house, listening to and making music together. So we did that. Invited 30 people into our living room and had 5 artists play acoustic sets. No amplification, no overhead lighting. Just the people and the space and the time. That community has continued to grow and develop and we have been so amazed at the talent, creativity and generosity of the people that have been involved. We want to honour that and continue to help musicians and other creatives thrive.

Still with us? Awesome! Our goal is simple: to foster human connection and creative development in our community. We are launching an artist incubator and digital platform to not only showcase their musical talent but also provide support and direction to further their careers:

  • Performance skill development
  • Branding and design
  • Web design and developement
  • Social media content development

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $20,000 in order to fully launch our digital platform and continue to help local artists grow. We know that this is not enough to last us a year - or even half of one - but it is enough for us to create all of our start up content for the first few months and get the word out! Better still, this will help us continue to run community events while we do so. This will also aid us in getting ourselves out there so that we are better positioned to receive grants in the future.

Your Unique Perks

  • Cozy Coffee Mugs
  • Wooden Coasters
  • EC T-Shirts
  • EC Mystery Swag Bag
  • Eclectic Comfort in Your Own Home
  • Kitchen Tunes

Every little bit counts. If we don't reach our total goal, we will use every dollar that comes through towards launching. We appreciate everyone's support and we know that even with a little boost, we will be able to go a long way.

 

The Impact

We are striving to foster human connection and creative development not only in our community but communities around the world. After receiving such positive feedback in Toronto over the past year we have tried the same thing in Denmark, Sweden and France and the response has been overwhelming. Our local community is becoming global. In order to continue to do that, we need some help from you to get started.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Content is a challenge. Businesses big or small have this problem. Once you have an idea, the creation of it requires a vast number of skills to execute. We believe we can overcome this challenge.

We are passionate about the creative industry and the people in our community. Emily is a special effects makeup artist working in film and television who is passionate about art, music and helping other people pursue their dreams. Julie is a musician and video producer for broadcast and online content who is passionate about connecting people to what they need and providing opportunities for creatives to do their best work. Our resident post production supervisor, Andrew Farlow, brings an enormous amount of experience and expertise on both audio and visual effects/editing. With design expertise from Adam Silcox-Vanwyk and cinematography from Justin Yaroski, we are well equipped to create the content required for this endeavour.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We appreciate financial constraints, so if a donation to us is not within your budget, please do not feel pressure! We are just so glad you made it to the end! (Go you!). If you do want to still help, please feel free to share our campaign with your friends and get the word out. Also - send us a message when we are hosting our next event so you can come by and see what all the fuss is about. 

See you soon!

Julie is a musician and video producer for broadcast and online content who is passionate about connecting people to what they need and providing opportunities for creatives to do their best work. With design expertise from Adam Silcox-Vanwyk and cinematography from Justin Yaroski, we are well equipped to create the content required for this endeavour.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
We appreciate financial constraints, so if a donation to us is not within your budget, please do not feel pressure! We are just so glad you made it to the end! (Go you!). If you do want to still help, please feel free to share our campaign with your friends and get the word out. Also - send us a message when we are hosting our next event so you can come by and see what all the fuss is about. 
See you soon!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

In a perfect world, I will reach my targeted goal of $5,000! But, if this isn’t the case and I fall short, this EP will be put on hold until additional funds can make up the difference, even if it takes an additional year or two. I am very determined and believe in my craft! 

To clarify, I created a passion-project cover-EP entitled “Play On” which is available to stream in the above, embedded video (also, here: ) These five songs capture the vibe, emotion, and overall mood of the direction I am heading for with EP 2! With your help, I can bring my original content come to life, with a professional producer I have on board if I reach my goal!

WHY I’M DOING THIS

Recording music has always been a vital and integral part of who I am and how I choose to express myself. Now, I will get the chance to do so professionally, with material I’ve written myself. I have a strong desire to see a full EP of songs come to life, and allow others into an emotional and creative space that I am otherwise very protective over.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU’LL GET

$5,000 is a tight, just slightly over-budgeted sum that will sufficiently fund this entire campaign. I know it is a large amount. Each track will cost about $945, which is $4,725 when multiplied by five. There will also be an additional photoshoot for this project, taxes included, making up the rest of the remaining funds.

Below is the list of perks, which can be found on the right.

$5 - digital copy of EP “”Play On” - five individual cover tracks already recorded, which can be heard in the embedded video above.

$10 - digital copy of the my “Play On” demo EP and a promise that when this next one is fully funded, it will be sent you as well.

$15 - thank you letter, digitally or physically sent (up to you!) (+ all of the above perks included).

$30 - handwritten lyrics and photo paper copies of my new single covers from “Play On” (+ all of the above perks included).

$80 - a half-hour online concert with you as my audience (via Skype or FaceTime!) (+ all of the above perks included). 

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

The most challenging part of being an independent artist is almost always finding tangible methods of funding. I understand that not everybody can financially contribute to this campaign, which is why it would still help me out a lot if you shared this campaign through social media & by word of mouth! Thank you in advance.
